2. CloudFront - Global CDN, static assets fast delivery
3. Application Load Balancer - Traffic distribute ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ, SSL termination
4. EC2 Auto Scaling - Traffic ‡¶Ö‡¶®‡ßÅ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßÄ servers add/remove
5. RDS PostgreSQL - Managed database, automatic backups
6. ElastiCache Redis - Managed Redis cluster, high availability
7. S3 - Object storage, unlimited scalability
Auto Scaling Configuration


# Auto Scaling Group configuration (Infrastructure as Code)


AutoScalingGroup:
  MinSize: 2                    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Minimum 2 instances always (HA)
  MaxSize: 10                   # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Maximum capacity limit
  DesiredCapacity: 3            # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Normal load ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø 3 instances
  
  HealthCheckType: ELB          # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Load balancer health check use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
  HealthCheckGracePeriod: 300   # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: 5 minutes warm-up time
  
  # Scaling Policies
  ScaleUpPolicy:
    MetricName: CPUUtilization
    Threshold: 70               # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: CPU > 70% ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá scale up
    ScalingAdjustment: +2       # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: 2 instances add ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    Cooldown: 300               # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: 5 minutes wait before next scaling
  
  ScaleDownPolicy:
    MetricName: CPUUtilization
    Threshold: 30               # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: CPU < 30% ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá scale down
    ScalingAdjustment: -1       # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: 1 instance remove ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    Cooldown: 600               # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: 10 minutes wait (conservative)
Auto Scaling automatically servers add/remove ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá traffic based on:
* Scale Up - CPU 70% cross ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá 2 servers add ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
* Scale Down - CPU 30% ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶ö‡ßá ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá 1 server remove ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
* Minimum 2 - High availability ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø always 2 servers minimum
* Maximum 10 - Cost control ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø maximum limit
* Cooldown - Frequent scaling prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø wait period
6. SECURITY ARCHITECTURE
6.1 Defense in Depth Strategy
The platform implements multiple layers of security controls ensuring that if one layer is compromised, additional layers provide continued protection.
Security Layers Diagram
  

Defense in Depth ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßá multiple security layers:
1. Perimeter - ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá attacks block ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (DDoS, WAF)
2. Network - Server level encryption, private networks
3. Application - Code level security (validation, authentication)
4. Data - Stored data encrypt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ, passwords hash ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
5. Monitoring - Attacks detect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ, alert ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ layer breach ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ì ‡¶Ö‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø layers protect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá‡•§
6.2 Authentication & Authorization
JWT-Based API Authentication


<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/JwtAuthentication.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Firebase\JWT\JWT;
use Firebase\JWT\Key;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class JwtAuthentication
{
    /**
     * JWT Authentication Middleware
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: API requests authenticate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
     * Flow: Token verify ‚Üí User load ‚Üí Continue request
     */
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next)
    {
        // Step 1: Extract token from Authorization header
        // Format: "Bearer {token}"
        $token = $request->bearerToken();
        
        if (!$token) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Authorization token required',
            ], 401);
        }
        
        try {
            // Step 2: Verify and decode JWT token
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Token valid ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡¶æ check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ, expired ‡¶®‡¶æ
            $decoded = JWT::decode(
                $token,
                new Key(config('app.jwt_secret'), 'HS256')
            );
            
            // Step 3: Extract user ID from token payload
            $userId = $decoded->sub;  // 'sub' = subject (user ID)
            
            // Step 4: Load user from database
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Current user information request ‡¶è available ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
            $user = User::find($userId);
            
            if (!$user) {
                return response()->json([
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'User not found',
                ], 401);
            }
            
            // Step 5: Check if user is active
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Suspended users access ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
            if ($user->status !== 'active') {
                return response()->json([
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'Account suspended',
                ], 403);
            }
            
            // Step 6: Set authenticated user in request
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Controllers ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá auth()->user() ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá access ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
            auth()->setUser($user);
            
            // Step 7: Continue to next middleware/controller
            return $next($request);
            
        } catch (\Firebase\JWT\ExpiredException $e) {
            // Token expired
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Token expired',
            ], 401);
            
        } catch (\Firebase\JWT\SignatureInvalidException $e) {
            // Token signature invalid (tampered)
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Invalid token signature',
            ], 401);
            
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            // Any other JWT error
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Invalid token',
            ], 401);
        }
    }
}


Generating JWT Tokens
<?php
// app/Services/Auth/JwtService.php


namespace App\Services\Auth;


use Firebase\JWT\JWT;
use App\Models\User;
use Carbon\Carbon;


class JwtService
{
    /**
     * Generate JWT access token
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Login ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶™‡¶∞ token generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     * Payload: User ID, role, expiration
     */
    public function generateAccessToken(User $user): string
    {
        $payload = [
            // Registered claims (standard JWT fields)
            'iss' => config('app.url'),           // Issuer
            'sub' => $user->id,                   // Subject (user ID)
            'iat' => Carbon::now()->timestamp,    // Issued at
            'exp' => Carbon::now()->addMinutes(60)->timestamp,  // Expires in 1 hour
            
            // Custom claims
            'role' => $user->role,
            'email' => $user->email,
        ];
        
        return JWT::encode($payload, config('app.jwt_secret'), 'HS256');
    }
    
    /**
     * Generate refresh token
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Access token expire ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá new token ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
     * Longer expiration (7 days)
     */
    public function generateRefreshToken(User $user): string
    {
        $payload = [
            'iss' => config('app.url'),
            'sub' => $user->id,
            'iat' => Carbon::now()->timestamp,
            'exp' => Carbon::now()->addDays(7)->timestamp,  // 7 days
            'type' => 'refresh',  // Mark as refresh token
        ];
        
        return JWT::encode($payload, config('app.jwt_secret'), 'HS256');
    }
    
    /**
     * Refresh access token using refresh token
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Access token expire ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá re-login ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá new token ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
     */
    public function refreshAccessToken(string $refreshToken): array
    {
        try {
            $decoded = JWT::decode(
                $refreshToken,
                new Key(config('app.jwt_secret'), 'HS256')
            );
            
            // Verify it's a refresh token
            if (!isset($decoded->type) || $decoded->type !== 'refresh') {
                throw new \Exception('Invalid refresh token');
            }
            
            $user = User::findOrFail($decoded->sub);
            
            return [
                'access_token' => $this->generateAccessToken($user),
                'refresh_token' => $this->generateRefreshToken($user),
                'expires_in' => 3600,  // 1 hour in seconds
            ];
            
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            throw new \Exception('Invalid or expired refresh token');
        }
    }
}


JWT Authentication flow:
1. Login - User credentials verify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá access + refresh token generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
2. API Requests - ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶ü‡¶æ request ‡¶è Authorization header ‡¶è token ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã
3. Token Verification - Middleware token verify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá user identity confirm ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
4. Token Expiry - Access token 1 hour ‡¶™‡¶∞ expire ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º
5. Refresh - Refresh token use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® access token ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ (re-login ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá)
Benefits:
* Stateless authentication (server session ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶®‡¶æ)
* Scalable (multiple servers easily)
* Secure (signed, can't be tampered)
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/CheckRole.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class CheckRole
{
    /**
     * Check if authenticated user has required role
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Different endpoints different roles ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
     * Example: Admin endpoints ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ admins access ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
     */
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next, ...$roles)
    {
        // Get authenticated user
        $user = auth()->user();
        
        // Check if user authenticated
        if (!$user) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Unauthenticated',
            ], 401);
        }
        
        // Check if user has required role
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Unauthorized access prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        if (!in_array($user->role, $roles)) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Insufficient permissions',
            ], 403);
        }
        
        return $next($request);
    }
}


// Usage in routes:
// routes/api.php


Route::middleware(['auth:jwt', 'role:admin,super_admin'])->group(function () {
    // Admin-only routes
    Route::get('/admin/dashboard', [AdminController::class, 'dashboard']);
    Route::post('/admin/vendors/{id}/approve', [VendorController::class, 'approve']);
});


Route::middleware(['auth:jwt', 'role:vendor'])->group(function () {
    // Vendor-only routes
    Route::get('/vendor/products', [VendorProductController::class, 'index']);
    Route::post('/vendor/products', [VendorProductController::class, 'store']);
});


Route::middleware(['auth:jwt', 'role:customer'])->group(function () {
    // Customer-only routes
    Route::post('/orders', [OrderController::class, 'store']);
    Route::get('/orders/{id}', [OrderController::class, 'show']);
});
Resource-Level Authorization


<?php
// app/Policies/ProductPolicy.php


namespace App\Policies;


use App\Models\User;
use App\Models\Product;


class ProductPolicy
{
    /**
     * Determine if user can update product
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Vendors ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶ú‡ßá‡¶∞ products edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
     * Admins ‡¶∏‡¶¨ products edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
     */
    public function update(User $user, Product $product): bool
    {
        // Admin can update any product
        if ($user->isAdmin()) {
            return true;
        }
        
        // Vendor can only update their own products
        if ($user->isVendor()) {
            return $product->vendor_id === $user->vendor->id;
        }
        
        return false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Determine if user can delete product
     */
    public function delete(User $user, Product $product): bool
    {
        // Similar logic as update
        if ($user->isAdmin()) {
            return true;
        }
        
        if ($user->isVendor()) {
            // Vendors can only delete products with no orders
            return $product->vendor_id === $user->vendor->id 
                && $product->orderItems()->count() === 0;
        }
        
        return false;
    }
}


// Usage in Controller:
public function update(Request $request, Product $product)
{
    // Authorize action
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: User permission ‡¶Ü‡¶õ‡ßá ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡¶æ check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    $this->authorize('update', $product);
    
    // If authorized, proceed with update
    $product->update($request->validated());
    
    return response()->json([
        'success' => true,
        'data' => new ProductResource($product),
    ]);
}
RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) ‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶® levels ‡¶è ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶ú ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:
1. Authentication - User ‡¶ï‡ßá? (JWT token verify)
2. Role Check - User ‡¶è‡¶∞ role ‡¶ï‡ßÄ? (customer/vendor/admin)
3. Resource Authorization - User ‡¶è‡¶á specific resource access ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá?
Example scenario:
* Customer ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶ú‡ßá‡¶∞ orders ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
* Vendor ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶ú‡ßá‡¶∞ products edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
* Admin ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶õ‡ßÅ access ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
6.3 Input Validation & Sanitization
Request Validation
<?php
// app/Http/Requests/Product/CreateProductRequest.php


namespace App\Http\Requests\Product;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Http\FormRequest;
use Illuminate\Validation\Rule;


class CreateProductRequest extends FormRequest
{
    /**
     * Comprehensive input validation
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Invalid/malicious data reject ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     * SQL injection, XSS attacks prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    public function rules(): array
    {
        return [
            // Basic fields with strict validation
            'name' => [
                'required',
                'string',
                'min:3',
                'max:255',
                'regex:/^[\pL\s\-0-9]+$/u',  // Only letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens
            ],
            
            'slug' => [
                'required',
                'string',
                'regex:/^[a-z0-9]+(?:-[a-z0-9]+)*$/',  // URL-friendly
                Rule::unique('products', 'slug'),
            ],
            
            'sku' => [
                'required',
                'string',
                'alpha_num',
                'max:50',
                Rule::unique('products', 'sku')->where(function ($query) {
                    return $query->where('vendor_id', auth()->user()->vendor->id);
                }),
            ],
            
            'category_id' => [
                'required',
                'integer',
                'exists:categories,id',
            ],
            
            // Description with HTML sanitization
            'description' => [
                'required',
                'string',
                'min:50',
                'max:10000',
            ],
            
            // Price validation
            'regular_price' => [
                'required',
                'numeric',
                'min:0',
                'max:999999.99',
                'regex:/^\d+(\.\d{1,2})?$/',  // Max 2 decimal places
            ],
            
            'sale_price' => [
                'nullable',
                'numeric',
                'min:0',
                'lt:regular_price',  // Less than regular price
                'regex:/^\d+(\.\d{1,2})?$/',
            ],
            
            // Stock validation
            'stock_quantity' => [
                'required_if:type,simple',
                'integer',
                'min:0',
                'max:999999',
            ],
            
            'low_stock_threshold' => [
                'nullable',
                'integer',
                'min:0',
                'max:1000',
            ],
            
            // Image validation
            'images' => [
                'required',
                'array',
                'min:1',
                'max:5',
            ],
            
            'images.*' => [
                'required',
                'image',
                'mimes:jpeg,jpg,png,webp',
                'max:5120',  // 5MB
                'dimensions:min_width=300,min_height=300,max_width=5000,max_height=5000',
            ],
        ];
    }
    
    /**
     * Custom validation messages
     */
    public function messages(): array
    {
        return [
            'name.regex' => 'Product name can only contain letters, numbers, spaces and hyphens',
            'slug.regex' => 'Slug must be URL-friendly (lowercase, hyphens only)',
            'sku.alpha_num' => 'SKU must contain only letters and numbers',
            'sale_price.lt' => 'Sale price must be less than regular price',
            'images.*.mimes' => 'Images must be JPEG, JPG, PNG or WebP format',
            'images.*.max' => 'Each image must not exceed 5MB',
        ];
    }
    
    /**
     * Sanitize input after validation
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: XSS attacks prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    protected function passedValidation()
    {
        // Sanitize HTML in description
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Malicious scripts remove ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ but safe HTML ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ
        $this->merge([
            'description' => $this->sanitizeHtml($this->description),
            'name' => strip_tags($this->name),
            'slug' => strtolower($this->slug),
        ]);
    }
    
    /**
     * Sanitize HTML content
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Safe HTML tags allow ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ, dangerous tags remove ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    private function sanitizeHtml(string $html): string
    {
        // Allowed tags for product description
        $allowedTags = '<p><br><strong><em><u><ul><ol><li><h2><h3><h4>';
        
        // Strip all tags except allowed ones
        $cleaned = strip_tags($html, $allowedTags);
        
        // Remove javascript: and other dangerous protocols
        $cleaned = preg_replace('/javascript:/i', '', $cleaned);
        $cleaned = preg_replace('/on\w+\s*=/i', '', $cleaned);  // Remove onload=, onclick=, etc.
        
        return $cleaned;
    }
}
Input Validation multiple layers:
1. Type Validation - Correct data type (string/integer/numeric)
2. Format Validation - Regex pattern match (email, phone, URL)
3. Range Validation - Min/max values, length limits
4. Business Rules - Sale price < regular price
5. Sanitization - Dangerous characters/scripts remove ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Benefits:
* SQL Injection prevent (parameterized queries + validation)
* XSS prevent (HTML sanitization)
* Data integrity maintain ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
* Better error messages users ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
6.4 Encryption & Hashing
Password Hashing
<?php
// app/Models/User.php


namespace App\Models;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Auth\User as Authenticatable;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Hash;


class User extends Authenticatable
{
    /**
     * Password automatically hashed before saving
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Plain text passwords ‡¶ï‡¶ñ‡¶®‡ßã store ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
     * Bcrypt: Slow hashing algorithm (brute force resist ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø)
     */
    protected static function boot()
    {
        parent::boot();
        
        static::creating(function ($user) {
            if ($user->password) {
                $user->password = Hash::make($user->password);
            }
        });
        
        static::updating(function ($user) {
            if ($user->isDirty('password')) {
                $user->password = Hash::make($user->password);
            }
        });
    }
    
    /**
     * Verify password
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Login ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶Ø‡¶º password check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    public function verifyPassword(string $password): bool
    {
        return Hash::check($password, $this->password);
    }
}


// config/hashing.php
return [
    'driver' => 'bcrypt',
    'bcrypt' => [
        'rounds' => 12,  // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Higher rounds = slower = more secure
        // Cost of 12 = ~300ms to hash (good balance)
    ],
];

Bangla Explanation:

Password Hashing ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶® ‡¶è‡¶§ important:

  • One-way function - Hash ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá original password ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ impossible
  • Salt included - Same password different hash produce ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
  • Slow by design - Brute force attacks slow ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
  • Adaptive - Future ‡¶è rounds ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶°‡¶º‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá stronger ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º

Example:

Plain: "mypassword123"
Hashed: "$2y$12$KlBCG7vN6zHr8yF.5YWj7OqKq3WjP3xV..."
Database breach ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ì passwords safe ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶¨‡ßá‡•§
Sensitive Data Encryption
<?php
// app/Models/VendorBankDetails.php


namespace App\Models;


use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Crypt;


class VendorBankDetails extends Model
{
    /**
     * Fields that should be encrypted
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Bank account numbers, tax IDs sensitive data
     */
    protected $encrypted = [
        'account_number',
        'routing_number',
        'tax_id',
    ];
    
    /**
     * Automatically encrypt when setting
     */
    public function setAttribute($key, $value)
    {
        if (in_array($key, $this->encrypted) && $value !== null) {
            $value = Crypt::encryptString($value);
        }
        
        return parent::setAttribute($key, $value);
    }
    
    /**
     * Automatically decrypt when getting
     */
    public function getAttribute($key)
    {
        $value = parent::getAttribute($key);
        
        if (in_array($key, $this->encrypted) && $value !== null) {
            try {
                return Crypt::decryptString($value);
            } catch (\Exception $e) {
                // If decryption fails, return null
                return null;
            }
        }
        
        return $value;
    }
    
    /**
     * Get masked account number for display
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Full number ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã dangerous, last 4 digits safe
     */
    public function getMaskedAccountNumber(): string
    {
        $fullNumber = $this->account_number;
        
        if (!$fullNumber) {
            return '****';
        }
        
        // Show only last 4 digits
        return '****' . substr($fullNumber, -4);
    }
}


// Usage:
$bankDetails = new VendorBankDetails();
$bankDetails->account_number = '1234567890';  // Stored encrypted
$bankDetails->save();


// Reading
echo $bankDetails->account_number;  // "1234567890" (decrypted)
echo $bankDetails->getMaskedAccountNumber();  // "****7890" (safe to display)
Encryption Key Management
bash
# .env file


# Application encryption key (generated by artisan)
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Data encrypt/decrypt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
APP_KEY=base64:RANDOM_32_BYTE_STRING_HERE


# Key rotation strategy:
# 1. Generate new key: php artisan key:generate --show
# 2. Store old key: APP_KEY_OLD=old_key_here
# 3. Update to new key: APP_KEY=new_key_here
# 4. Re-encrypt data with new key (migration script)
# 5. Remove old key after successful migration


Encryption at Rest:
1. AES-256 - Industry standard symmetric encryption
2. Application Key - Laravel automatic manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
3. Transparent - Model level encryption, application code simple
4. Key Rotation - Periodically key change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ security ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
Benefits:
* Database backup leak ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ì sensitive data safe
* Encryption key ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ store ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (not in backup)
* Compliance requirements meet ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (PCI DSS, GDPR)
6.5 Security Headers
Security Middleware
<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/SecurityHeaders.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class SecurityHeaders
{
    /**
     * Add security headers to all responses
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Browser-level security features enable ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next)
    {
        $response = $next($request);
        
        // X-Frame-Options: Clickjacking prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Site iframe ‡¶è embed ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá fake UI ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        $response->headers->set('X-Frame-Options', 'SAMEORIGIN');
        
        // X-Content-Type-Options: MIME sniffing attacks prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Browser file type guess ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá declared type use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
        $response->headers->set('X-Content-Type-Options', 'nosniff');
        
        // X-XSS-Protection: Browser XSS filter enable ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Basic XSS attacks browser level ‡¶è block ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        $response->headers->set('X-XSS-Protection', '1; mode=block');
        
        // Strict-Transport-Security: HTTPS enforce ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Browser ‡¶∏‡¶¨‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶Ø‡¶º HTTPS use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá, HTTP ‡¶®‡¶æ
        if ($request->secure()) {
            $response->headers->set(
                'Strict-Transport-Security',
                'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains'  // 1 year
            );
        }
        
        // Content-Security-Policy: Resource loading restrict ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Malicious scripts external sources ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá load ‡¶π‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
        $csp = implode('; ', [
            "default-src 'self'",
            "script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com",
            "style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'",
            "img-src 'self' data: https:",
            "font-src 'self' data:",
            "connect-src 'self' https://api.stripe.com",
            "frame-ancestors 'self'",
            "base-uri 'self'",
            "form-action 'self'",
        ]);
        $response->headers->set('Content-Security-Policy', $csp);
        
        // Referrer-Policy: Referrer information control ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Privacy - ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶è‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá ‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        $response->headers->set('Referrer-Policy', 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin');
        
        // Permissions-Policy: Browser features disable ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Unnecessary features off ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ (microphone, camera)
        $response->headers->set('Permissions-Policy', 'geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()');
        
        return $response;
    }
}
Security Headers browser ‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶¨‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶ï‡ßÄ‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá content handle ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá:
1. X-Frame-Options - Clickjacking prevent (iframe block)
2. X-XSS-Protection - Basic XSS filter enable
3. HSTS - Always HTTPS enforce ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
4. CSP - Script/style sources whitelist ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
5. Referrer-Policy - Privacy maintain ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Example attack ‡¶Ø‡¶æ prevent ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá:
* Attacker site ‡¶§‡ßã‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶∞ platform iframe ‡¶è show ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
* External scripts inject ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
* HTTP downgrade attacks ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶ú ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
6.6 Rate Limiting
Rate Limit Configuration
<?php
// app/Http/Kernel.php


protected $middlewareGroups = [
    'api' => [
        'throttle:api',  // API rate limiting
        \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\SubstituteBindings::class,
    ],
];


protected $middlewareAliases = [
    'throttle' => \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\ThrottleRequests::class,
];


// config/rate-limiting.php


return [
    // Public API endpoints (unauthenticated)
    'api' => [
        'limit' => 60,           // 60 requests
        'period' => 1,           // per 1 minute
        'by' => 'ip',           // per IP address
    ],
    
    // Authenticated API endpoints
    'api_authenticated' => [
        'limit' => 100,          // 100 requests
        'period' => 1,           // per 1 minute
        'by' => 'user',         // per user
    ],
    
    // Authentication endpoints (login, register)
    'auth' => [
        'limit' => 5,            // 5 attempts
        'period' => 15,          // per 15 minutes
        'by' => 'ip',
    ],
    
    // Heavy operations (reports, exports)
    'heavy' => [
        'limit' => 10,           // 10 requests
        'period' => 60,          // per hour
        'by' => 'user',
    ],
];


// routes/api.php


// Public routes with IP-based rate limiting
Route::middleware('throttle:60,1')->group(function () {
    Route::get('/products', [ProductController::class, 'index']);
    Route::get('/categories', [CategoryController::class, 'index']);
});


// Authentication routes with strict limiting
// ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Brute force attacks prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Route::middleware('throttle:5,15')->group(function () {
    Route::post('/login', [AuthController::class, 'login']);
    Route::post('/register', [AuthController::class, 'register']);
    Route::post('/forgot-password', [AuthController::class, 'forgotPassword']);
});


// Authenticated routes with user-based limiting
Route::middleware(['auth:jwt', 'throttle:100,1'])->group(function () {
    Route::post('/orders', [OrderController::class, 'store']);
    Route::get('/orders', [OrderController::class, 'index']);
});


// Heavy operations with stricter limits
Route::middleware(['auth:jwt', 'throttle:10,60'])->group(function () {
    Route::get('/reports/sales', [ReportController::class, 'sales']);
    Route::get('/export/orders', [ExportController::class, 'orders']);
});
Custom Rate Limiter
<?php
// app/Providers/RouteServiceProvider.php


use Illuminate\Cache\RateLimiting\Limit;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\RateLimiter;


public function boot()
{
    // Configure rate limiters
    $this->configureRateLimiting();
}


protected function configureRateLimiting()
{
    // API rate limiter
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Dynamic limits based on user role
    RateLimiter::for('api', function (Request $request) {
        $user = $request->user();
        
        if (!$user) {
            // Guest users: 60 per minute
            return Limit::perMinute(60)->by($request->ip());
        }
        
        // Different limits based on role
        $limits = [
            'customer' => 100,
            'vendor' => 200,
            'admin' => 500,
        ];
        
        $limit = $limits[$user->role] ?? 60;
        
        return Limit::perMinute($limit)->by($user->id);
    });
    
    // Authentication rate limiter with decay
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Failed attempts ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶™‡¶∞ exponential backoff
    RateLimiter::for('login', function (Request $request) {
        $email = $request->input('email');
        
        // Base limit: 5 attempts per 15 minutes
        $key = 'login:' . $email;
        
        return Limit::perMinutes(15, 5)
            ->by($key)
            ->response(function (Request $request, array $headers) {
                return response()->json([
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'Too many login attempts. Please try again in 15 minutes.',
                ], 429, $headers);
            });
    });
    
    // Sliding window rate limiter for critical operations
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Burst traffic handle ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ but sustained abuse prevent ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    RateLimiter::for('orders', function (Request $request) {
        $user = $request->user();
        
        return [
            // Short term: 10 orders per minute (prevent rapid clicking)
            Limit::perMinute(10)->by($user->id),
            
            // Long term: 100 orders per day (prevent abuse)
            Limit::perDay(100)->by($user->id),
        ];
    });
}
Rate Limiting ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶® important:
1. Brute Force Protection - Login attempts limit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
2. API Abuse Prevention - Excessive requests block ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
3. Fair Resource Distribution - ‡¶∏‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø fair access
4. Cost Control - Cloud bill control ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Different limits different scenarios ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø:
* Public API - 60 req/min (IP based)
* Authenticated - 100 req/min (user based)
* Login - 5 attempts/15min (security)
* Heavy ops - 10 req/hour (resource intensive)
Exceeded ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá HTTP 429 (Too Many Requests) return ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá‡•§
7. DEPLOYMENT ARCHITECTURE
7.1 Deployment Strategy
The platform uses a blue-green deployment strategy with Docker containers ensuring zero-downtime updates and quick rollback capability.
Blue-Green Deployment Diagram
  

Deployment Flow:
STEP 1: PREPARATION
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Deploy new version to GREEN (inactive)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Run database migrations
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Update dependencies
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Warm up caches


STEP 2: TESTING
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Run automated tests on GREEN
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Manual QA testing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Smoke tests
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Performance validation


STEP 3: TRAFFIC SWITCH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Switch 10% traffic to GREEN (canary)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor errors/performance for 15 mins
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If OK: Switch 50% traffic
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor for 15 mins
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ If OK: Switch 100% traffic to GREEN


STEP 4: FINALIZATION
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ BLUE becomes inactive (standby)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Keep BLUE running for 1 hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If issues: Quick rollback to BLUE
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ After 1 hour: Shut down BLUE


Blue-Green Deployment ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶® use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶ø:
1. Zero Downtime - Users ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶®‡ßã interruption feel ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
2. Quick Rollback - Problem ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá instantly previous version ‡¶è ‡¶´‡¶ø‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
3. Safe Testing - Production environment ‡¶è testing ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ before full release
4. Reduced Risk - Gradual rollout (10% ‚Üí 50% ‚Üí 100%)
Flow:
* Blue = Current live version (users use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶õ‡ßá)
* Green = New version (deploy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶π‡¶ö‡ßç‡¶õ‡ßá)
* Switch ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶™‡¶∞ Green live ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º, Blue standby ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡ßá
* Problem ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá switch back ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º seconds ‡¶è
7.2 CI/CD Pipeline
GitLab CI/CD Configuration
# .gitlab-ci.yml


# CI/CD Pipeline for Multi-Vendor E-commerce Platform
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Automated testing, building, deployment


stages:
  - test          # Run tests
  - build         # Build Docker images
  - deploy-staging
  - deploy-production


# Global variables
variables:
  DOCKER_DRIVER: overlay2
  DOCKER_TLS_CERTDIR: "/certs"
  MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: test_root_password
  MYSQL_DATABASE: ecommerce_test
  REGISTRY: registry.gitlab.com/platform
  
# Cache dependencies for faster builds
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞ dependencies download ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
cache:
  key: ${CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG}
  paths:
    - backend/vendor/
    - backend/node_modules/


# ==========================================
# TEST STAGE
# ==========================================


# PHP Unit Tests
test:phpunit:
  stage: test
  image: php:8.2-fpm
  
  # Services needed for testing
  # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Database, Redis test environment ‡¶è ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡¶¨‡ßá
  services:
    - postgres:15-alpine
    - redis:7-alpine
  
  variables:
    POSTGRES_DB: ecommerce_test
    POSTGRES_USER: test_user
    POSTGRES_PASSWORD: test_password
  
  before_script:
    # Install PHP extensions
    - apt-get update -qq && apt-get install -y -qq git unzip libpq-dev
    - docker-php-ext-install pdo_pgsql
    
    # Install Composer
    - curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php
    - php composer.phar install --no-progress --no-interaction
    
    # Setup Laravel
    - cd backend
    - cp .env.testing .env
    - php artisan key:generate
    - php artisan migrate --force
  
  script:
    # Run PHPUnit tests
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Code changes ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶®‡ßã bug introduce ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá‡¶®‡¶ø verify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    - php artisan test --parallel --coverage
  
  # Artifacts: Test coverage report
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - backend/coverage/
    expire_in: 1 week
  
  only:
    - merge_requests
    - develop
    - main


# Code Quality Analysis
test:phpstan:
  stage: test
  image: php:8.2-fpm
  
  before_script:
    - cd backend
    - curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php
    - php composer.phar install --no-progress
  
  script:
    # Static analysis with PHPStan
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Type errors, potential bugs detect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    - vendor/bin/phpstan analyse --memory-limit=2G
  
  only:
    - merge_requests
    - develop
    - main


# Frontend Tests
test:frontend:
  stage: test
  image: node:18-alpine
  
  before_script:
    - cd customer-frontend
    - npm ci
  
  script:
    # Run Jest tests
    - npm run test -- --coverage
    
    # Run ESLint
    - npm run lint
  
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - customer-frontend/coverage/
    expire_in: 1 week
  
  only:
    - merge_requests
    - develop
    - main


# Security Scan
test:security:
  stage: test
  image: php:8.2-fpm
  
  before_script:
    - cd backend
    - curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php
    - php composer.phar install --no-progress
  
  script:
    # Check for vulnerable dependencies
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Security vulnerabilities detect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    - php composer.phar audit
  
  allow_failure: true  # Don't block pipeline but warn
  
  only:
    - merge_requests
    - develop
    - main


# ==========================================
# BUILD STAGE
# ==========================================


build:docker:
  stage: build
  image: docker:20.10
  
  services:
    - docker:20.10-dind
  
  before_script:
    # Login to Docker registry
    - echo $CI_REGISTRY_PASSWORD | docker login -u $CI_REGISTRY_USER --password-stdin $CI_REGISTRY
  
  script:
    # Build Docker images
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Application containerized ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ deployment ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
    
    # Build PHP-FPM image
    - |
      docker build \
        --build-arg VERSION=$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA \
        --tag $REGISTRY/php-fpm:$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA \
        --tag $REGISTRY/php-fpm:latest \
        -f docker/php/Dockerfile \
        .
    
    # Build Nginx image
    - |
      docker build \
        --build-arg VERSION=$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA \
        --tag $REGISTRY/nginx:$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA \
        --tag $REGISTRY/nginx:latest \
        -f docker/nginx/Dockerfile \
        .
    
    # Push images to registry
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Images servers ‡¶è pull ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
    - docker push $REGISTRY/php-fpm:$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA
    - docker push $REGISTRY/php-fpm:latest
    - docker push $REGISTRY/nginx:$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA
    - docker push $REGISTRY/nginx:latest
  
  only:
    - develop
    - main


# ==========================================
# DEPLOY STAGING
# ==========================================


deploy:staging:
  stage: deploy-staging
  image: alpine:latest
  
  # Environment configuration
  environment:
    name: staging
    url: https://staging.platform.com
  
  before_script:
    # Install SSH and Docker Compose
    - apk add --no-cache openssh-client docker-compose
    
    # Setup SSH key
    - eval $(ssh-agent -s)
    - echo "$STAGING_SSH_KEY" | tr -d '\r' | ssh-add -
    - mkdir -p ~/.ssh
    - chmod 700 ~/.ssh
  
  script:
    # Deploy to staging server
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Production ‡¶è deploy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá staging ‡¶è test ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    
    # SSH into staging server
    - |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no deploy@staging.platform.com << 'EOF'
        # Navigate to project directory
        cd /var/www/platform
        
        # Pull latest images
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml pull
        
        # Run database migrations
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml run --rm php php artisan migrate --force
        
        # Clear caches
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml run --rm php php artisan cache:clear
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml run --rm php php artisan config:clear
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml run --rm php php artisan view:clear
        
        # Restart services (zero-downtime)
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.staging.yml up -d --no-deps --build
        
        # Health check
        sleep 10
        curl -f http://localhost/health || exit 1
        
        echo "‚úÖ Staging deployment successful"
      EOF
  
  only:
    - develop
  
  when: manual  # Manual approval required
  
  # Rollback on failure
  # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Deploy fail ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá automatic rollback
  retry:
    max: 2
    when:
      - script_failure


# ==========================================
# DEPLOY PRODUCTION
# ==========================================


deploy:production:
  stage: deploy-production
  image: alpine:latest
  
  environment:
    name: production
    url: https://platform.com
  
  before_script:
    - apk add --no-cache openssh-client docker-compose
    - eval $(ssh-agent -s)
    - echo "$PRODUCTION_SSH_KEY" | tr -d '\r' | ssh-add -
    - mkdir -p ~/.ssh
    - chmod 700 ~/.ssh
  
  script:
    # Blue-Green Deployment
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Zero-downtime deployment with quick rollback
    
    - |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no deploy@production.platform.com << 'EOF'
        cd /var/www/platform
        
        # Determine current active environment
        ACTIVE=$(cat .active-env)
        if [ "$ACTIVE" = "blue" ]; then
          INACTIVE="green"
        else
          INACTIVE="blue"
        fi
        
        echo "Active: $ACTIVE, Deploying to: $INACTIVE"
        
        # Pull latest images
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.$INACTIVE.yml pull
        
        # Start inactive environment
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.$INACTIVE.yml up -d
        
        # Wait for services to be ready
        sleep 30
        
        # Run migrations (safe - runs only new migrations)
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.$INACTIVE.yml exec -T php php artisan migrate --force
        
        # Warm up caches
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.$INACTIVE.yml exec -T php php artisan cache:warm
        
        # Health check on inactive environment
        for i in {1..10}; do
          if curl -f http://localhost:8080/health; then
            echo "Health check passed"
            break
          fi
          echo "Waiting for services... ($i/10)"
          sleep 5
        done
        
        # Switch load balancer (10% canary)
        ./scripts/load-balancer-switch.sh $INACTIVE 10
        echo "Switched 10% traffic to $INACTIVE, monitoring..."
        sleep 300  # 5 minutes monitoring
        
        # Check error rates
        ERROR_RATE=$(./scripts/check-error-rate.sh $INACTIVE)
        if [ "$ERROR_RATE" -gt "1" ]; then
          echo "Error rate too high, rolling back"
          ./scripts/load-balancer-switch.sh $ACTIVE 100
          exit 1
        fi
        
        # Switch 50% traffic
        ./scripts/load-balancer-switch.sh $INACTIVE 50
        echo "Switched 50% traffic, monitoring..."
        sleep 300
        
        # Final check
        ERROR_RATE=$(./scripts/check-error-rate.sh $INACTIVE)
        if [ "$ERROR_RATE" -gt "1" ]; then
          echo "Error rate too high, rolling back"
          ./scripts/load-balancer-switch.sh $ACTIVE 100
          exit 1
        fi
        
        # Switch 100% traffic
        ./scripts/load-balancer-switch.sh $INACTIVE 100
        echo "Switched 100% traffic to $INACTIVE"
        
        # Update active environment marker
        echo $INACTIVE > .active-env
        
        # Keep old environment running for 1 hour (quick rollback)
        echo "Keeping $ACTIVE running for 1 hour as standby"
        
        echo "‚úÖ Production deployment successful"
        echo "Active environment: $INACTIVE"
      EOF
  
  only:
    - main
  
  when: manual  # Manual approval required
  
  # Notify on Slack
  after_script:
    - |
      if [ "$CI_JOB_STATUS" == "success" ]; then
        STATUS="‚úÖ Success"
        COLOR="good"
      else
        STATUS="‚ùå Failed"
        COLOR="danger"
      fi
      
      curl -X POST $SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL \
        -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
        -d "{
          \"text\": \"Production Deployment $STATUS\",
          \"attachments\": [{
            \"color\": \"$COLOR\",
            \"fields\": [
              {\"title\": \"Commit\", \"value\": \"$CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA\", \"short\": true},
              {\"title\": \"Branch\", \"value\": \"$CI_COMMIT_REF_NAME\", \"short\": true},
              {\"title\": \"Author\", \"value\": \"$GITLAB_USER_NAME\", \"short\": true},
              {\"title\": \"Pipeline\", \"value\": \"$CI_PIPELINE_URL\", \"short\": true}
            ]
          }]
        }"
CI/CD Pipeline ‡¶è‡¶∞ stages:
1. Test Stage
   * Unit tests ‡¶ö‡¶æ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã (PHPUnit, Jest)
   * Code quality check (PHPStan, ESLint)
   * Security scan (vulnerable dependencies)
   * Coverage report generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
2. Build Stage
   * Docker images build ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Version tag ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (commit SHA)
   * Registry ‡¶§‡ßá push ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
3. Deploy Staging
   * Staging server ‡¶è deploy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Migrations run ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Health check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Manual approval ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡ßá
4. Deploy Production
   * Blue-green deployment strategy
   * Gradual rollout (10% ‚Üí 50% ‚Üí 100%)
   * Error rate monitoring
   * Automatic rollback on failure
   * Slack notification
Benefits:
* Automated testing - manual testing ‡¶ï‡¶Æ ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡ßá
* Fast feedback - 10-15 minutes ‡¶è ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶∞‡ßã pipeline
* Consistent deployments - human error ‡¶ï‡¶Æ
* Quick rollback - problems detect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá instant revert
7.3 Database Migration Strategy
Migration Best Practices
<?php
// database/migrations/2026_02_06_000001_add_index_to_orders_table.php


use Illuminate\Database\Migrations\Migration;
use Illuminate\Database\Schema\Blueprint;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Schema;


/**
 * Migration: Add index to orders table
 * 
 * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Query performance improve ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
 * Impact: Low (index creation is online operation)
 * Rollback: Safe (drop index)
 */
class AddIndexToOrdersTable extends Migration
{
    /**
     * Run the migrations
     * 
     * Best practices:
     * 1. Use transactions for data migrations
     * 2. Add indexes concurrently (no table lock)
     * 3. Test on staging first
     * 4. Monitor query performance before/after
     */
    public function up()
    {
        // Add index concurrently (PostgreSQL specific)
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Production ‡¶è table lock ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
        DB::statement('CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY idx_orders_customer_status ON orders(customer_id, order_status)');
        
        // Alternative for other databases:
        // Schema::table('orders', function (Blueprint $table) {
        //     $table->index(['customer_id', 'order_status']);
        // });
    }
    
    /**
     * Reverse the migrations
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Rollback ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡¶≤‡ßá safely revert ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
     */
    public function down()
    {
        Schema::table('orders', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropIndex('idx_orders_customer_status');
        });
    }
}
Data Migration Example


<?php
// database/migrations/2026_02_06_000002_migrate_old_commission_format.php


use Illuminate\Database\Migrations\Migration;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\DB;


/**
 * Data Migration: Convert old commission format to new structure
 * 
 * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Schema change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶Ø‡¶º data convert ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
 * Risk: High (data transformation)
 * Strategy: Batch processing with verification
 */
class MigrateOldCommissionFormat extends Migration
{
    public function up()
    {
        // Step 1: Add new columns
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Gradual migration - old data keep ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ rollback ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
        Schema::table('commissions', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->decimal('gateway_fee', 10, 2)->nullable()->after('commission_amount');
            $table->decimal('vendor_payout', 10, 2)->nullable()->after('gateway_fee');
        });
        
        // Step 2: Migrate data in batches
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Large tables ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá process ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá timeout ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
        $batchSize = 1000;
        $totalProcessed = 0;
        
        DB::transaction(function () use ($batchSize, &$totalProcessed) {
            DB::table('commissions')
                ->whereNull('vendor_payout')  // Only unmigrated records
                ->orderBy('id')
                ->chunk($batchSize, function ($commissions) use (&$totalProcessed) {
                    
                    foreach ($commissions as $commission) {
                        // Calculate new values
                        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Old format ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá new format ‡¶è convert ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
                        $gatewayFee = $commission->order_amount * 0.029 + 0.30;  // 2.9% + $0.30
                        $vendorPayout = $commission->order_amount 
                                      - $commission->commission_amount 
                                      - $gatewayFee;
                        
                        // Update record
                        DB::table('commissions')
                            ->where('id', $commission->id)
                            ->update([
                                'gateway_fee' => round($gatewayFee, 2),
                                'vendor_payout' => round($vendorPayout, 2),
                            ]);
                        
                        $totalProcessed++;
                    }
                    
                    // Log progress
                    \Log::info("Migrated {$totalProcessed} commission records");
                });
        });
        
        // Step 3: Verify migration
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Data corruption check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
        $unmigrated = DB::table('commissions')
            ->whereNull('vendor_payout')
            ->count();
        
        if ($unmigrated > 0) {
            throw new \Exception("Migration incomplete: {$unmigrated} records remaining");
        }
        
        // Step 4: Make columns non-nullable (after verification)
        Schema::table('commissions', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->decimal('gateway_fee', 10, 2)->nullable(false)->change();
            $table->decimal('vendor_payout', 10, 2)->nullable(false)->change();
        });
        
        \Log::info("Commission migration completed: {$totalProcessed} records processed");
    }
    
    public function down()
    {
        // Rollback: Remove new columns
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Migration revert ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡¶≤‡ßá
        Schema::table('commissions', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropColumn(['gateway_fee', 'vendor_payout']);
        });
    }
}
Migration Strategy:
1. Schema Migrations - Table/column structure change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Use CONCURRENTLY index creation (no lock)
   * Test on staging first
   * Always provide rollback (down method)
2. Data Migrations - Existing data transform ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   * Batch processing (large tables ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø)
   * Transaction use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (atomicity)
   * Verification step (data integrity check)
   * Gradual approach (new columns nullable first)
3. Deployment Process
   * Deploy code with migration
   * Run migration on production
   * Verify success before traffic switch
   * Keep rollback ready
Risks:
* Data corruption if migration fails
* Downtime if table locks occur
* Performance impact during migration
Mitigation:
* Test thoroughly on staging
* Use concurrent operations
* Batch processing for large datasets
* Monitor query performance
________________


8. DISASTER RECOVERY & BUSINESS CONTINUITY
8.1 Backup Strategy
Automated Backup System
#!/bin/bash
# scripts/database/backup-db.sh


# ==========================================
# DATABASE BACKUP SCRIPT
# ==========================================
# Purpose: Automated daily backups with retention
# Schedule: Runs daily at 2 AM UTC (cron)
# Retention: 30 daily, 12 weekly, 12 monthly


set -e  # Exit on error


# Color output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color


echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Starting database backup...${NC}"


# Configuration from environment
DB_HOST="${DB_HOST:-localhost}"
DB_PORT="${DB_PORT:-5432}"
DB_NAME="${DB_NAME:-ecommerce}"
DB_USER="${DB_USER:-postgres}"
DB_PASSWORD="${DB_PASSWORD:-secret}"


# Backup directory
BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/database"
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"


# Backup filename with timestamp
TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
BACKUP_FILE="$BACKUP_DIR/${DB_NAME}_${TIMESTAMP}.sql.gz"


# S3 bucket for off-site backup
S3_BUCKET="${AWS_S3_BACKUP_BUCKET:-}"


# Retention periods (days)
DAILY_RETENTION=30
WEEKLY_RETENTION=84    # 12 weeks
MONTHLY_RETENTION=365  # 12 months


# Export password for pg_dump
export PGPASSWORD="$DB_PASSWORD"


echo "Database: $DB_NAME"
echo "Backup file: $BACKUP_FILE"


# ==========================================
# PERFORM BACKUP
# ==========================================


# Create backup with pg_dump
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Logical backup - portable, easy to restore
# Format: Custom format (compressed, efficient)
if pg_dump \
    -h "$DB_HOST" \
    -p "$DB_PORT" \
    -U "$DB_USER" \
    -F c \
    -b \
    -v \
    "$DB_NAME" | gzip > "$BACKUP_FILE"; then
    
    BACKUP_SIZE=$(du -h "$BACKUP_FILE" | cut -f1)
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Backup completed successfully${NC}"
    echo "Backup size: $BACKUP_SIZE"
    
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Backup failed!${NC}"
    rm -f "$BACKUP_FILE"
    
    # Send alert
    curl -X POST "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" \
        -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
        -d '{"text":"‚ùå Database backup FAILED on '"$(hostname)"'"}'
    
    exit 1
fi


# Verify backup integrity
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Corrupted backup useless, early detection important
if gzip -t "$BACKUP_FILE" 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Backup file integrity verified${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Backup file corrupted!${NC}"
    rm -f "$BACKUP_FILE"
    exit 1
fi


# ==========================================
# UPLOAD TO S3 (OFF-SITE BACKUP)
# ==========================================


if [ -n "$S3_BUCKET" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚òÅÔ∏è  Uploading to S3...${NC}"
    
    # Upload with server-side encryption
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Off-site backup essential for disaster recovery
    if aws s3 cp "$BACKUP_FILE" \
        "s3://$S3_BUCKET/database/$(date +%Y)/$(date +%m)/" \
        --storage-class STANDARD_IA \
        --server-side-encryption AES256; then
        
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Uploaded to S3${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ö†Ô∏è  S3 upload failed (local backup still available)${NC}"
    fi
fi


# ==========================================
# RETENTION MANAGEMENT
# ==========================================


echo -e "${YELLOW}üßπ Managing backup retention...${NC}"


# Daily backups: Keep 30 days
find "$BACKUP_DIR" \
    -name "${DB_NAME}_*.sql.gz" \
    -type f \
    -mtime +$DAILY_RETENTION \
    ! -name "*_weekly_*" \
    ! -name "*_monthly_*" \
    -delete


# Weekly backups: Mark and keep 12 weeks
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Every Sunday backup mark as weekly
if [ $(date +%u) -eq 7 ]; then  # Sunday
    WEEKLY_FILE="${BACKUP_DIR}/${DB_NAME}_${TIMESTAMP}_weekly.sql.gz"
    cp "$BACKUP_FILE" "$WEEKLY_FILE"
    echo "Created weekly backup: $WEEKLY_FILE"
fi


# Clean old weekly backups
find "$BACKUP_DIR" \
    -name "${DB_NAME}_*_weekly.sql.gz" \
    -type f \
    -mtime +$WEEKLY_RETENTION \
    ! -name "*_monthly_*" \
    -delete


# Monthly backups: Mark and keep 12 months
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: First day of month mark as monthly
if [ $(date +%d) -eq 01 ]; then
    MONTHLY_FILE="${BACKUP_DIR}/${DB_NAME}_${TIMESTAMP}_monthly.sql.gz"
    cp "$BACKUP_FILE" "$MONTHLY_FILE"
    echo "Created monthly backup: $MONTHLY_FILE"
fi


# Clean old monthly backups
find "$BACKUP_DIR" \
    -name "${DB_NAME}_*_monthly.sql.gz" \
    -type f \
    -mtime +$MONTHLY_RETENTION \
    -delete


# ==========================================
# SUMMARY & NOTIFICATION
# ==========================================


# Count backups
DAILY_COUNT=$(find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "${DB_NAME}_*.sql.gz" ! -name "*_weekly_*" ! -name "*_monthly_*" | wc -l)
WEEKLY_COUNT=$(find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "${DB_NAME}_*_weekly.sql.gz" | wc -l)
MONTHLY_COUNT=$(find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "${DB_NAME}_*_monthly.sql.gz" | wc -l)


echo -e "${GREEN}üìä Backup Summary:${NC}"
echo "  Daily backups: $DAILY_COUNT (retention: $DAILY_RETENTION days)"
echo "  Weekly backups: $WEEKLY_COUNT (retention: 12 weeks)"
echo "  Monthly backups: $MONTHLY_COUNT (retention: 12 months)"


# Calculate total backup size
TOTAL_SIZE=$(du -sh "$BACKUP_DIR" | cut -f1)
echo "  Total backup size: $TOTAL_SIZE"


# Success notification
curl -X POST "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d "{
        \"text\":\"‚úÖ Database backup completed\",
        \"attachments\":[{
            \"color\":\"good\",
            \"fields\":[
                {\"title\":\"Database\",\"value\":\"$DB_NAME\",\"short\":true},
                {\"title\":\"Size\",\"value\":\"$BACKUP_SIZE\",\"short\":true},
                {\"title\":\"Daily\",\"value\":\"$DAILY_COUNT\",\"short\":true},
                {\"title\":\"Weekly\",\"value\":\"$WEEKLY_COUNT\",\"short\":true}
            ]
        }]
    }"


# Unset password
unset PGPASSWORD


echo -e "${GREEN}üéâ Backup process completed successfully!${NC}"
Cron Schedule


# /etc/cron.d/database-backup


# Database backup - Daily at 2 AM UTC
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Low traffic time, minimal impact
0 2 * * * deploy /var/www/platform/scripts/database/backup-db.sh >> /var/log/backup.log 2>&1


# Redis backup - Every 6 hours
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Cache data less critical but still valuable
0 */6 * * * deploy /var/www/platform/scripts/database/backup-redis.sh >> /var/log/backup-redis.log 2>&1


# File backup - Daily at 3 AM UTC
# ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: After database backup completes
0 3 * * * deploy /var/www/platform/scripts/database/backup-files.sh >> /var/log/backup-files.log 2>&1

Bangla Explanation:

Backup Strategy ‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶® ‡¶ß‡¶∞‡¶®‡ßá‡¶∞ retention period ‡¶è:

  • Daily Backups - 30 days retention
  • ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶® 2 AM ‡¶è automatic backup
  • Recent data recovery ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
  • Weekly Backups - 12 weeks retention
  • ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø Sunday daily backup copy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
  • Medium-term recovery ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
  • Monthly Backups - 12 months retention
  • ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶∞ 1st day backup copy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
  • Long-term archival ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø

Storage:

  • Local - Fast recovery, immediate access
  • S3 - Off-site, disaster recovery
  • Encrypted - Security compliance

Benefits:

  • Point-in-time recovery capability
  • Protection against data corruption
  • Compliance with data retention policies
  • Off-site protection against facility disasters

## 8.2 Disaster Recovery Plan

### Recovery Time Objective (RTO) & Recovery Point Objective (RPO)

  

* RTO (Recovery Time Objective) - ‡¶ï‡¶§ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá service restore ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
* RPO (Recovery Point Objective) - ‡¶∏‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶¨‡ßã‡¶ö‡ßç‡¶ö ‡¶ï‡¶§ data loss acceptable
Example:
* Database failure: 1 hour ‡¶è restore, maximum 15 min data loss
* Application crash: 5 minute ‡¶è recover, no data loss
* Data center outage: 4 hour ‡¶è failover, 1 hour data loss
Disaster Recovery Procedures
#!/bin/bash
# scripts/disaster-recovery/restore-from-backup.sh


# ==========================================
# DISASTER RECOVERY SCRIPT
# ==========================================
# Purpose: Restore database from backup
# Usage: ./restore-from-backup.sh <backup-file> [--verify-only]


set -e


RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'


# Check arguments
if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error: Backup file not specified${NC}"
    echo "Usage: $0 <backup-file> [--verify-only]"
    echo "Example: $0 /var/backups/database/ecommerce_20260206_020000.sql.gz"
    exit 1
fi


BACKUP_FILE="$1"
VERIFY_ONLY="${2:-false}"


# Verify backup file exists
if [ ! -f "$BACKUP_FILE" ]; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Backup file not found: $BACKUP_FILE${NC}"
    exit 1
fi


# Configuration
DB_HOST="${DB_HOST:-localhost}"
DB_PORT="${DB_PORT:-5432}"
DB_NAME="${DB_NAME:-ecommerce}"
DB_USER="${DB_USER:-postgres}"
DB_PASSWORD="${DB_PASSWORD:-secret}"


export PGPASSWORD="$DB_PASSWORD"


echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}   DISASTER RECOVERY PROCEDURE${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Database: $DB_NAME"
echo "Backup file: $BACKUP_FILE"
echo "Verify only: $VERIFY_ONLY"
echo ""


# ==========================================
# STEP 1: VERIFY BACKUP INTEGRITY
# ==========================================


echo -e "${YELLOW}[1/8] Verifying backup file integrity...${NC}"


if ! gzip -t "$BACKUP_FILE" 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Backup file is corrupted!${NC}"
    exit 1
fi


echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Backup file integrity OK${NC}"


# ==========================================
# STEP 2: CREATE SAFETY BACKUP
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[2/8] Creating safety backup of current database...${NC}"
    
    SAFETY_BACKUP="/var/backups/database/safety_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).sql.gz"
    
    if pg_dump -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -F c "$DB_NAME" | gzip > "$SAFETY_BACKUP"; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Safety backup created: $SAFETY_BACKUP${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to create safety backup${NC}"
        read -p "Continue anyway? (yes/no): " FORCE
        if [ "$FORCE" != "yes" ]; then
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 3: MAINTENANCE MODE
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[3/8] Enabling maintenance mode...${NC}"
    
    # Enable maintenance mode in application
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Users service interruption notice ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
    ssh deploy@web-server "cd /var/www/platform/backend && php artisan down --message='System maintenance in progress' --retry=3600"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Maintenance mode enabled${NC}"
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 4: STOP APPLICATION SERVICES
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[4/8] Stopping application services...${NC}"
    
    # Stop queue workers (prevent job processing during restore)
    ssh deploy@web-server "sudo supervisorctl stop laravel-worker:*"
    
    # Stop web servers (prevent new connections)
    ssh deploy@web-server "sudo systemctl stop nginx"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Services stopped${NC}"
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 5: TERMINATE DATABASE CONNECTIONS
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[5/8] Terminating active database connections...${NC}"
    
    psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "
        SELECT pg_terminate_backend(pg_stat_activity.pid)
        FROM pg_stat_activity
        WHERE pg_stat_activity.datname = '$DB_NAME'
          AND pid <> pg_backend_pid();
    "
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Connections terminated${NC}"
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 6: DROP AND RECREATE DATABASE
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[6/8] Dropping and recreating database...${NC}"
    
    # Drop database
    psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS $DB_NAME;"
    
    # Create fresh database
    psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "CREATE DATABASE $DB_NAME;"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Database recreated${NC}"
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 7: RESTORE BACKUP
# ==========================================


echo -e "${YELLOW}[7/8] Restoring database from backup...${NC}"


START_TIME=$(date +%s)


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" = "--verify-only" ]; then
    # Verify mode: restore to temporary database
    # ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Production database touch ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá verify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    
    TEMP_DB="${DB_NAME}_verify_$$"
    
    psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "CREATE DATABASE $TEMP_DB;"
    
    if zcat "$BACKUP_FILE" | pg_restore \
        -h "$DB_HOST" \
        -p "$DB_PORT" \
        -U "$DB_USER" \
        -d "$TEMP_DB" \
        -v \
        --no-owner \
        --no-acl \
        2>&1 | tee /tmp/restore_verify.log; then
        
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Backup verification successful${NC}"
        
        # Cleanup
        psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "DROP DATABASE $TEMP_DB;"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Backup verification failed${NC}"
        psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS $TEMP_DB;"
        exit 1
    fi
    
else
    # Production restore
    if zcat "$BACKUP_FILE" | pg_restore \
        -h "$DB_HOST" \
        -p "$DB_PORT" \
        -U "$DB_USER" \
        -d "$DB_NAME" \
        -v \
        --no-owner \
        --no-acl \
        2>&1 | tee /tmp/restore_production.log; then
        
        END_TIME=$(date +%s)
        DURATION=$((END_TIME - START_TIME))
        
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Database restored successfully${NC}"
        echo "Restore duration: ${DURATION}s"
        
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Restore failed!${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}Attempting rollback to safety backup...${NC}"
        
        # Restore from safety backup
        psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "DROP DATABASE $DB_NAME;"
        psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d postgres -c "CREATE DATABASE $DB_NAME;"
        zcat "$SAFETY_BACKUP" | pg_restore -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -v --no-owner --no-acl
        
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Rolled back to safety backup${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
fi


# ==========================================
# STEP 8: POST-RESTORE VERIFICATION
# ==========================================


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[8/8] Running post-restore verification...${NC}"
    
    # Verify table count
    TABLE_COUNT=$(psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -t -c "
        SELECT COUNT(*) 
        FROM information_schema.tables 
        WHERE table_schema = 'public';
    ")
    
    echo "Tables restored: $TABLE_COUNT"
    
    if [ "$TABLE_COUNT" -lt "20" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: Unexpected table count${NC}"
    fi
    
    # Verify critical data
    USER_COUNT=$(psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -t -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;")
    PRODUCT_COUNT=$(psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -t -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM products;")
    ORDER_COUNT=$(psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -t -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orders;")
    
    echo "Data verification:"
    echo "  Users: $USER_COUNT"
    echo "  Products: $PRODUCT_COUNT"
    echo "  Orders: $ORDER_COUNT"
    
    # Update sequences
    echo "Updating sequences..."
    psql -h "$DB_HOST" -p "$DB_PORT" -U "$DB_USER" -d "$DB_NAME" -c "
        SELECT setval(pg_get_serial_sequence('users', 'id'), COALESCE(MAX(id), 1)) FROM users;
        SELECT setval(pg_get_serial_sequence('products', 'id'), COALESCE(MAX(id), 1)) FROM products;
        SELECT setval(pg_get_serial_sequence('orders', 'id'), COALESCE(MAX(id), 1)) FROM orders;
    "
    
    # Restart services
    echo "Restarting services..."
    ssh deploy@web-server "sudo systemctl start nginx"
    ssh deploy@web-server "sudo supervisorctl start laravel-worker:*"
    
    # Disable maintenance mode
    ssh deploy@web-server "cd /var/www/platform/backend && php artisan up"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Services restarted${NC}"
fi


# ==========================================
# SUMMARY
# ==========================================


echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}   RECOVERY COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo ""


if [ "$VERIFY_ONLY" != "--verify-only" ]; then
    echo "Safety backup location: $SAFETY_BACKUP"
    echo "Keep this backup for at least 7 days"
    echo ""
    echo "Next steps:"
    echo "1. Verify application functionality"
    echo "2. Check recent orders and transactions"
    echo "3. Monitor error logs for issues"
    echo "4. Notify stakeholders of restoration"
fi


# Send notification
curl -X POST "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d "{
        \"text\":\"‚úÖ Database restore completed\",
        \"attachments\":[{
            \"color\":\"good\",
            \"fields\":[
                {\"title\":\"Backup\",\"value\":\"$(basename $BACKUP_FILE)\",\"short\":true},
                {\"title\":\"Duration\",\"value\":\"${DURATION}s\",\"short\":true}
            ]
        }]
    }"


unset PGPASSWORD
Disaster Recovery Process:
1. Verify Backup - Backup file corrupted ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡¶æ check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
2. Safety Backup - Current database backup ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ (rollback ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø)
3. Maintenance Mode - Users notice ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá system maintenance ‡¶ö‡¶≤‡¶õ‡ßá
4. Stop Services - Queue workers, web servers stop ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
5. Terminate Connections - Active database connections kill ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
6. Drop/Recreate - Clean slate ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø database recreate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
7. Restore - Backup ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá data restore ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
8. Verify - Data integrity check, services restart ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Testing:
* ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡¶ø quarter disaster recovery drill ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
* Verify-only mode ‡¶è backup test ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
* RTO/RPO targets meet ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶õ‡ßá ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡¶æ measure ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
9. MONITORING & OBSERVABILITY
9.1 Monitoring Stack Overview
The platform implements comprehensive monitoring and observability using industry-standard tools to ensure system health, performance, and rapid incident detection.
Monitoring Architecture
  

Monitoring Stack ‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶® main components:
1. Collection - Data collect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (logs, metrics, errors)
2. Visualization - Data visualize ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (dashboards, graphs)
3. Alerting - Problems detect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá notify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
Different tools different purposes ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø:
* Sentry - Application errors track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
* Prometheus - System metrics (CPU, memory, requests)
* ELK - Log aggregation and search
* New Relic - Application performance monitoring
9.2 Error Tracking with Sentry
Sentry Integration
<?php
// config/sentry.php


return [
    // DSN (Data Source Name) from Sentry project
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Errors Sentry ‡¶è ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
    'dsn' => env('SENTRY_LARAVEL_DSN'),
    
    // Environment name
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Production vs Staging errors ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    'environment' => env('APP_ENV', 'production'),
    
    // Release version
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® code version ‡¶è error ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
    'release' => env('SENTRY_RELEASE', 'unknown'),
    
    // Sample rate (0.0 to 1.0)
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: All errors ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶≤‡ßá quota ‡¶∂‡ßá‡¶∑ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
    'traces_sample_rate' => env('SENTRY_TRACES_SAMPLE_RATE', 0.2),
    
    // Capture user context
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® user ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø error ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶æ
    'send_default_pii' => true,
    
    // Ignored exceptions
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Expected exceptions ignore ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (404, validation)
    'ignore_exceptions' => [
        Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\ModelNotFoundException::class,
        Symfony\Component\HttpKernel\Exception\NotFoundHttpException::class,
        Illuminate\Validation\ValidationException::class,
    ],
    
    // Before send callback
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Sensitive data filter ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ before sending
    'before_send' => function (\Sentry\Event $event): ?\Sentry\Event {
        // Remove sensitive data from context
        if ($event->getRequest()) {
            $request = $event->getRequest();
            
            // Remove password fields
            if (isset($request['data']['password'])) {
                $request['data']['password'] = '[FILTERED]';
            }
            
            if (isset($request['data']['password_confirmation'])) {
                $request['data']['password_confirmation'] = '[FILTERED]';
            }
            
            // Remove credit card data
            if (isset($request['data']['card_number'])) {
                $request['data']['card_number'] = '[FILTERED]';
            }
        }
        
        return $event;
    },
];
Custom Error Context


<?php
// app/Exceptions/Handler.php


namespace App\Exceptions;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Exceptions\Handler as ExceptionHandler;
use Throwable;
use Sentry\State\Scope;


class Handler extends ExceptionHandler
{
    /**
     * Report exception to Sentry with custom context
     * 
     * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Error debugging ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø extra context helpful
     */
    public function report(Throwable $exception)
    {
        if ($this->shouldReport($exception) && app()->bound('sentry')) {
            // Add custom context to Sentry
            \Sentry\configureScope(function (Scope $scope): void {
                // User context
                // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® user ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø error ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá
                if ($user = auth()->user()) {
                    $scope->setUser([
                        'id' => $user->id,
                        'email' => $user->email,
                        'role' => $user->role,
                        'name' => $user->name,
                    ]);
                }
                
                // Request context
                // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Request details error reproduce ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡ßç‡¶Ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
                $scope->setContext('request', [
                    'url' => request()->fullUrl(),
                    'method' => request()->method(),
                    'ip' => request()->ip(),
                    'user_agent' => request()->userAgent(),
                ]);
                
                // Application context
                // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Environment, version info
                $scope->setContext('application', [
                    'environment' => config('app.env'),
                    'version' => config('app.version'),
                    'php_version' => PHP_VERSION,
                    'laravel_version' => app()->version(),
                ]);
                
                // Tags for filtering
                // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Sentry UI ‡¶§‡ßá filter ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶∏‡¶π‡¶ú
                $scope->setTag('environment', config('app.env'));
                $scope->setTag('server', gethostname());
                
                // Breadcrumbs (user actions before error)
                // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Error ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá user ‡¶ï‡ßÄ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
                if (request()->route()) {
                    $scope->addBreadcrumb([
                        'category' => 'route',
                        'message' => request()->route()->getName() ?? request()->route()->uri(),
                        'level' => 'info',
                    ]);
                }
            });
        }
        
        parent::report($exception);
    }
}
Custom Exception for Business Logic Errors


<?php
// app/Exceptions/OrderProcessingException.php


namespace App\Exceptions;


use Exception;
use Sentry\Severity;


/**
 * Exception for order processing errors
 * 
 * ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Business logic errors ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
 */
class OrderProcessingException extends Exception
{
    private array $context;
    
    public function __construct(
        string $message,
        array $context = [],
        int $code = 0,
        ?Exception $previous = null
    ) {
        parent::__construct($message, $code, $previous);
        $this->context = $context;
    }
    
    /**
     * Report to Sentry with custom severity
     */
    public function report()
    {
        \Sentry\captureException($this, function (\Sentry\State\Scope $scope): void {
            // Set severity
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Error importance indicate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
            $scope->setLevel(Severity::error());
            
            // Add business context
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Order details debugging ‡¶è help ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
            $scope->setContext('order', $this->context);
            
            // Tags for grouping
            $scope->setTag('error_type', 'order_processing');
            
            if (isset($this->context['order_id'])) {
                $scope->setTag('order_id', $this->context['order_id']);
            }
            
            // Fingerprint for grouping similar errors
            // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Same type errors ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶•‡ßá group ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
            $scope->setFingerprint([
                'order_processing',
                $this->getMessage(),
            ]);
        });
    }
    
    /**
     * Render error response
     */
    public function render($request)
    {
        return response()->json([
            'success' => false,
            'message' => 'Order processing failed: ' . $this->getMessage(),
            'error_code' => 'ORDER_PROCESSING_ERROR',
        ], 422);
    }
}


// Usage example:
try {
    $order = $orderService->createOrder(...);
} catch (\Exception $e) {
    throw new OrderProcessingException(
        'Failed to process payment',
        [
            'order_id' => $order->id ?? null,
            'customer_id' => $customerId,
            'amount' => $total,
            'payment_method' => $paymentMethod,
        ],
        0,
        $e
    );
}

Bangla Explanation:

Sentry Error Tracking benefits:

  • Automatic Capture - ‡¶∏‡¶¨ unhandled exceptions automatic capture ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º
  • Rich Context - User, request, environment details ‡¶∏‡¶π
  • Stack Traces - Error ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá exact line number
  • Breadcrumbs - Error ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá ‡¶ï‡ßÄ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá
  • Grouping - Similar errors ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶•‡ßá group ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
  • Alerting - New/frequent errors ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø notification

Example alert:

New Error: OrderProcessingException
Message: Failed to process payment
User: customer@example.com (ID: 1234)
URL: POST /api/v1/orders
Occurrences: 5 in last hour
First seen: 2 minutes ago
9.3 Application Performance Monitoring (APM)
New Relic Integration
<?php
// config/newrelic.php


return [
    // Enable/disable New Relic
    'enabled' => env('NEW_RELIC_ENABLED', false),
    
    // Application name in New Relic
    'app_name' => env('NEW_RELIC_APP_NAME', 'Multi-Vendor-Platform'),
    
    // License key
    'license_key' => env('NEW_RELIC_LICENSE_KEY'),
    
    // Transaction naming
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Meaningful transaction names monitoring ‡¶è
    'auto_name_transactions' => true,
    
    // Custom attributes
    // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Additional context for transactions
    'capture_params' => true,
    
    // Background job monitoring
    'capture_background_jobs' => true,
];


// app/Providers/AppServiceProvider.php


use Illuminate\Support\ServiceProvider;


class AppServiceProvider extends ServiceProvider
{
    public function boot()
    {
        // New Relic transaction naming
        // ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®: Better visibility in APM dashboard
        if (extension_loaded('newrelic') && config('newrelic.enabled')) {
            
            // Name transactions by route
            if (request()->route()) {
                $routeName = request()->route()->getName();
                $routeAction = request()->route()->getActionName();
                
                $transactionName = $routeName ?: $routeAction;
                newrelic_name_transaction($transactionName);
            }
