    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_categories_parent FOREIGN KEY (parent_id) 
        REFERENCES categories(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_categories_created_by FOREIGN KEY (created_by) 
        REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_categories_approved_by FOREIGN KEY (approved_by) 
        REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_categories_alternative FOREIGN KEY (suggested_alternative_id) 
        REFERENCES categories(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    CONSTRAINT uq_categories_slug UNIQUE (slug),
    CONSTRAINT ck_categories_status CHECK (status IN ('active', 'inactive', 'pending')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_categories_level CHECK (level BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    CONSTRAINT ck_categories_level_parent CHECK (
        (level = 1 AND parent_id IS NULL) OR 
        (level > 1 AND parent_id IS NOT NULL)
    )
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_parent ON categories(parent_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_slug ON categories(slug);
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_status ON categories(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_level ON categories(level);
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_path ON categories(path) WHERE path IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_created_by ON categories(created_by) WHERE created_by IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_featured ON categories(is_featured) WHERE is_featured = TRUE;


-- Partial index for pending vendor categories
CREATE INDEX idx_categories_pending ON categories(created_at) 
WHERE status = 'pending' AND created_by IS NOT NULL;


COMMENT ON TABLE categories IS 'Hierarchical product categories (max 3 levels) with vendor creation support';
COMMENT ON COLUMN categories.level IS 'Category depth: 1=top, 2=sub, 3=leaf (max)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN categories.path IS 'Materialized path for efficient tree queries: /parent_id/id/';
COMMENT ON COLUMN categories.created_by IS 'NULL if admin-created, user_id if vendor-created';
COMMENT ON COLUMN categories.status IS 'active=visible, inactive=hidden, pending=awaiting approval';
Materialized Path Implementation:
sql
-- Function to calculate path
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION calculate_category_path(category_id BIGINT)
RETURNS VARCHAR(500) AS $$
DECLARE
    result VARCHAR(500);
BEGIN
    WITH RECURSIVE category_tree AS (
        SELECT id, parent_id, CAST('/' || id || '/' AS VARCHAR(500)) as path
        FROM categories
        WHERE id = category_id
        
        UNION ALL
        
        SELECT c.id, c.parent_id, CAST('/' || c.id || ct.path AS VARCHAR(500))
        FROM categories c
        JOIN category_tree ct ON c.id = ct.parent_id
    )
    SELECT path INTO result
    FROM category_tree
    WHERE parent_id IS NULL;
    
    RETURN result;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;


-- Trigger to update path on insert/update
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION trigger_update_category_path()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
BEGIN
    NEW.path := calculate_category_path(NEW.id);
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;


CREATE TRIGGER before_insert_update_category_path
BEFORE INSERT OR UPDATE ON categories
FOR EACH ROW
EXECUTE FUNCTION trigger_update_category_path();
Sample Data:
sql
-- Level 1 (Top Categories)
INSERT INTO categories (name, slug, level, status) VALUES
('Electronics', 'electronics', 1, 'active'),
('Fashion', 'fashion', 1, 'active'),
('Home & Garden', 'home-garden', 1, 'active');


-- Level 2 (Subcategories)
INSERT INTO categories (parent_id, name, slug, level, status) VALUES
(1, 'Laptops', 'laptops', 2, 'active'),
(1, 'Smartphones', 'smartphones', 2, 'active'),
(2, 'Men''s Clothing', 'mens-clothing', 2, 'active');


-- Level 3 (Leaf Categories)
INSERT INTO categories (parent_id, name, slug, level, status) VALUES
(4, 'Gaming Laptops', 'gaming-laptops', 3, 'active'),
(4, 'Business Laptops', 'business-laptops', 3, 'active');


-- Vendor-created category (pending approval)
INSERT INTO categories (parent_id, name, slug, level, status, created_by) VALUES
(1, 'Smart Watches', 'smart-watches', 2, 'pending', 2);

Bangla Explanation:

categories table hierarchical category structure support ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

3-Level Hierarchy:

Electronics (Level 1)
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Laptops (Level 2)
  ‚îÇ     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gaming Laptops (Level 3)
  ‚îÇ     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Business Laptops (Level 3)
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Smartphones (Level 2)
Vendor Category Creation:
1. Vendor new category create ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‚Üí created_by = vendor_user_id, status = 'pending'
2. Category immediately usable by creating vendor
3. Admin review ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:
   * Approve ‚Üí status = 'active', category platform-wide visible
   * Reject ‚Üí suggested_alternative_id ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá existing category suggest ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
4. Rejected ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá vendor ‡¶è‡¶∞ products suggested category ‡¶§‡ßá move ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º
Materialized Path:
* Path Format: /1/5/23/ = grandparent/parent/current
* Benefits: Efficient subtree queries
* Example Query: All Electronics subcategories
sql
 SELECT * FROM categories 
  WHERE path LIKE '/1/%';  -- All under Electronics
Tree Queries:
sql
-- Get full category tree with breadcrumbs
SELECT 
    c.id,
    c.name,
    c.level,
    (SELECT string_agg(parent.name, ' > ' ORDER BY parent.level)
     FROM categories parent
     WHERE c.path LIKE '%/' || parent.id || '/%'
    ) as breadcrumb
FROM categories c
WHERE c.status = 'active';


-- Get all descendants of a category
SELECT * FROM categories
WHERE path LIKE (
    SELECT path || '%' FROM categories WHERE id = 1
);


-- Get immediate children only
SELECT * FROM categories
WHERE parent_id = 1;
4.3.2 attribute_templates
Purpose: Define standardized product attributes per category
sql
CREATE TABLE attribute_templates (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Category Relationship
    category_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Attribute Definition
    attribute_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    attribute_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    
    -- Display & Input
    display_label VARCHAR(255),
    placeholder VARCHAR(255),
    help_text TEXT,
    
    -- Behavior Flags
    is_required BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_filterable BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_variant BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_searchable BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Validation
    validation_rules JSONB,
    
    -- Units (for numeric attributes)
    unit VARCHAR(20),
    
    -- Display
    display_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Status
    is_active BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT TRUE,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_attr_templates_category FOREIGN KEY (category_id) 
        REFERENCES categories(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT ck_attr_templates_type CHECK (attribute_type IN 
        ('text', 'number', 'select', 'multiselect', 'boolean', 'color', 'date')),
    CONSTRAINT uq_attr_templates_category_name UNIQUE (category_id, attribute_name)
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_templates_category ON attribute_templates(category_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_templates_type ON attribute_templates(attribute_type);
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_templates_filterable ON attribute_templates(is_filterable) 
WHERE is_filterable = TRUE;
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_templates_variant ON attribute_templates(is_variant) 
WHERE is_variant = TRUE;


COMMENT ON TABLE attribute_templates IS 'Standardized attribute definitions per category';
COMMENT ON COLUMN attribute_templates.attribute_type IS 'Input type: text, number, select, multiselect, boolean, color, date';
COMMENT ON COLUMN attribute_templates.is_variant IS 'If TRUE, this attribute creates product variants (e.g., Size, Color)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN attribute_templates.validation_rules IS 'JSON validation rules: {"min": 0, "max": 100, "pattern": "^[A-Z]+$"}';
Sample Data:
sql
-- Laptop attributes (category_id = 4)
INSERT INTO attribute_templates (category_id, attribute_name, attribute_type, 
    display_label, is_required, is_filterable, is_variant, unit, validation_rules) 
VALUES
-- Variant attributes (creates different SKUs)
(4, 'ram', 'select', 'RAM', TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, 'GB', 
    '{"options": ["4", "8", "16", "32"]}'::jsonb),
(4, 'storage', 'select', 'Storage', TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, 'GB', 
    '{"options": ["256", "512", "1024"]}'::jsonb),
(4, 'color', 'select', 'Color', TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, NULL, 
    '{"options": ["Black", "Silver", "Space Gray"]}'::jsonb),


-- Non-variant attributes (informational)
(4, 'processor', 'text', 'Processor', TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, NULL, 
    '{"max_length": 100}'::jsonb),
(4, 'screen_size', 'number', 'Screen Size', TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, 'inches', 
    '{"min": 11, "max": 17}'::jsonb),
(4, 'has_touchscreen', 'boolean', 'Touchscreen', FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, NULL, NULL),
(4, 'weight', 'number', 'Weight', FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, 'kg', 
    '{"min": 0.5, "max": 5}'::jsonb);


-- T-Shirt attributes (category_id = 6)
INSERT INTO attribute_templates (category_id, attribute_name, attribute_type, 
    display_label, is_required, is_filterable, is_variant) 
VALUES
(6, 'size', 'select', 'Size', TRUE, TRUE, TRUE),
(6, 'color', 'color', 'Color', TRUE, TRUE, TRUE),
(6, 'material', 'select', 'Material', TRUE, TRUE, FALSE),
(6, 'pattern', 'select', 'Pattern', FALSE, TRUE, FALSE);

Bangla Explanation:

attribute_templates category-specific attributes define ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

Attribute Types:

  • text - Free text input (processor name)
  • number - Numeric value (screen size, weight)
  • select - Single choice dropdown (RAM: 8GB/16GB/32GB)
  • multiselect - Multiple choices (features: WiFi, Bluetooth, USB-C)
  • boolean - Yes/No checkbox (has touchscreen?)
  • color - Color picker (shirt color)
  • date - Date picker (warranty expiry)

Key Flags:

  • is_required - Vendor must provide this attribute
  • is_filterable - Customers can filter by this (sidebar filters)
  • is_variant - Creates separate product variants with own SKU/stock
  • is_searchable - Included in product search index

Variant Attributes:

Laptop with RAM (8GB/16GB) + Storage (256GB/512GB) creates 4 variants:

1. 8GB RAM + 256GB Storage
2. 8GB RAM + 512GB Storage  
3. 16GB RAM + 256GB Storage
4. 16GB RAM + 512GB Storage
Validation Rules (JSON):
json
{
  "min": 0,
  "max": 100,
  "pattern": "^[A-Z0-9-]+$",
  "options": ["Option1", "Option2"],
  "max_length": 255
}
4.3.3 attribute_template_options
Purpose: Predefined values for select/multiselect attributes
sql
CREATE TABLE attribute_template_options (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Template Relationship
    template_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Option Details
    option_value VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    display_label VARCHAR(255),
    
    -- Color (for color type attributes)
    color_hex VARCHAR(7),  -- #RRGGBB format
    
    -- Image (for visual options)
    image_url VARCHAR(500),
    
    -- Display
    display_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Status
    is_active BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT TRUE,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_attr_options_template FOREIGN KEY (template_id) 
        REFERENCES attribute_templates(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT uq_attr_options_template_value UNIQUE (template_id, option_value),
    CONSTRAINT ck_attr_options_color_hex CHECK (
        color_hex IS NULL OR color_hex ~ '^#[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$'
    )
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_options_template ON attribute_template_options(template_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_attr_options_active ON attribute_template_options(is_active) 
WHERE is_active = TRUE;


COMMENT ON TABLE attribute_template_options IS 'Predefined values for select/multiselect attributes';
COMMENT ON COLUMN attribute_template_options.option_value IS 'Stored value (used in database)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN attribute_template_options.display_label IS 'Human-readable label (displayed to users)';
Sample Data:
sql
-- RAM options (template_id = 1)
INSERT INTO attribute_template_options (template_id, option_value, display_label, display_order) 
VALUES
(1, '4', '4 GB', 1),
(1, '8', '8 GB', 2),
(1, '16', '16 GB', 3),
(1, '32', '32 GB', 4),
(1, '64', '64 GB', 5);


-- Color options with hex codes (template_id = 3)
INSERT INTO attribute_template_options (template_id, option_value, display_label, color_hex, display_order) 
VALUES
(3, 'black', 'Black', '#000000', 1),
(3, 'silver', 'Silver', '#C0C0C0', 2),
(3, 'gold', 'Gold', '#FFD700', 3),
(3, 'rose_gold', 'Rose Gold', '#B76E79', 4);


-- T-Shirt sizes (template_id = 10)
INSERT INTO attribute_template_options (template_id, option_value, display_label, display_order) 
VALUES
(10, 'xs', 'Extra Small (XS)', 1),
(10, 's', 'Small (S)', 2),
(10, 'm', 'Medium (M)', 3),
(10, 'l', 'Large (L)', 4),
(10, 'xl', 'Extra Large (XL)', 5),
(10, 'xxl', '2XL', 6),
(10, 'xxxl', '3XL', 7);
Bangla Explanation:
attribute_template_options select/multiselect attributes ‡¶è‡¶∞ choices define ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:
Structure:
* option_value - Database ‡¶è store ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º ("black", "8", "m")
* display_label - User ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡ßá ("Black", "8 GB", "Medium (M)")
* color_hex - Visual color picker ‡¶è ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø
* display_order - Dropdown ‡¶è ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® order ‡¶è show ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
Use Case:
sql
-- Get all RAM options for laptop
SELECT option_value, display_label
FROM attribute_template_options
WHERE template_id = (
    SELECT id FROM attribute_templates 
    WHERE category_id = 4 AND attribute_name = 'ram'
)
ORDER BY display_order;


-- Result:
-- option_value | display_label
-- 4            | 4 GB
-- 8            | 8 GB
-- 16           | 16 GB
-- 32           | 32 GB
4.3.4 products
Purpose: Core product information for items listed by vendors
sql
CREATE TABLE products (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Relationships
    vendor_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    category_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Basic Information
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    slug VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    sku VARCHAR(100),  -- Nullable for variable products
    
    -- Product Type
    type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'simple',
    
    -- Description
    description TEXT NOT NULL,
    short_description VARCHAR(500),
    
    -- Brand
    brand VARCHAR(100),
    
    -- Pricing (Simple Products)
    regular_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    sale_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    sale_start_date TIMESTAMP,
    sale_end_date TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Inventory (Simple Products Only)
    stock_quantity INT,
    low_stock_threshold INT DEFAULT 10,
    stock_status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'in_stock',
    backorder_allowed BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Physical Properties
    weight DECIMAL(8,2),  -- in kg
    dimensions JSONB,  -- {"length": 10, "width": 5, "height": 2, "unit": "cm"}
    
    -- Status
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'draft',
    visibility VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'visible',
    
    -- Features
    is_featured BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_new_arrival BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_best_seller BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Reviews
    reviews_enabled BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT TRUE,
    average_rating DECIMAL(3,2),
    total_reviews INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Sales Statistics
    total_sales INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    viewed_count INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- SEO
    seo_title VARCHAR(255),
    seo_description TEXT,
    seo_keywords VARCHAR(500),
    
    -- Additional Data
    tags JSONB,  -- ["electronics", "gaming", "laptop"]
    custom_fields JSONB,  -- Flexible key-value storage
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    published_at TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_products_vendor FOREIGN KEY (vendor_id) 
        REFERENCES vendors(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_products_category FOREIGN KEY (category_id) 
        REFERENCES categories(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT uq_products_slug UNIQUE (slug),
    CONSTRAINT uq_products_vendor_sku UNIQUE (vendor_id, sku) 
        WHERE sku IS NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_type CHECK (type IN ('simple', 'variable')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_status CHECK (status IN ('draft', 'active', 'inactive', 'out_of_stock')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_visibility CHECK (visibility IN ('visible', 'catalog', 'search', 'hidden')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_stock_status CHECK (stock_status IN ('in_stock', 'out_of_stock', 'on_backorder')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_prices CHECK (
        regular_price IS NULL OR regular_price >= 0
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_sale_price CHECK (
        sale_price IS NULL OR (sale_price >= 0 AND sale_price < regular_price)
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_stock CHECK (
        stock_quantity IS NULL OR stock_quantity >= 0
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_average_rating CHECK (
        average_rating IS NULL OR (average_rating >= 0 AND average_rating <= 5)
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_products_simple_required CHECK (
        (type = 'simple' AND sku IS NOT NULL AND regular_price IS NOT NULL AND stock_quantity IS NOT NULL) OR
        (type = 'variable' AND sku IS NULL AND regular_price IS NULL AND stock_quantity IS NULL)
    )
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_products_vendor ON products(vendor_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_category ON products(category_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_slug ON products(slug);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_sku ON products(sku) WHERE sku IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_products_type ON products(type);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_status ON products(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_created ON products(created_at);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_published ON products(published_at) WHERE published_at IS NOT NULL;


-- Partial indexes for common queries
CREATE INDEX idx_products_active ON products(vendor_id, created_at) 
WHERE status = 'active' AND deleted_at IS NULL;


CREATE INDEX idx_products_featured ON products(category_id) 
WHERE is_featured = TRUE AND status = 'active';


CREATE INDEX idx_products_new_arrivals ON products(published_at DESC) 
WHERE is_new_arrival = TRUE AND status = 'active';


CREATE INDEX idx_products_best_sellers ON products(total_sales DESC) 
WHERE is_best_seller = TRUE AND status = 'active';


CREATE INDEX idx_products_on_sale ON products(sale_price) 
WHERE sale_price IS NOT NULL 
  AND (sale_start_date IS NULL OR sale_start_date <= NOW())
  AND (sale_end_date IS NULL OR sale_end_date >= NOW())
  AND status = 'active';


-- Full-text search index
CREATE INDEX idx_products_search ON products 
USING gin(to_tsvector('english', name || ' ' || COALESCE(description, '') || ' ' || COALESCE(brand, '')));


-- JSONB indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_products_tags ON products USING gin(tags);
CREATE INDEX idx_products_dimensions ON products USING gin(dimensions);


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE products IS 'Core product catalog - supports both simple and variable products';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.type IS 'simple = single SKU/price/stock, variable = multiple variants';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.sku IS 'Stock Keeping Unit - NULL for variable products, required for simple';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.stock_status IS 'Calculated from stock_quantity: in_stock, out_of_stock, on_backorder';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.visibility IS 'visible = all, catalog = only in listings, search = only in search, hidden = none';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.dimensions IS 'JSON: {"length": 30, "width": 20, "height": 10, "unit": "cm"}';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.tags IS 'JSON array: ["tag1", "tag2"]';
COMMENT ON COLUMN products.average_rating IS 'Calculated from approved reviews (updated by trigger)';
Field Descriptions:
Column
	Type
	Null
	Default
	Description
	id
	BIGSERIAL
	NO
	AUTO
	Unique product identifier
	vendor_id
	BIGINT
	NO
	-
	Owner vendor reference
	category_id
	BIGINT
	NO
	-
	Product category
	name
	VARCHAR(255)
	NO
	-
	Product title
	slug
	VARCHAR(255)
	NO
	-
	URL-friendly unique identifier
	sku
	VARCHAR(100)
	YES
	NULL
	Stock Keeping Unit (NULL for variable)
	type
	VARCHAR(20)
	NO
	simple
	Product type: simple or variable
	description
	TEXT
	NO
	-
	Full product description (supports HTML)
	regular_price
	DECIMAL(10,2)
	YES
	NULL
	Standard price (NULL for variable)
	sale_price
	DECIMAL(10,2)
	YES
	NULL
	Discounted price (optional)
	stock_quantity
	INT
	YES
	NULL
	Available inventory (NULL for variable)
	stock_status
	VARCHAR(20)
	NO
	in_stock
	Stock availability status
	weight
	DECIMAL(8,2)
	YES
	NULL
	Product weight in kg
	dimensions
	JSONB
	YES
	NULL
	Length, width, height in JSON
	status
	VARCHAR(20)
	NO
	draft
	Publication status
	is_featured
	BOOLEAN
	NO
	FALSE
	Featured product flag (admin only)
	average_rating
	DECIMAL(3,2)
	YES
	NULL
	Average review rating (0-5)
	total_reviews
	INT
	NO
	0
	Count of approved reviews
	total_sales
	INT
	NO
	0
	Lifetime units sold
	viewed_count
	INT
	NO
	0
	Total product views
	Sample Data:
sql
-- Simple Product: MacBook Pro
INSERT INTO products (
    vendor_id, category_id, name, slug, sku, type,
    description, brand, regular_price, sale_price,
    stock_quantity, low_stock_threshold, weight,
    dimensions, status, published_at
) VALUES (
    1, 4, -- vendor_id=1, category_id=4 (Laptops)
    'MacBook Pro 14" M3 Pro',
    'macbook-pro-14-m3-pro',
    'MBP-14-M3-001',
    'simple',
    'The 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro chip delivers exceptional performance...',
    'Apple',
    2499.00,
    2299.00, -- On sale
    15, -- 15 units in stock
    5,  -- Low stock alert at 5
    1.60, -- 1.6 kg
    '{"length": 31.26, "width": 22.12, "height": 1.55, "unit": "cm"}'::jsonb,
    'active',
    NOW()
);


-- Variable Product: iPhone 15 Pro
INSERT INTO products (
    vendor_id, category_id, name, slug, type,
    description, brand, status, published_at
) VALUES (
    1, 5, -- category_id=5 (Smartphones)
    'iPhone 15 Pro',
    'iphone-15-pro',
    'variable',
    'Experience the power of A17 Pro chip with titanium design...',
    'Apple',
    'active',
    NOW()
);


-- Simple Product: T-Shirt
INSERT INTO products (
    vendor_id, category_id, name, slug, sku, type,
    description, brand, regular_price,
    stock_quantity, weight, status, published_at
) VALUES (
    2, 6, -- vendor_id=2, category_id=6 (T-Shirts)
    'Classic Cotton T-Shirt',
    'classic-cotton-tshirt-blue',
    'TSHIRT-BLUE-M-001',
    'simple',
    '100% cotton, comfortable fit, machine washable',
    'FashionBrand',
    19.99,
    100,
    0.20, -- 200g
    'active',
    NOW()
);
Bangla Explanation:
products table ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶á types ‡¶è‡¶∞ products support ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:
Simple Products
* ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ SKU, ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ price, ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ stock quantity
* Example: Specific laptop model (MacBook Pro 14" with exact specs)
* Required fields: sku, regular_price, stock_quantity
Variable Products
* Multiple variants, each with own SKU/price/stock
* Example: iPhone 15 Pro (different storage: 128GB/256GB/512GB, different colors)
* Parent product: sku=NULL, regular_price=NULL, stock_quantity=NULL
* Actual selling happens through variants (product_variants table)
Stock Status
Automatically calculated:
sql
-- in_stock: stock_quantity > 0
-- out_of_stock: stock_quantity = 0
-- on_backorder: stock_quantity = 0 AND backorder_allowed = TRUE
Pricing Logic
sql
-- Current effective price
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN sale_price IS NOT NULL 
             AND (sale_start_date IS NULL OR sale_start_date <= NOW())
             AND (sale_end_date IS NULL OR sale_end_date >= NOW())
        THEN sale_price
        ELSE regular_price
    END as current_price
FROM products;
Visibility Options
* visible - Shown everywhere (catalog + search + direct link)
* catalog - Only in category/vendor listings (not in search)
* search - Only in search results (not in listings)
* hidden - Not shown anywhere (draft, discontinued)
4.3.5 product_variants
Purpose: Store variants for variable products (different SKU/price/stock combinations)
sql
CREATE TABLE product_variants (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Product Relationship
    product_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Variant Identification
    sku VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    
    -- Pricing
    regular_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    sale_price DECIMAL(10,2),
    
    -- Inventory
    stock_quantity INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    low_stock_threshold INT DEFAULT 10,
    
    -- Variant Attributes (Denormalized for Performance)
    variant_attributes JSONB NOT NULL,  -- {"ram": "16GB", "storage": "512GB", "color": "Silver"}
    
    -- Physical Properties (if different from parent)
    weight DECIMAL(8,2),
    dimensions JSONB,
    
    -- Images (variant-specific)
    image_urls JSONB,  -- ["url1.jpg", "url2.jpg"]
    
    -- Status
    is_active BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT TRUE,
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'in_stock',
    
    -- Ordering (display priority)
    display_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Statistics
    total_sales INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_product_variants_product FOREIGN KEY (product_id) 
        REFERENCES products(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT uq_product_variants_sku UNIQUE (sku),
    CONSTRAINT uq_product_variants_attributes UNIQUE (product_id, variant_attributes),
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_variants_prices CHECK (regular_price >= 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_variants_sale_price CHECK (
        sale_price IS NULL OR (sale_price >= 0 AND sale_price < regular_price)
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_variants_stock CHECK (stock_quantity >= 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_variants_status CHECK (status IN ('in_stock', 'out_of_stock', 'discontinued'))
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_product ON product_variants(product_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_sku ON product_variants(sku);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_status ON product_variants(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_active ON product_variants(is_active);


-- Partial index for in-stock variants
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_available ON product_variants(product_id) 
WHERE is_active = TRUE AND status = 'in_stock';


-- JSONB index for attribute queries
CREATE INDEX idx_product_variants_attributes ON product_variants USING gin(variant_attributes);


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE product_variants IS 'Product variations with unique SKU, price, and inventory';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_variants.variant_attributes IS 'JSON object with attribute name-value pairs defining this variant';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_variants.image_urls IS 'Variant-specific images (e.g., actual color photos)';
COMMENT ON CONSTRAINT uq_product_variants_attributes ON product_variants 
IS 'Ensures no duplicate variant combinations for same product';
Sample Data:
sql
-- iPhone 15 Pro Variants (product_id = 2)
INSERT INTO product_variants (
    product_id, sku, regular_price, sale_price, stock_quantity,
    variant_attributes, image_urls
) VALUES
-- 128GB Natural Titanium
(2, 'IPHONE15PRO-128GB-NATURAL', 999.00, NULL, 25,
 '{"storage": "128GB", "color": "Natural Titanium"}'::jsonb,
 '["iphone-natural-1.jpg", "iphone-natural-2.jpg"]'::jsonb),


-- 128GB Blue Titanium
(2, 'IPHONE15PRO-128GB-BLUE', 999.00, NULL, 30,
 '{"storage": "128GB", "color": "Blue Titanium"}'::jsonb,
 '["iphone-blue-1.jpg", "iphone-blue-2.jpg"]'::jsonb),


-- 256GB Natural Titanium
(2, 'IPHONE15PRO-256GB-NATURAL', 1099.00, NULL, 20,
 '{"storage": "256GB", "color": "Natural Titanium"}'::jsonb,
 '["iphone-natural-1.jpg", "iphone-natural-2.jpg"]'::jsonb),


-- 512GB Blue Titanium
(2, 'IPHONE15PRO-512GB-BLUE', 1299.00, 1249.00, 15,
 '{"storage": "512GB", "color": "Blue Titanium"}'::jsonb,
 '["iphone-blue-1.jpg", "iphone-blue-2.jpg"]'::jsonb);


-- T-Shirt Variants (product_id with variable type)
INSERT INTO product_variants (
    product_id, sku, regular_price, stock_quantity,
    variant_attributes
) VALUES
(10, 'TSHIRT-BLUE-S', 19.99, 50, '{"size": "S", "color": "Blue"}'::jsonb),
(10, 'TSHIRT-BLUE-M', 19.99, 100, '{"size": "M", "color": "Blue"}'::jsonb),
(10, 'TSHIRT-BLUE-L', 19.99, 75, '{"size": "L", "color": "Blue"}'::jsonb),
(10, 'TSHIRT-RED-M', 19.99, 80, '{"size": "M", "color": "Red"}'::jsonb),
(10, 'TSHIRT-RED-L', 19.99, 60, '{"size": "L", "color": "Red"}'::jsonb);
Querying Variants:
sql
-- Get all variants for a product with attribute labels
SELECT 
    pv.id,
    pv.sku,
    pv.regular_price,
    pv.sale_price,
    pv.stock_quantity,
    pv.variant_attributes,
    -- Extract specific attributes
    pv.variant_attributes->>'storage' as storage,
    pv.variant_attributes->>'color' as color,
    pv.variant_attributes->>'size' as size
FROM product_variants pv
WHERE pv.product_id = 2
  AND pv.is_active = TRUE
ORDER BY pv.display_order, pv.regular_price;


-- Find variant by specific attributes
SELECT * FROM product_variants
WHERE product_id = 2
  AND variant_attributes @> '{"storage": "256GB", "color": "Blue Titanium"}'::jsonb;


-- Get price range for a variable product
SELECT 
    MIN(COALESCE(sale_price, regular_price)) as min_price,
    MAX(COALESCE(sale_price, regular_price)) as max_price,
    COUNT(*) as variant_count,
    SUM(stock_quantity) as total_stock
FROM product_variants
WHERE product_id = 2
  AND is_active = TRUE
  AND status = 'in_stock';


-- Get available attribute combinations
SELECT DISTINCT 
    variant_attributes->>'storage' as storage
FROM product_variants
WHERE product_id = 2
  AND is_active = TRUE
  AND status = 'in_stock'
ORDER BY storage;

Bangla Explanation:

product_variants variable products ‡¶è‡¶∞ different combinations store ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

### Variant Generation

Product has variant attributes: RAM (8GB/16GB) √ó Storage (256GB/512GB)

Generates 4 variants:

1. 8GB + 256GB  ‚Üí SKU: LAPTOP-8-256
2. 8GB + 512GB  ‚Üí SKU: LAPTOP-8-512
3. 16GB + 256GB ‚Üí SKU: LAPTOP-16-256
4. 16GB + 512GB ‚Üí SKU: LAPTOP-16-512
Variant Attributes (JSONB)
Stored as JSON object for flexibility:
json
{
  "ram": "16GB",
  "storage": "512GB",
  "color": "Silver"
}
Benefits:
* Flexible - Any number of attributes
* Queryable - Can filter by specific values
* Indexable - GIN index for fast queries
Unique Constraint
uq_product_variants_attributes prevents duplicate combinations:
sql
-- First insert: OK
INSERT ... variant_attributes = '{"ram": "8GB", "storage": "256GB"}'


-- Second insert: ERROR (duplicate)
INSERT ... variant_attributes = '{"ram": "8GB", "storage": "256GB"}'
Price Range Display
sql
-- Frontend shows: $999 - $1,299
SELECT 
    CONCAT('$', MIN(regular_price), ' - $', MAX(regular_price)) as price_range
FROM product_variants
WHERE product_id = 2;
4.3.6 product_images
Purpose: Multiple images per product with different sizes
sql
CREATE TABLE product_images (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Product Relationship
    product_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Image Files
    filename VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    original_url VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
    thumbnail_url VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,  -- 150x150
    small_url VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,      -- 300x300
    medium_url VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,     -- 600x600
    large_url VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,      -- 1200x1200
    
    -- Image Metadata
    alt_text VARCHAR(255),
    file_size BIGINT NOT NULL,  -- In bytes
    mime_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    width INT,
    height INT,
    
    -- Display
    sort_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    is_primary BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_product_images_product FOREIGN KEY (product_id) 
        REFERENCES products(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT uq_product_images_primary UNIQUE (product_id, is_primary) 
        WHERE is_primary = TRUE,
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_images_file_size CHECK (file_size > 0 AND file_size <= 5242880),  -- Max 5MB
    CONSTRAINT ck_product_images_mime CHECK (mime_type IN ('image/jpeg', 'image/jpg', 'image/png', 'image/webp'))
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_product_images_product ON product_images(product_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_images_sort ON product_images(product_id, sort_order);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_images_primary ON product_images(product_id, is_primary) 
WHERE is_primary = TRUE;


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE product_images IS 'Product images in multiple sizes for responsive display';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_images.original_url IS 'Full-resolution uploaded image (preserved for future reprocessing)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_images.is_primary IS 'Primary product image (only one per product)';
COMMENT ON CONSTRAINT uq_product_images_primary ON product_images 
IS 'Ensures only one primary image per product';
Sample Data:
sql
INSERT INTO product_images (
    product_id, filename, original_url, thumbnail_url, small_url, 
    medium_url, large_url, alt_text, file_size, mime_type,
    width, height, sort_order, is_primary
) VALUES
-- MacBook Pro - Primary Image
(1, 'macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/original/macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/thumb/macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/small/macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/medium/macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/large/macbook-pro-14-front.jpg',
 'MacBook Pro 14 inch M3 Pro - Front View',
 1048576, 'image/jpeg', 3000, 2000, 1, TRUE),


-- MacBook Pro - Additional Images
(1, 'macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/original/macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/thumb/macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/small/macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/medium/macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/large/macbook-pro-14-side.jpg',
 'MacBook Pro 14 inch - Side Profile',
 987654, 'image/jpeg', 3000, 2000, 2, FALSE),


(1, 'macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/original/macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/thumb/macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/small/macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/medium/macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 's3://bucket/products/1/large/macbook-pro-14-keyboard.jpg',
 'MacBook Pro 14 inch - Keyboard Close-up',
 876543, 'image/jpeg', 3000, 2000, 3, FALSE);
Image Processing Workflow:
php
// app/Services/Media/ImageService.php


public function processProductImage(UploadedFile $file, int $productId): ProductImage
{
    // Generate unique filename
    $filename = Str::uuid() . '.' . $file->getClientOriginalExtension();
    $basePath = "products/{$productId}";
    
    // Read original image
    $image = Image::make($file);
    $originalWidth = $image->width();
    $originalHeight = $image->height();
    
    // Define sizes
    $sizes = [
        'original' => null,  // No resize
        'large'    => 1200,
        'medium'   => 600,
        'small'    => 300,
        'thumbnail' => 150,
    ];
    
    $urls = [];
    
    foreach ($sizes as $size => $dimension) {
        $img = clone $image;
        
        if ($dimension) {
            // Resize maintaining aspect ratio
            $img->resize($dimension, $dimension, function ($constraint) {
                $constraint->aspectRatio();
                $constraint->upsize();  // Don't upscale small images
            });
        }
        
        // Optimize and convert to WebP
        $img->encode('webp', 85);
        
        // Upload to S3
        $path = "{$basePath}/{$size}/{$filename}.webp";
        Storage::disk('s3')->put($path, (string) $img, 'public');
        
        $urls[$size] = Storage::disk('s3')->url($path);
    }
    
    // Create database record
    return ProductImage::create([
        'product_id' => $productId,
        'filename' => $filename,
        'original_url' => $urls['original'],
        'large_url' => $urls['large'],
        'medium_url' => $urls['medium'],
        'small_url' => $urls['small'],
        'thumbnail_url' => $urls['thumbnail'],
        'file_size' => $file->getSize(),
        'mime_type' => 'image/webp',
        'width' => $originalWidth,
        'height' => $originalHeight,
        'sort_order' => ProductImage::where('product_id', $productId)->count() + 1,
    ]);
}
Bangla Explanation:
product_images multiple sizes ‡¶è images store ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá responsive display ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶ú‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø:
Image Sizes
* original - Full resolution (3000√ó2000) - Archive/future use
* large - 1200√ó1200 - Product detail page zoom
* medium - 600√ó600 - Product detail main image
* small - 300√ó300 - Product grid/listings
* thumbnail - 150√ó150 - Cart, order summaries
Responsive Image Usage
html
<!-- Frontend HTML -->
<img 
  src="{{ $product->primary_image->medium_url }}"
  srcset="
    {{ $product->primary_image->small_url }} 300w,
    {{ $product->primary_image->medium_url }} 600w,
    {{ $product->primary_image->large_url }} 1200w
  "
  sizes="(max-width: 600px) 300px, (max-width: 1200px) 600px, 1200px"
  alt="{{ $product->primary_image->alt_text }}"
/>
Primary Image
* Only one image can be is_primary = TRUE
* Used as product thumbnail everywhere
* Unique constraint enforces this
Sort Order
sql
-- Reorder images (drag-and-drop in admin)
UPDATE product_images SET sort_order = 1 WHERE id = 5;
UPDATE product_images SET sort_order = 2 WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE product_images SET sort_order = 3 WHERE id = 1;


-- Get ordered images
SELECT * FROM product_images
WHERE product_id = 1
ORDER BY sort_order;
4.3.7 product_attributes
Purpose: Store actual attribute values for products based on templates
sql
CREATE TABLE product_attributes (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Relationships
    product_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    template_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Attribute Value
    attribute_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Denormalized for Performance
    attribute_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    attribute_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    is_variant BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_product_attrs_product FOREIGN KEY (product_id) 
        REFERENCES products(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_product_attrs_template FOREIGN KEY (template_id) 
        REFERENCES attribute_templates(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT uq_product_attrs_product_template UNIQUE (product_id, template_id)
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_product_attrs_product ON product_attributes(product_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_attrs_template ON product_attributes(template_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_attrs_name ON product_attributes(attribute_name);
CREATE INDEX idx_product_attrs_variant ON product_attributes(is_variant) 
WHERE is_variant = TRUE;


-- GIN index for searching attribute values
CREATE INDEX idx_product_attrs_value ON product_attributes USING gin(to_tsvector('english', attribute_value));


COMMENT ON TABLE product_attributes IS 'Actual product attribute values based on category templates';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_attributes.attribute_value IS 'Stored as text; parse based on attribute_type';
COMMENT ON COLUMN product_attributes.is_variant IS 'Copied from template; indicates if this creates variants';
Sample Data:
sql
-- MacBook Pro Attributes (product_id = 1)
INSERT INTO product_attributes (
    product_id, template_id, attribute_value, 
    attribute_name, attribute_type, is_variant
) VALUES
-- Variant attributes (create different SKUs for variable products)
(1, 1, '16', 'ram', 'select', FALSE),  -- Simple product, not variant
(1, 2, '512', 'storage', 'select', FALSE),
(1, 3, 'Silver', 'color', 'select', FALSE),


-- Non-variant attributes (informational only)
(1, 4, 'Apple M3 Pro (12-core CPU, 18-core GPU)', 'processor', 'text', FALSE),
(1, 5, '14.2', 'screen_size', 'number', FALSE),
(1, 6, 'true', 'has_touchscreen', 'boolean', FALSE),
(1, 7, '1.60', 'weight', 'number', FALSE);


-- T-Shirt Attributes (variable product)
-- Parent product doesn't have variant attributes
-- Only non-variant attributes
INSERT INTO product_attributes (
    product_id, template_id, attribute_value,
    attribute_name, attribute_type, is_variant
) VALUES
(10, 20, '100% Cotton', 'material', 'select', FALSE),
(10, 21, 'Solid', 'pattern', 'select', FALSE),
(10, 22, 'Machine Wash', 'care_instructions', 'text', FALSE);
Querying Product with Attributes:
sql
-- Get product with all attributes
SELECT 
    p.id,
    p.name,
    p.regular_price,
    json_agg(
        json_build_object(
            'name', pa.attribute_name,
            'value', pa.attribute_value,
            'type', pa.attribute_type,
            'is_variant', pa.is_variant
        ) ORDER BY pa.attribute_name
    ) as attributes
FROM products p
LEFT JOIN product_attributes pa ON p.id = pa.product_id
WHERE p.id = 1
GROUP BY p.id, p.name, p.regular_price;


-- Filter products by attribute
-- Find all laptops with 16GB RAM
SELECT DISTINCT p.*
FROM products p
JOIN product_attributes pa ON p.id = pa.product_id
JOIN attribute_templates at ON pa.template_id = at.id
WHERE p.category_id = 4  -- Laptops
  AND at.attribute_name = 'ram'
  AND pa.attribute_value = '16';


-- Get filterable attributes for category
SELECT DISTINCT
    at.attribute_name,
    at.display_label,
    at.attribute_type,
    json_agg(DISTINCT pa.attribute_value ORDER BY pa.attribute_value) as available_values
FROM attribute_templates at
JOIN product_attributes pa ON at.id = pa.template_id
JOIN products p ON pa.product_id = p.id
WHERE p.category_id = 4
  AND at.is_filterable = TRUE
  AND p.status = 'active'
GROUP BY at.id, at.attribute_name, at.display_label, at.attribute_type
ORDER BY at.display_order;


-- Result for Laptops category:
-- {
--   "ram": ["4", "8", "16", "32"],
--   "storage": ["256", "512", "1024"],
--   "screen_size": ["13.3", "14.2", "15.6", "16.0"]
-- }

Bangla Explanation:

product_attributes actual product ‡¶è‡¶∞ attribute values store ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

### Template-Based System

1. Category defines templates (what attributes are possible)

2. Product assigns values to those templates (actual product specs)

Example:

Laptop Category Templates:
  - RAM (select): 4GB, 8GB, 16GB, 32GB
  - Processor (text): Any text
  - Has Touchscreen (boolean): Yes/No


MacBook Pro Product Attributes:
  - RAM = "16"  (selected from template options)
  - Processor = "Apple M3 Pro"  (free text)
  - Has Touchscreen = "false"
Variant vs Non-Variant
* Variant Attributes (Variable products only)
   * Create different SKUs (size, color, storage)
   * Stored in product_variants.variant_attributes
* Non-Variant Attributes (All products)
   * Informational specs (processor, weight, screen size)
   * Stored in product_attributes table
Denormalization
attribute_name, attribute_type, is_variant copied from template:
* Why: Avoid JOIN on every query
* Trade-off: Slight data duplication for major performance gain
Filter Sidebar Generation
sql
-- Generate dynamic filters for category page
Category: Laptops
Filters available:
  RAM: ‚ñ° 4GB  ‚ñ° 8GB  ‚òë 16GB  ‚ñ° 32GB
  Storage: ‚ñ° 256GB  ‚òë 512GB  ‚ñ° 1TB
  Screen Size: ‚ñ° 13"  ‚òë 14"  ‚ñ° 15"  ‚ñ° 16"
  Has Touchscreen: ‚òë Yes  ‚ñ° No
4.4 Order Management Tables
4.4.1 orders
Purpose: Customer purchase transactions with multi-vendor support
sqlCREATE TABLE orders (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Order Identification
    order_number VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    
    -- Customer Relationship
    customer_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Address References
    shipping_address_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    billing_address_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Order Status
    order_status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    payment_status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    
    -- Pricing
    subtotal DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    tax DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    shipping_charge DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    discount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    total DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    
    -- Payment Information
    payment_method VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    
    -- Shipping Information
    shipping_method VARCHAR(100),
    tracking_number VARCHAR(100),
    estimated_delivery_date DATE,
    delivered_at TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Coupon
    coupon_code VARCHAR(50),
    
    -- Notes
    customer_notes TEXT,
    admin_notes TEXT,
    
    -- Cancellation
    cancelled_at TIMESTAMP,
    cancelled_by BIGINT,  -- user_id who cancelled
    cancellation_reason TEXT,
    
    -- Multi-Vendor Support
    vendor_count INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 1,
    is_multi_vendor BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- IP Tracking
    customer_ip INET,
    user_agent TEXT,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_orders_customer FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) 
        REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_orders_shipping_address FOREIGN KEY (shipping_address_id) 
        REFERENCES addresses(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_orders_billing_address FOREIGN KEY (billing_address_id) 
        REFERENCES addresses(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_orders_cancelled_by FOREIGN KEY (cancelled_by) 
        REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    CONSTRAINT uq_orders_number UNIQUE (order_number),
    CONSTRAINT ck_orders_status CHECK (order_status IN 
        ('pending', 'processing', 'shipped', 'delivered', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'refunded')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_orders_payment_status CHECK (payment_status IN 
        ('pending', 'authorized', 'paid', 'failed', 'refunded', 'partially_refunded')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_orders_payment_method CHECK (payment_method IN 
        ('stripe_card', 'paypal', 'cash_on_delivery')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_orders_amounts CHECK (
        subtotal >= 0 AND 
        tax >= 0 AND 
        shipping_charge >= 0 AND 
        discount >= 0 AND 
        total >= 0 AND
        total = (subtotal + tax + shipping_charge - discount)
    )
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_order_number ON orders(order_number);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_customer ON orders(customer_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_status ON orders(order_status);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_payment_status ON orders(payment_status);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_created ON orders(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_transaction ON orders(transaction_id) WHERE transaction_id IS NOT NULL;


-- Composite indexes for common queries
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_customer_status ON orders(customer_id, order_status);
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_customer_created ON orders(customer_id, created_at DESC);


-- Partial indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_pending ON orders(created_at) 
WHERE order_status = 'pending' AND payment_status = 'paid';


CREATE INDEX idx_orders_processing ON orders(created_at) 
WHERE order_status = 'processing';


CREATE INDEX idx_orders_cancelled ON orders(cancelled_at) 
WHERE order_status = 'cancelled';


-- Full-text search on order number
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_number_search ON orders 
USING gin(to_tsvector('simple', order_number));


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE orders IS 'Customer orders with multi-vendor support';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.order_number IS 'Human-readable unique order identifier (format: ORD-YYYYMMDD-####)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.order_status IS 'Order fulfillment status (overall status across all vendors)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.payment_status IS 'Payment processing status';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.vendor_count IS 'Number of different vendors in this order';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.is_multi_vendor IS 'TRUE if order contains items from multiple vendors';
COMMENT ON COLUMN orders.total IS 'Final amount charged = subtotal + tax + shipping - discount';
Order Number Generation Function:
sqlCREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_order_number()
RETURNS TEXT AS $$
DECLARE
    date_part TEXT;
    sequence_number INT;
    order_number TEXT;
BEGIN
    -- Get current date in YYYYMMDD format
    date_part := TO_CHAR(NOW(), 'YYYYMMDD');
    
    -- Get next sequence number for today
    SELECT COUNT(*) + 1 INTO sequence_number
    FROM orders
    WHERE DATE(created_at) = CURRENT_DATE;
    
    -- Format: ORD-20260213-0001
    order_number := 'ORD-' || date_part || '-' || LPAD(sequence_number::TEXT, 4, '0');
    
    RETURN order_number;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;


-- Trigger to auto-generate order number
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION trigger_generate_order_number()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
BEGIN
    IF NEW.order_number IS NULL OR NEW.order_number = '' THEN
        NEW.order_number := generate_order_number();
    END IF;
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;


CREATE TRIGGER before_insert_order_number
BEFORE INSERT ON orders
FOR EACH ROW
EXECUTE FUNCTION trigger_generate_order_number();
Sample Data:
sql-- Single vendor order
INSERT INTO orders (
    customer_id, shipping_address_id, billing_address_id,
    order_status, payment_status, payment_method,
    subtotal, tax, shipping_charge, discount, total,
    shipping_method, customer_ip
) VALUES (
    1, 1, 1,  -- customer_id, shipping_address_id, billing_address_id
    'pending', 'paid', 'stripe_card',
    2299.00,  -- subtotal
    229.90,   -- tax (10%)
    15.00,    -- shipping
    0.00,     -- discount
    2543.90,  -- total
    'Standard Shipping (3-5 days)',
    '192.168.1.100'
);
-- order_number will be auto-generated: ORD-20260213-0001


-- Multi-vendor order
INSERT INTO orders (
    customer_id, shipping_address_id, billing_address_id,
    order_status, payment_status, payment_method,
    subtotal, tax, shipping_charge, discount, total,
    vendor_count, is_multi_vendor, coupon_code,
    customer_notes
) VALUES (
    2, 2, 2,
    'processing', 'paid', 'paypal',
    459.98,   -- subtotal
    45.99,    -- tax
    20.00,    -- shipping
    45.99,    -- discount (10% coupon)
    480.00,   -- total
    2,        -- 2 vendors
    TRUE,
    'SAVE10',
    'Please deliver between 9 AM - 5 PM'
);
-- order_number: ORD-20260213-0002

orders table customer purchases track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

### Order Number Format

ORD-20260213-0001
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ        ‚îî‚îÄ Sequence (daily reset)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Date (YYYYMMDD)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Prefix

Benefits:

  • Human-readable - Easy to reference in support
  • Sequential - Auto-incrementing daily
  • Unique - Cannot duplicate
  • Sortable - Chronological ordering

### Order Status Flow

pending ‚Üí processing ‚Üí shipped ‚Üí delivered ‚Üí completed
   ‚îÇ                                             ‚îÇ
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí cancelled ‚Üê‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò


pending - Order placed, awaiting vendor action
processing - Vendor preparing items
shipped - Items dispatched, tracking available
delivered - Customer received items
completed - Order finalized (after return window)
cancelled - Order cancelled (customer/vendor/admin)
refunded - Full refund issued


Payment Status


pending - Payment not yet processed
authorized - Payment authorized, not captured
paid - Payment successful
failed - Payment declined
refunded - Full refund
partially_refunded - Partial refund


Multi-Vendor Orders
Single order can have items from multiple vendors:
sql-- Order #ORD-20260213-0002
-- Item 1: Laptop from Vendor A
-- Item 2: Mouse from Vendor B
-- Item 3: Keyboard from Vendor B


-- Order record shows:
vendor_count = 2
is_multi_vendor = TRUE


-- Each vendor fulfills independently
-- Overall order_status = least progressed vendor
Price Calculation
sqltotal = subtotal + tax + shipping_charge - discount


Example:
subtotal = $2,299.00  (sum of all items)
tax = $229.90         (10% tax rate)
shipping = $15.00     (standard shipping)
discount = $0.00      (no coupon)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
total = $2,543.90
Constraint Check
Database enforces calculation accuracy:
sqlCONSTRAINT ck_orders_amounts CHECK (
    total = (subtotal + tax + shipping_charge - discount)
)


-- Invalid insert will fail:
INSERT INTO orders (subtotal, tax, shipping_charge, discount, total)
VALUES (100, 10, 5, 0, 100);  -- ERROR: total should be 115
4.4.2 order_items
Purpose: Individual line items within orders (products ordered)
sqlCREATE TABLE order_items (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Order Relationship
    order_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Product References
    product_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    variant_id BIGINT,
    
    -- Vendor (for multi-vendor orders)
    vendor_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Product Snapshot (at time of purchase)
    product_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    product_sku VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    variant_attributes JSONB,  -- {"ram": "16GB", "color": "Silver"}
    
    -- Pricing
    quantity INT NOT NULL,
    unit_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    total_price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    tax_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    
    -- Item-Level Status (for multi-vendor)
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    
    -- Shipping (allocated per item)
    shipping_cost DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    
    -- Commission Tracking
    commission_rate DECIMAL(5,2),
    commission_amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    
    -- Notes
    vendor_notes TEXT,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_order_items_order FOREIGN KEY (order_id) 
        REFERENCES orders(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_order_items_product FOREIGN KEY (product_id) 
        REFERENCES products(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_order_items_variant FOREIGN KEY (variant_id) 
        REFERENCES product_variants(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_order_items_vendor FOREIGN KEY (vendor_id) 
        REFERENCES vendors(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT ck_order_items_quantity CHECK (quantity > 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_order_items_unit_price CHECK (unit_price >= 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_order_items_total_price CHECK (total_price = quantity * unit_price),
    CONSTRAINT ck_order_items_status CHECK (status IN 
        ('pending', 'processing', 'shipped', 'delivered', 'cancelled', 'refunded'))
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_order ON order_items(order_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_product ON order_items(product_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_variant ON order_items(variant_id) WHERE variant_id IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_vendor ON order_items(vendor_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_status ON order_items(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_sku ON order_items(product_sku);


-- Composite index for vendor order management
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_vendor_status ON order_items(vendor_id, status);


-- JSONB index for variant attributes
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_variant_attrs ON order_items USING gin(variant_attributes);


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE order_items IS 'Line items within orders - individual products purchased';
COMMENT ON COLUMN order_items.product_name IS 'Snapshot of product name at time of purchase (preserved if product renamed)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN order_items.product_sku IS 'SKU at time of purchase (preserved if product deleted)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN order_items.variant_attributes IS 'Variant details at purchase (e.g., {"size": "L", "color": "Blue"})';
COMMENT ON COLUMN order_items.status IS 'Item-level status (can differ from order status in multi-vendor orders)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN order_items.commission_rate IS 'Commission percentage applied at time of order';
Sample Data:
sql-- Order #1 Items (Single Vendor)
INSERT INTO order_items (
    order_id, product_id, variant_id, vendor_id,
    product_name, product_sku, variant_attributes,
    quantity, unit_price, total_price, tax_amount,
    status, commission_rate, commission_amount
) VALUES
-- MacBook Pro
(1, 1, NULL, 1,  -- Simple product, no variant
 'MacBook Pro 14" M3 Pro',
 'MBP-14-M3-001',
 NULL,
 1,         -- quantity
 2299.00,   -- unit_price
 2299.00,   -- total_price
 229.90,    -- tax
 'pending',
 12.50,     -- 12.5% commission
 287.38);   -- commission amount


-- Order #2 Items (Multi-Vendor)
INSERT INTO order_items (
    order_id, product_id, variant_id, vendor_id,
    product_name, product_sku, variant_attributes,
    quantity, unit_price, total_price, tax_amount,
    status, shipping_cost
) VALUES
-- iPhone from Vendor A
(2, 2, 5, 1,  -- Variable product with variant
 'iPhone 15 Pro',
 'IPHONE15PRO-256GB-BLUE',
 '{"storage": "256GB", "color": "Blue Titanium"}'::jsonb,
 1, 1099.00, 1099.00, 109.90,
 'processing', 10.00),


-- Headphones from Vendor B
(2, 15, NULL, 2,
 'Premium Wireless Headphones',
 'HEADPHONES-BLK-001',
 NULL,
 2, 149.99, 299.98, 30.00,
 'processing', 10.00);
Querying Order Items:
sql-- Get order with items grouped by vendor
SELECT 
    o.order_number,
    o.customer_id,
    v.business_name as vendor_name,
    COUNT(oi.id) as item_count,
    SUM(oi.quantity) as total_quantity,
    SUM(oi.total_price) as vendor_subtotal,
    SUM(oi.shipping_cost) as vendor_shipping,
    json_agg(
        json_build_object(
            'product_name', oi.product_name,
            'sku', oi.product_sku,
            'quantity', oi.quantity,
            'unit_price', oi.unit_price,
            'total', oi.total_price,
            'variant', oi.variant_attributes,
            'status', oi.status
        )
    ) as items
FROM orders o
JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
JOIN vendors v ON oi.vendor_id = v.id
WHERE o.id = 2
GROUP BY o.id, o.order_number, o.customer_id, v.id, v.business_name;


-- Find best-selling products
SELECT 
    p.name,
    p.sku,
    SUM(oi.quantity) as units_sold,
    COUNT(DISTINCT oi.order_id) as order_count,
    SUM(oi.total_price) as revenue
FROM order_items oi
JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
JOIN orders o ON oi.order_id = o.id
WHERE o.payment_status = 'paid'
  AND o.created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
GROUP BY p.id, p.name, p.sku
ORDER BY units_sold DESC
LIMIT 10;
order_items order ‡¶è‡¶∞ individual products track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:
Snapshot Concept
Order time ‡¶è product details capture ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ (‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶£ future ‡¶è change ‡¶π‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá):
sql-- Order placed: Feb 13, 2026
product_name = "MacBook Pro 14" M3 Pro"
product_sku = "MBP-14-M3-001"
unit_price = $2,299.00


-- Later vendor renames product: "MacBook Pro M3"
-- Later vendor changes SKU: "MBP-M3-2024"
-- Later price increases: $2,499.00


-- Order history shows original values:
-- Still displays "MacBook Pro 14" M3 Pro" at $2,299
-- Customer paid that price, that's what order shows

### Multi-Vendor Item Status

Different items different vendors ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá - independent status:

Order #ORD-20260213-0002 (is_multi_vendor = TRUE)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item 1 (Vendor A): status = 'shipped'
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Item 2 (Vendor B): status = 'pending'


Overall order_status = 'processing' 
(least progressed item determines overall status)
Commission Calculation
sql-- Commission captured at order time
commission_rate = 12.50%  -- From vendors.commission_rate
commission_amount = total_price √ó (commission_rate / 100)
                  = $2,299.00 √ó 0.125
                  = $287.38


-- Platform earns: $287.38
-- Vendor receives: $2,299.00 - $287.38 = $2,011.62
Variant Attributes Snapshot
json// variant_attributes stored as JSONB
{
  "storage": "256GB",
  "color": "Blue Titanium"
}


// Benefits:
// - Preserved if variant deleted
// - Searchable/filterable
// - Display in order history
4.4.3 payments
Purpose: Payment transaction records for orders
sqlCREATE TABLE payments (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Order Relationship
    order_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Payment Details
    payment_method VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    currency VARCHAR(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'USD',
    
    -- Transaction Information
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),  -- External gateway transaction ID
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    
    -- Gateway Response
    gateway_response JSONB,  -- Full response from payment gateway
    
    -- Refund Information
    refund_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00,
    refunded_at TIMESTAMP,
    refund_transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    refund_reason TEXT,
    
    -- Failure Information
    failure_reason TEXT,
    failure_code VARCHAR(50),
    
    -- Metadata
    customer_ip INET,
    user_agent TEXT,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_payments_order FOREIGN KEY (order_id) 
        REFERENCES orders(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT ck_payments_method CHECK (payment_method IN 
        ('stripe_card', 'paypal', 'cash_on_delivery')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_payments_status CHECK (status IN 
        ('pending', 'authorized', 'paid', 'failed', 'refunded', 'partially_refunded')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_payments_amount CHECK (amount > 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_payments_refund_amount CHECK (
        refund_amount >= 0 AND refund_amount <= amount
    ),
    CONSTRAINT ck_payments_currency CHECK (currency ~ '^[A-Z]{3}$')
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_order ON payments(order_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_transaction ON payments(transaction_id) 
WHERE transaction_id IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_status ON payments(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_method ON payments(payment_method);
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_created ON payments(created_at);


-- Partial index for failed payments
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_failed ON payments(created_at) 
WHERE status = 'failed';


-- JSONB index for gateway response queries
CREATE INDEX idx_payments_gateway_response ON payments USING gin(gateway_response);


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE payments IS 'Payment transaction records with gateway integration';
COMMENT ON COLUMN payments.transaction_id IS 'External payment gateway transaction identifier (Stripe charge ID, PayPal transaction ID)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN payments.gateway_response IS 'Full JSON response from payment gateway for debugging';
COMMENT ON COLUMN payments.refund_amount IS 'Total amount refunded (can be partial)';
Sample Data:
sql-- Successful Stripe payment
INSERT INTO payments (
    order_id, payment_method, amount, currency,
    transaction_id, status, gateway_response, customer_ip
) VALUES (
    1, 'stripe_card', 2543.90, 'USD',
    'ch_3MlJ9xJxK5z9Fq8p1S2h4T6y',  -- Stripe charge ID
    'paid',
    '{
        "id": "ch_3MlJ9xJxK5z9Fq8p1S2h4T6y",
        "object": "charge",
        "amount": 254390,
        "currency": "usd",
        "status": "succeeded",
        "payment_method": "card_1MlJ9wJxK5z9Fq8p",
        "receipt_url": "https://pay.stripe.com/receipts/...",
        "created": 1708041600
    }'::jsonb,
    '192.168.1.100'
);


-- PayPal payment
INSERT INTO payments (
    order_id, payment_method, amount, currency,
    transaction_id, status, gateway_response
) VALUES (
    2, 'paypal', 480.00, 'USD',
    '8XY12345ABC67890',  -- PayPal transaction ID
    'paid',
    '{
        "id": "8XY12345ABC67890",
        "status": "COMPLETED",
        "amount": {"currency_code": "USD", "value": "480.00"},
        "payer": {"email_address": "customer@example.com"}
    }'::jsonb
);


-- Cash on delivery (pending)
INSERT INTO payments (
    order_id, payment_method, amount, currency, status
) VALUES (
    3, 'cash_on_delivery', 150.00, 'USD', 'pending'
);


-- Failed payment
INSERT INTO payments (
    order_id, payment_method, amount, currency,
    status, failure_reason, failure_code
) VALUES (
    4, 'stripe_card', 1999.00, 'USD',
    'failed',
    'Your card was declined. Please contact your bank for more information.',
    'card_declined'
);
Payment Processing Logic:
php// app/Services/Payment/StripePaymentService.php


public function processPayment(Order $order, string $paymentIntentId): Payment
{
    try {
        // Verify payment intent with Stripe
        $paymentIntent = \Stripe\PaymentIntent::retrieve($paymentIntentId);
        
        if ($paymentIntent->status !== 'succeeded') {
            throw new PaymentFailedException('Payment not successful');
        }
        
        // Create payment record
        $payment = Payment::create([
            'order_id' => $order->id,
            'payment_method' => 'stripe_card',
            'amount' => $order->total,
            'currency' => 'USD',
            'transaction_id' => $paymentIntent->charges->data[0]->id,
            'status' => 'paid',
            'gateway_response' => json_encode($paymentIntent->toArray()),
            'customer_ip' => request()->ip(),
            'user_agent' => request()->userAgent(),
        ]);
        
        // Update order payment status
        $order->update([
            'payment_status' => 'paid',
            'transaction_id' => $payment->transaction_id,
        ]);
        
        return $payment;
        
    } catch (\Stripe\Exception\CardException $e) {
        // Card was declined
        return Payment::create([
            'order_id' => $order->id,
            'payment_method' => 'stripe_card',
            'amount' => $order->total,
            'currency' => 'USD',
            'status' => 'failed',
            'failure_reason' => $e->getMessage(),
            'failure_code' => $e->getStripeCode(),
        ]);
    }
}


// Process refund
public function processRefund(Payment $payment, float $amount, string $reason): void
{
    $refund = \Stripe\Refund::create([
        'charge' => $payment->transaction_id,
        'amount' => $amount * 100,  // Convert to cents
        'reason' => 'requested_by_customer',
    ]);
    
    $payment->update([
        'refund_amount' => $payment->refund_amount + $amount,
        'refunded_at' => now(),
        'refund_transaction_id' => $refund->id,
        'refund_reason' => $reason,
        'status' => $payment->refund_amount >= $payment->amount 
            ? 'refunded' 
            : 'partially_refunded',
    ]);
}

*

payments table payment transactions track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá:

### Payment Methods

  • stripe_card - Credit/Debit card via Stripe
  • paypal - PayPal account payment
  • cash_on_delivery - Pay when receiving order

### Payment Status Flow

pending ‚Üí authorized ‚Üí paid
   ‚îÇ                     ‚îÇ
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí failed          ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí refunded
                              partially_refunded
  • pending - Payment being processed
  • authorized - Funds held, not captured yet
  • paid - Payment successful, funds captured
  • failed - Payment declined/failed
  • refunded - Full refund issued
  • partially_refunded - Partial refund issued

### Transaction IDs

External gateway identifiers for reconciliation:

Stripe: ch_3MlJ9xJxK5z9Fq8p1S2h4T6y
PayPal: 8XY12345ABC67890
COD: NULL (no external transaction)
Gateway Response (JSONB)
Full API response stored for debugging:
json{
  "id": "ch_...",
  "amount": 254390,
  "status": "succeeded",
  "receipt_url": "https://...",
  "card": {
    "brand": "visa",
    "last4": "4242",
    "exp_month": 12,
    "exp_year": 2027
  }
}
Benefits:


Debugging - Investigate payment issues
Reconciliation - Match with gateway reports
Audit Trail - Complete transaction history


Refund Handling
sql-- Original payment
amount = $100.00
refund_amount = $0.00
status = 'paid'


-- Partial refund $30
refund_amount = $30.00
status = 'partially_refunded'


-- Another partial refund $70
refund_amount = $100.00
status = 'refunded'  -- Full amount refunded
4.4.4 shipments
Purpose: Track shipping/delivery information per vendor
sqlCREATE TABLE shipments (
    -- Primary Key
    id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Order Relationship
    order_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    vendor_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Shipment Details
    shipment_number VARCHAR(50),
    carrier VARCHAR(100),
    tracking_number VARCHAR(100),
    tracking_url VARCHAR(500),
    
    -- Shipping Method
    shipping_method VARCHAR(100),
    estimated_delivery_date DATE,
    
    -- Status
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    
    -- Dates
    shipped_at TIMESTAMP,
    in_transit_at TIMESTAMP,
    out_for_delivery_at TIMESTAMP,
    delivered_at TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Delivery Details
    delivered_to VARCHAR(255),
    delivery_signature TEXT,  -- Base64 encoded signature image
    delivery_notes TEXT,
    
    -- Package Details
    weight DECIMAL(8,2),  -- kg
    dimensions JSONB,     -- {"length": 30, "width": 20, "height": 10, "unit": "cm"}
    package_count INT DEFAULT 1,
    
    -- Timestamps
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Constraints
    CONSTRAINT fk_shipments_order FOREIGN KEY (order_id) 
        REFERENCES orders(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_shipments_vendor FOREIGN KEY (vendor_id) 
        REFERENCES vendors(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    CONSTRAINT ck_shipments_status CHECK (status IN 
        ('pending', 'processing', 'shipped', 'in_transit', 'out_for_delivery', 'delivered', 'failed', 'returned')),
    CONSTRAINT ck_shipments_weight CHECK (weight IS NULL OR weight > 0),
    CONSTRAINT ck_shipments_package_count CHECK (package_count > 0)
);


-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_order ON shipments(order_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_vendor ON shipments(vendor_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_tracking ON shipments(tracking_number) 
WHERE tracking_number IS NOT NULL;
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_status ON shipments(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_shipped ON shipments(shipped_at) 
WHERE shipped_at IS NOT NULL;


-- Partial index for active shipments
CREATE INDEX idx_shipments_active ON shipments(vendor_id, created_at) 
WHERE status NOT IN ('delivered', 'returned');


-- Comments
COMMENT ON TABLE shipments IS 'Shipping/delivery tracking per vendor in multi-vendor orders';
COMMENT ON COLUMN shipments.shipment_number IS 'Internal shipment identifier';
COMMENT ON COLUMN shipments.tracking_url IS 'Full URL for tracking (e.g., https://track.fedex.com/...)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN shipments.delivered_to IS 'Name of person who received package';
Sample Data:
sql-- Shipment for Order #1 (Single Vendor)
INSERT INTO shipments (
    order_id, vendor_id, carrier, tracking_number,
    tracking_url, shipping_method, estimated_delivery_date,
    status, weight, dimensions, shipped_at
) VALUES (
    1, 1,
    'FedEx',
    '1234567890123',
    'https://www.fedex.com/fedextrack/?tracknumbers=1234567890123',
    'FedEx 2-Day',
    CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '2 days',
    'shipped',
    1.60,  -- MacBook weight
    '{"length": 35, "width": 25, "height": 5, "unit": "cm"}'::jsonb,
    NOW()
);


-- Shipments for Order #2 (Multi-Vendor)
-- Vendor A shipment
INSERT INTO shipments (
    order_id, vendor_id, carrier, tracking_number,
    shipping_method, status
) VALUES (
    2, 1,
    'DHL',
    'DHL9876543210',
    'DHL Express',
    'processing'
);


-- Vendor B shipment
INSERT INTO shipments (
    order_id, vendor_id, carrier, tracking_number,
    shipping_method, status, shipped_at
) VALUES (
    2, 2,
    'USPS',
    'USPS1234567890',
    'USPS Priority',
    'in_transit',
    NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'
);

shipments table delivery tracking ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá vendor-wise:

### Multi-Vendor Shipments

‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ order ‡¶è multiple vendors ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ shipments:

Order #ORD-20260213-0002
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Shipment 1 (Vendor A)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Carrier: DHL
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tracking: DHL9876543210
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: processing
‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Shipment 2 (Vendor B)
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Carrier: USPS
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tracking: USPS1234567890
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: in_transit

### Shipment Status Flow

pending ‚Üí processing ‚Üí shipped ‚Üí in_transit ‚Üí 
out_for_delivery ‚Üí delivered


                         ‚Üì
                      failed
                         ‚Üì
                      returned
Tracking Integration
sql-- Generate tracking URL
tracking_url = 'https://www.fedex.com/fedextrack/?tracknumbers=' || tracking_number


-- Different carriers different URLs:
FedEx: https://www.fedex.com/fedextrack/?tracknumbers={number}
UPS: https://www.ups.com/track?tracknum={number}
USPS: https://tools.usps.com/go/TrackConfirmAction?tLabels={number}
DHL: https://www.dhl.com/en/express/tracking.html?AWB={number}
Delivery Confirmation
sql-- When delivered
UPDATE shipments SET
    status = 'delivered',
    delivered_at = NOW(),
    delivered_to = 'John Doe',
    delivery_notes = 'Left at front door as requested'
WHERE id = 1;

DETAILED DATABASE SCHEMA
üìê
Detailed Database Schema
Multi-Vendor E-commerce Platform  ¬∑  Feb 2026  ¬∑  v2.0

E-COMMERCE PLATFORM - DETAILED DATABASE SCHEMA

1. COMPLETE DATABASE DESIGN

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚îÇ                    DATABASE ARCHITECTURE OVERVIEW                        ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


DATABASE: MySQL 8.0+ / PostgreSQL 14+
CHARACTER SET: utf8mb4
COLLATION: utf8mb4_unicode_ci
STORAGE ENGINE: InnoDB
TOTAL TABLES: 65 tables


DATABASE ORGANIZATION:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
1. User & Authentication (8 tables)
2. Products & Catalog (12 tables)
3. Orders & Transactions (10 tables)
4. Inventory & Stock (6 tables)
5. Payments & Commissions (7 tables)
6. Shipping & Fulfillment (5 tables)
7. Reviews & Ratings (4 tables)
8. Marketing & Promotions (6 tables)
9. Content Management (4 tables)
10. System & Logs (3 tables)


SECTION 1: USER & AUTHENTICATION TABLES


‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
TABLE 1: users (Main user table for all user types)
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê


CREATE TABLE users (
    id BIGINT UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    
    -- Basic Information
    email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    email_verified_at TIMESTAMP NULL,
    password VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    
    first_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    phone VARCHAR(20) NULL,
    phone_verified_at TIMESTAMP NULL,
    
    -- Profile
    avatar VARCHAR(255) NULL,
    date_of_birth DATE NULL,
    gender ENUM('male', 'female', 'other', 'prefer_not_to_say') NULL,
    
    -- User Type & Status
    user_type ENUM('customer', 'vendor', 'admin') NOT NULL DEFAULT 'customer',
    status ENUM('active', 'inactive', 'suspended', 'banned') NOT NULL DEFAULT 'active',
    
    -- Security
    two_factor_enabled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    two_factor_secret VARCHAR(255) NULL,
    two_factor_recovery_codes TEXT NULL,
    
    -- Login Tracking
    last_login_at TIMESTAMP NULL,
    last_login_ip VARCHAR(45) NULL,
    login_count INT UNSIGNED DEFAULT 0,
    failed_login_attempts INT UNSIGNED DEFAULT 0,
    locked_until TIMESTAMP NULL,
    
    -- Preferences
    preferred_language VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'en',
    preferred_currency VARCHAR(3) DEFAULT 'USD',
    timezone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'UTC',
    
    -- Metadata
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP NULL,
    
    -- Indexes
    INDEX idx_email (email),
    INDEX idx_user_type (user_type),
    INDEX idx_status (status),
    INDEX idx_created_at (created_at)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci;


‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
TABLE 2: user_roles (Role-based access control)
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    id BIGINT UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
    role_id BIGINT UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
    
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    
    UNIQUE KEY unique_user_role (user_id, role_id),
    INDEX idx_user_id (user_id),
    INDEX idx_role_id (role_id)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci;


-- ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
-- TABLE 3: roles (Roles for RBAC)
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê


CREATE TABLE roles (
    id BIGINT UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    display_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT NULL,
    
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci;


-- Default Roles
INSERT INTO roles (name, display_name, description) VALUES
('super_admin', 'Super Administrator', 'Full system access'),
('admin', 'Administrator', 'Platform management'),
('vendor', 'Vendor', 'Vendor dashboard access'),
('customer', 'Customer', 'Customer account access');


-- ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
-- TABLE 4: permissions (Permissions for RBAC)
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê


CREATE TABLE permissions (
    id BIGINT UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    display_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT NULL,
    module VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- products, orders, users, etc.
    
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci;


-- Sample Permissions
INSERT INTO permissions (name, display_name, module) VALUES
('products.create', 'Create Products', 'products'),
('products.view', 'View Products', 'products'),
('products.edit', 'Edit Products', 'products'),
('products.delete', 'Delete Products', 'products'),
('orders.view', 'View Orders', 'orders'),
('orders.manage', 'Manage Orders', 'orders'),
('users.manage', 'Manage Users', 'users');


-- ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
-- TABLE 5: role_permissions (Link roles to permissions)
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê


CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    id BIGINT UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    role_id BIGINT UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
    permission_id BIGINT UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
