            'cash_on_delivery' => [
                'name' => 'Cash on Delivery',
                'description' => 'Pay when you receive the product',
                'icon' => 'cash',
                'enabled' => true,
            ],
        ];
    }
}
<?php
// app/Services/Payment/PaymentService.php


namespace App\Services\Payment;


use App\Models\Order;
use App\Factories\PaymentGatewayFactory;


class PaymentService
{
    public function processPayment(Order $order): PaymentResult
    {
        // Factory creates the appropriate gateway
        $gateway = PaymentGatewayFactory::create($order->payment_method);


        // Process payment
        $result = $gateway->charge($order->total, $order);


        // Save payment record
        if ($result->success) {
            $order->payments()->create([
                'amount' => $order->total,
                'currency' => 'USD',
                'payment_method' => $order->payment_method,
                'transaction_id' => $result->transactionId,
                'status' => 'paid',
            ]);
        }


        return $result;
    }
}
7.3 Notification Channel Factory


<?php
// app/Factories/NotificationChannelFactory.php


namespace App\Factories;


use App\Services\Notification\NotificationChannel;
use App\Services\Notification\EmailChannel;
use App\Services\Notification\SMSChannel;
use App\Services\Notification\PushChannel;
use App\Services\Notification\WhatsAppChannel;


class NotificationChannelFactory
{
    public static function create(string $channel): NotificationChannel
    {
        return match($channel) {
            'email' => app(EmailChannel::class),
            'sms' => app(SMSChannel::class),
            'push' => app(PushChannel::class),
            'whatsapp' => app(WhatsAppChannel::class),
            default => throw new \InvalidArgumentException("Unknown channel: {$channel}"),
        };
    }


    public static function createMultiple(array $channels): array
    {
        return array_map(fn($channel) => self::create($channel), $channels);
    }
}


// Usage
$channels = NotificationChannelFactory::createMultiple(['email', 'sms', 'push']);


foreach ($channels as $channel) {
    $channel->send($user, $message);
}
8. STRATEGY PATTERN
8.1 Shipping Cost Strateg
<?php
// app/Strategies/Shipping/ShippingStrategy.php


namespace App\Strategies\Shipping;


use App\Models\Order;


interface ShippingStrategy
{
    public function calculateCost(Order $order): float;
    public function getName(): string;
    public function getEstimatedDays(): int;
}
<?php
// app/Strategies/Shipping/ExpressShipping.php


namespace App\Strategies\Shipping;


use App\Models\Order;


class ExpressShipping implements ShippingStrategy
{
    public function calculateCost(Order $order): float
    {
        $weight = $order->getTotalWeight();
        $baseCost = 15.00;
        $weightCost = $weight * 0.8;
        
        return $baseCost + $weightCost;
    }


    public function getName(): string
    {
        return 'Express Shipping';
    }


    public function getEstimatedDays(): int
    {
        return 2;
    }
}
8.2 Shipping Service Using Strategy
<?php
// app/Services/ShippingService.php


namespace App\Services;


use App\Models\Order;
use App\Strategies\Shipping\ShippingStrategy;
use App\Strategies\Shipping\StandardShipping;
use App\Strategies\Shipping\ExpressShipping;
use App\Strategies\Shipping\OvernightShipping;
use App\Strategies\Shipping\FreeShipping;


class ShippingService
{
    private ShippingStrategy $strategy;


    public function __construct(?ShippingStrategy $strategy = null)
    {
        $this->strategy = $strategy ?? new StandardShipping();
    }


    /**
     * Set shipping strategy
     */
    public function setStrategy(ShippingStrategy $strategy): void
    {
        $this->strategy = $strategy;
    }


    /**
     * Calculate shipping cost using current strategy
     */
    public function calculateShipping(Order $order): array
    {
        $cost = $this->strategy->calculateCost($order);
        $estimatedDays = $this->strategy->getEstimatedDays();


        return [
            'cost' => $cost,
            'method' => $this->strategy->getName(),
            'estimated_days' => $estimatedDays,
            'estimated_delivery' => now()->addDays($estimatedDays),
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Get all available shipping options
     */
    public function getAvailableOptions(Order $order): array
    {
        $strategies = [
            'standard' => new StandardShipping(),
            'express' => new ExpressShipping(),
            'overnight' => new OvernightShipping(),
            'free' => new FreeShipping(),
        ];


        $options = [];


        foreach ($strategies as $key => $strategy) {
            $this->setStrategy($strategy);
            $options[$key] = $this->calculateShipping($order);
        }


        return $options;
    }
}


// Usage in Controller
class CheckoutController extends Controller
{
    public function getShippingOptions(Request $request, ShippingService $shippingService)
    {
        $order = Order::findOrFail($request->order_id);
        
        $options = $shippingService->getAvailableOptions($order);


        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => $options,
        ]);
    }


    public function selectShipping(Request $request, ShippingService $shippingService)
    {
        $order = Order::findOrFail($request->order_id);


        $strategy = match($request->shipping_method) {
            'express' => new ExpressShipping(),
            'overnight' => new OvernightShipping(),
            'free' => new FreeShipping(),
            default => new StandardShipping(),
        };


        $shippingService->setStrategy($strategy);
        $result = $shippingService->calculateShipping($order);


        $order->update([
            'shipping_method' => $request->shipping_method,
            'shipping_charge' => $result['cost'],
            'estimated_delivery_date' => $result['estimated_delivery'],
        ]);


        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => $result,
        ]);
    }
}
8.3 Discount Strategy Pattern
<?php
// app/Strategies/Discount/DiscountStrategy.php


namespace App\Strategies\Discount;


use App\Models\Order;


interface DiscountStrategy
{
    public function calculate(Order $order): float;
    public function isApplicable(Order $order): bool;
    public function getDescription(): string;
}
<?php
// app/Strategies/Discount/PercentageDiscount.php


namespace App\Strategies\Discount;


use App\Models\Order;


class PercentageDiscount implements DiscountStrategy
{
    public function __construct(
        private float $percentage,
        private ?float $maxDiscount = null
    ) {}


    public function calculate(Order $order): float
    {
        $discount = $order->subtotal * ($this->percentage / 100);


        if ($this->maxDiscount !== null) {
            $discount = min($discount, $this->maxDiscount);
        }


        return $discount;
    }


    public function isApplicable(Order $order): bool
    {
        return $order->subtotal > 0;
    }


    public function getDescription(): string
    {
        return "{$this->percentage}% off";
    }
}
9. CHAIN OF RESPONSIBILITY PATTERN
9.1 Order Validation Chain
<?php
// app/Validators/OrderValidation/ValidationHandler.php


namespace App\Validators\OrderValidation;


use App\Models\Order;


abstract class ValidationHandler
{
    protected ?ValidationHandler $next = null;


    public function setNext(ValidationHandler $handler): ValidationHandler
    {
        $this->next = $handler;
        return $handler;
    }


    public function handle(Order $order): bool
    {
        if ($this->validate($order)) {
            if ($this->next) {
                return $this->next->handle($order);
            }
            return true;
        }


        return false;
    }


    abstract protected function validate(Order $order): bool;
    abstract public function getErrorMessage(): string;
}
<?php
// app/Validators/OrderValidation/StockAvailabilityValidator.php


namespace App\Validators\OrderValidation;


use App\Models\Order;


class StockAvailabilityValidator extends ValidationHandler
{
    private string $errorMessage = '';


    protected function validate(Order $order): bool
    {
        foreach ($order->items as $item) {
            $product = $item->product;


            if (!$product->isInStock()) {
                $this->errorMessage = "{$product->name} is out of stock";
                return false;
            }


            if ($product->stock_quantity < $item->quantity) {
                $this->errorMessage = "Insufficient stock for {$product->name}. Available: {$product->stock_quantity}";
                return false;
            }
        }


        return true;
    }


    public function getErrorMessage(): string
    {
        return $this->errorMessage;
    }
}
<?php
// app/Validators/OrderValidation/MinimumOrderAmountValidator.php


namespace App\Validators\OrderValidation;


use App\Models\Order;


class MinimumOrderAmountValidator extends ValidationHandler
{
    public function __construct(
        private float $minimumAmount = 10.00
    ) {}


    protected function validate(Order $order): bool
    {
        return $order->subtotal >= $this->minimumAmount;
    }


    public function getErrorMessage(): string
    {
        return "Minimum order amount is \${$this->minimumAmount}";
    }
}
<?php
// app/Validators/OrderValidation/PaymentMethodValidator.php


namespace App\Validators\OrderValidation;


use App\Models\Order;


class PaymentMethodValidator extends ValidationHandler
{
    private array $allowedMethods = [
        'stripe_card',
        'paypal',
        'sslcommerz',
        'cash_on_delivery',
    ];


    protected function validate(Order $order): bool
    {
        return in_array($order->payment_method, $this->allowedMethods);
    }


    public function getErrorMessage(): string
    {
        return "Invalid payment method";
    }
}
9.2 Using the Validation Chain
<?php
// app/Services/OrderValidationService.php


namespace App\Services;


use App\Models\Order;
use App\Validators\OrderValidation\{
    StockAvailabilityValidator,
    MinimumOrderAmountValidator,
    ShippingAddressValidator,
    PaymentMethodValidator,
    CouponValidator
};


class OrderValidationService
{
    /**
     * Validate order through chain of validators
     */
    public function validate(Order $order): array
    {
        // Build validation chain
        $stockValidator = new StockAvailabilityValidator();
        $minAmountValidator = new MinimumOrderAmountValidator();
        $addressValidator = new ShippingAddressValidator();
        $paymentValidator = new PaymentMethodValidator();
        $couponValidator = new CouponValidator();


        // Chain validators
        $stockValidator
            ->setNext($minAmountValidator)
            ->setNext($addressValidator)
            ->setNext($paymentValidator)
            ->setNext($couponValidator);


        // Execute validation chain
        $isValid = $stockValidator->handle($order);


        if (!$isValid) {
            // Find which validator failed
            $validators = [
                $stockValidator,
                $minAmountValidator,
                $addressValidator,
                $paymentValidator,
                $couponValidator,
            ];


            foreach ($validators as $validator) {
                if (!$validator->handle($order)) {
                    return [
                        'valid' => false,
                        'error' => $validator->getErrorMessage(),
                    ];
                }
            }
        }


        return ['valid' => true];
    }
}


// Usage in Controller
class OrderController extends Controller
{
    public function store(Request $request, OrderValidationService $validator)
    {
        $order = Order::create($request->validated());


        $validation = $validator->validate($order);


        if (!$validation['valid']) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => $validation['error'],
            ], 422);
        }


        // Proceed with order creation
        // ...


        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => $order,
        ], 201);
    }
}


10. FACADE PATTERN
10.1 Order Processing Facade
<?php
// app/Facades/OrderFacade.php


namespace App\Facades;


use App\Models\Order;
use App\Models\User;
use App\Services\OrderService;
use App\Services\PaymentService;
use App\Services\InventoryService;
use App\Services\NotificationService;
use App\Services\OrderValidationService;


/**
 * Facade to simplify complex order operations
 */
class OrderFacade
{
    public function __construct(
        private OrderService $orderService,
        private PaymentService $paymentService,
        private InventoryService $inventoryService,
        private NotificationService $notificationService,
        private OrderValidationService $validationService
    ) {}


    /**
     * Complete order processing with single method call
     */
    public function processOrder(User $user, array $orderData): array
    {
        try {
            // 1. Validate order
            $validation = $this->validationService->validate(
                new Order($orderData)
            );


            if (!$validation['valid']) {
                return [
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => $validation['error'],
                ];
            }


            // 2. Create order
            $order = $this->orderService->createOrder($user, $orderData);


            // 3. Process payment
            $paymentResult = $this->paymentService->processPayment($order);


            if (!$paymentResult->success) {
                $this->orderService->cancelOrder($order, 'Payment failed');
                return [
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'Payment processing failed',
                ];
            }


            // 4. Update inventory
            foreach ($order->items as $item) {
                $this->inventoryService->decreaseStock(
                    $item->product_id,
                    $item->quantity
                );
            }


            // 5. Send notifications
            $this->notificationService->sendOrderConfirmation($order);
            $this->notificationService->notifyVendors($order);


            return [
                'success' => true,
                'order' => $order,
                'message' => 'Order placed successfully',
            ];


        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            \Log::error('Order processing failed', [
                'user_id' => $user->id,
                'error' => $e->getMessage(),
            ]);


            return [
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Order processing failed',
            ];
        }
    }


    /**
     * Cancel and refund order
     */
    public function cancelAndRefund(Order $order, string $reason): array
    {
        try {
            // 1. Refund payment
            if ($order->isPaid()) {
                $refundResult = $this->paymentService->refundPayment($order);
                
                if (!$refundResult->success) {
                    return [
                        'success' => false,
                        'message' => 'Refund failed',
                    ];
                }
            }


            // 2. Cancel order
            $this->orderService->cancelOrder($order, $reason);


            // 3. Restore inventory
            foreach ($order->items as $item) {
                $this->inventoryService->increaseStock(
                    $item->product_id,
                    $item->quantity
                );
            }


            // 4. Notify customer
            $this->notificationService->sendCancellationConfirmation($order);


            return [
                'success' => true,
                'message' => 'Order cancelled and refunded successfully',
            ];


        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            return [
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Cancellation failed',
            ];
        }
    }


    /**
     * Track order status
     */
    public function trackOrder(string $orderNumber): array
    {
        $order = Order::where('order_number', $orderNumber)->first();


        if (!$order) {
            return [
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Order not found',
            ];
        }


        return [
            'success' => true,
            'order' => [
                'order_number' => $order->order_number,
                'status' => $order->order_status,
                'payment_status' => $order->payment_status,
                'created_at' => $order->created_at,
                'estimated_delivery' => $order->estimated_delivery_date,
                'tracking_number' => $order->tracking_number,
                'items_count' => $order->items->count(),
                'total' => $order->total,
            ],
        ];
    }
}
10.2 Using the Facade
<?php
// In Controller - Simple usage


use App\Facades\OrderFacade;


class CheckoutController extends Controller
{
    public function __construct(
        private OrderFacade $orderFacade
    ) {}


    public function placeOrder(Request $request)
    {
        // Complex operations hidden behind simple facade
        $result = $this->orderFacade->processOrder(
            $request->user(),
            $request->validated()
        );


        if (!$result['success']) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => $result['message'],
            ], 422);
        }


        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => $result['order'],
            'message' => $result['message'],
        ], 201);
    }


    public function cancelOrder(Request $request, $orderId)
    {
        $order = Order::findOrFail($orderId);


        // Simple method call handles all complexity
        $result = $this->orderFacade->cancelAndRefund(
            $order,
            $request->input('reason')
        );


        return response()->json($result);
    }


    public function trackOrder(Request $request)
    {
        $result = $this->orderFacade->trackOrder(
            $request->input('order_number')
        );


        return response()->json($result);
    }
}
11.2 Constructor Injection
<?php
// Automatic Dependency Resolution


namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;


use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Repositories\Contracts\ProductRepositoryInterface;
use App\Services\CacheService;
use App\Services\ImageService;


class ProductController extends Controller
{
    // Laravel automatically resolves and injects dependencies
    public function __construct(
        private ProductRepositoryInterface $productRepository,
        private CacheService $cache,
        private ImageService $imageService
    ) {}


    public function index()
    {
        // Use injected dependencies
        $products = $this->productRepository->all();
        return response()->json($products);
    }
}
OOP Principles:
* Encapsulation
* Inheritance
* Polymorphism
* Abstraction
SOLID Principles:
* Single Responsibility Principle
* Open/Closed Principle
* Liskov Substitution Principle
* Interface Segregation Principle
* Dependency Inversion Principle
Design Patterns:
* Repository Pattern
* Service Layer Pattern
* Observer Pattern (Events/Listeners)
* Factory Pattern
* Strategy Pattern
* Chain of Responsibility
* Facade Pattern
* Dependency Injection
Key Takeaways:
1. Repository Pattern - Data access layer separation
2. Service Layer - Business logic orchestration
3. Strategy Pattern - Interchangeable algorithms (shipping, discounts)
4. Observer Pattern - Event-driven architecture
5. Factory Pattern - Object creation abstraction
6. Facade Pattern - Simplified complex operations
7. SOLID - Maintainable, testable code
E-COMMERCE PLATFORM - OOP & DESIGN PATTERNS USAGE MAP


OOP CONCEPTS - ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá
________________


1. ENCAPSULATION (Data Hiding)
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Class ‡¶è‡¶∞ data ‡¶è‡¶¨‡¶Ç methods ‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶•‡ßá bundle ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
         ‡¶è‡¶¨‡¶Ç ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá direct access ‡¶¨‡¶®‡ßç‡¶ß ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


User Class
   - Password ‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∂ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ (plain text ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶®‡¶æ)
   - Email verification status internal ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ
   - Login attempt count ‡¶≠‡ßá‡¶§‡¶∞‡ßá manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Payment Class
   - Credit card number encrypt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ
   - CVV ‡¶ï‡¶ñ‡¶®‡ßã store ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Bank account details mask ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Product Class
   - Cost price vendor ‡¶õ‡¶æ‡¶°‡¶º‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶â ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ
   - Internal approval status manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Commission calculation ‡¶≠‡ßá‡¶§‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ


Order Class
   - Order total calculation internal
   - Discount logic ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶∞‡ßá expose ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Payment status transitions control ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Vendor Class
   - Commission rate ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ admin change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá
   - Earnings calculation internal ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ
   - Payout eligibility check ‡¶≠‡ßá‡¶§‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


2. INHERITANCE (‡¶â‡¶§‡ßç‡¶§‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶ø‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶∞)


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Parent class ‡¶è‡¶∞ properties ‡¶è‡¶¨‡¶Ç methods
         child class inherit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶Ø‡¶º


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


User ‚Üí Customer
   - User ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶¨ features + Cart, Wishlist, Reviews


User ‚Üí Vendor
   - User ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶¨ features + Store, Products, Orders


User ‚Üí Admin
   - User ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶¨ features + Full platform control


Product ‚Üí SimpleProduct
   - ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø variant, ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø price, ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø stock


Product ‚Üí VariableProduct
   - Multiple variants, Multiple prices, Multiple stocks


Product ‚Üí DigitalProduct
   - No shipping required, Download link


Payment ‚Üí StripePayment
   - Card processing via Stripe API


Payment ‚Üí PayPalPayment
   - Payment via PayPal


Payment ‚Üí CashOnDelivery
   - Physical payment on delivery


Notification ‚Üí EmailNotification
   - Email ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã‡¶∞ logic


Notification ‚Üí SMSNotification
   - SMS ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã‡¶∞ logic


Notification ‚Üí PushNotification
   - Push notification ‡¶è‡¶∞ logic


Report ‚Üí SalesReport
   - Sales specific report generation


Report ‚Üí InventoryReport
   - Inventory specific report


Report ‚Üí PaymentReport
   - Payment specific report


Shipping ‚Üí FlatRateShipping
   - Fixed rate shipping


Shipping ‚Üí WeightBasedShipping
   - Weight ‡¶Ö‡¶®‡ßÅ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßÄ rate


Shipping ‚Üí FreeShipping
   - Free shipping logic


3. POLYMORPHISM (‡¶¨‡¶π‡ßÅ‡¶∞‡ßÇ‡¶™‡¶§‡¶æ)


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶á method different classes ‡¶è different
         behavior ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


calculatePrice()
   - SimpleProduct: Just returns price
   - VariableProduct: Returns variant price
   - DigitalProduct: Returns with no shipping cost


processPayment()
   - StripePayment: Stripe API call ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - PayPalPayment: PayPal redirect ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - CashOnDelivery: Order confirm ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡ßá


sendNotification()
   - EmailNotification: Email ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º
   - SMSNotification: SMS ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º
   - PushNotification: Push ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶†‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º


generateReport()
   - SalesReport: Sales data compile ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - InventoryReport: Stock data compile ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - CustomerReport: Customer data compile ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


calculateShipping()
   - FlatRate: Fixed amount return ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - WeightBased: Weight √ó rate calculate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - Free: Always returns 0


applyDiscount()
   - PercentageCoupon: Price √ó % calculate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - FixedCoupon: Price - fixed amount ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - FreeShippingCoupon: Shipping 0 ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


validateUser()
   - Customer: Order history check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - Vendor: Business verification check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - Admin: Permission level check ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


render() [Frontend]
   - ProductCard: Product info render ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - VendorCard: Store info render ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - OrderCard: Order info render ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


4. ABSTRACTION (‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶®)


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Complex implementation ‡¶≤‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá ‡¶∞‡ßá‡¶ñ‡ßá
         ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ interface ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


PaymentGateway (Abstract)
   - processPayment() ‚Üí ‡¶∏‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßá payment ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡ßç‡¶§‡ßÅ Stripe/PayPal ‡¶è‡¶∞ details ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶¶‡¶∞‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶á


NotificationService (Abstract)
   - send() ‚Üí notification ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º
   - Email/SMS/Push details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


ShippingCalculator (Abstract)
   - calculate() ‚Üí shipping cost ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Carrier API details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


SearchEngine (Abstract)
   - search() ‚Üí results ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Elasticsearch/MySQL details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


FileStorage (Abstract)
   - upload() ‚Üí file save ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Local/S3/CloudFront details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


CacheService (Abstract)
   - get()/set() ‚Üí cache ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶ú ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Redis/Memcached details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


AuthService (Abstract)
   - login()/logout() ‚Üí authentication ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - JWT/Session details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


OrderProcessor (Abstract)
   - process() ‚Üí order complete ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Internal steps hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


ReportGenerator (Abstract)
   - generate() ‚Üí report ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - PDF/Excel details hide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


5. INTERFACE (‡¶ö‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§‡¶ø)


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Class ‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶ï‡ßÄ ‡¶ï‡ßÄ methods implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá
         ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶∞ contract define ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Payable Interface
   - pay() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - refund() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Order, Invoice, Subscription ‡¶∏‡¶¨ implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


Searchable Interface
   - search() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Product, Vendor, Customer ‡¶∏‡¶¨ searchable


Reviewable Interface
   - addReview() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - getReviews() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Product, Vendor ‡¶∏‡¶¨ reviewable


Notifiable Interface
   - notify() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - User, Admin, Vendor ‡¶∏‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á notifiable


Exportable Interface
   - exportToCSV() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - exportToPDF() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Orders, Products, Reports ‡¶∏‡¶¨ exportable


Cacheable Interface
   - cache() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - clearCache() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Products, Categories, Settings cacheable


Trackable Interface
   - getStatus() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - updateStatus() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Orders, Shipments, Tickets trackable


Discountable Interface
   - applyDiscount() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - getDiscountedPrice() implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá
   - Products, Cart, Orders discountable
DESIGN PATTERNS - ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá‡¶õ‡ßá
________________


CREATIONAL PATTERNS (‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡¶ï‡¶∂‡¶æ)
________________


1. SINGLETON PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶∞‡ßã application ‡¶è ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø instance ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


DatabaseConnection
   - ‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶∞‡ßã app ‡¶è ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á DB connection pool
   - ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® connection ‡¶ñ‡ßÅ‡¶≤‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ


CacheManager (Redis)
   - ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á Redis connection
   - ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶ó‡¶æ ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá same instance use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


SessionManager
   - User session ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á instance manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


ConfigManager
   - Application settings ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶á load ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º
   - .env file ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶∞ read ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ


LogManager
   - Application log ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á logger instance
   - ‡¶∏‡¶¨ module same logger use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


QueueManager
   - Email/SMS queue ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á instance manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


EventDispatcher
   - Application events ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á dispatcher handle ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


2. FACTORY PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø‡¶∞ logic ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ,
         ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® type ‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ó‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶§‡¶æ runtime ‡¶è decide ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


PaymentFactory
   - "stripe" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí StripePayment object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "paypal" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí PayPalPayment object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "cod" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí CashOnDelivery object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


NotificationFactory
   - "email" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí EmailNotification ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "sms" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí SMSNotification ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "push" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí PushNotification ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


ShippingFactory
   - "flat" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí FlatRateShipping ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "weight" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí WeightBased ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "free" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí FreeShipping ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


ProductFactory
   - "simple" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí SimpleProduct ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "variable" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí VariableProduct ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "digital" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí DigitalProduct ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


ReportFactory
   - "sales" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí SalesReport ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "inventory" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí InventoryReport ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "payment" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí PaymentReport ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


UserFactory (Testing)
   - Test data generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá
   - Customer, Vendor, Admin fake data ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


CouponFactory
   - "percentage" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí PercentageCoupon ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "fixed" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí FixedCoupon ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - "bogo" ‡¶¶‡¶ø‡¶≤‡ßá ‚Üí BogoCoupon ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


3. BUILDER PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Complex object step by step ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


OrderBuilder
   - addItem() ‚Üí item ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addShipping() ‚Üí shipping ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addCoupon() ‚Üí coupon apply ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addTax() ‚Üí tax calculate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - build() ‚Üí final Order object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø


QueryBuilder
   - select() ‚Üí ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶® columns
   - where() ‚Üí filter conditions
   - orderBy() ‚Üí sort ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - limit() ‚Üí ‡¶ï‡¶§‡¶ü‡¶æ data
   - build() ‚Üí final SQL query ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø


EmailBuilder
   - setTo() ‚Üí recipient set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - setSubject() ‚Üí subject ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
   - setBody() ‚Üí body ‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ
   - addAttachment() ‚Üí file ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - build() ‚Üí final Email object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø


SearchQueryBuilder
   - addKeyword() ‚Üí search term ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addFilter() ‚Üí filter ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addSort() ‚Üí sort option ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - setPagination() ‚Üí page set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - build() ‚Üí final Search object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø


ReportBuilder
   - setDateRange() ‚Üí date range ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
   - addFilter() ‚Üí filter ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - addColumn() ‚Üí column ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - setFormat() ‚Üí PDF/CSV/Excel set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - build() ‚Üí final Report object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø


4. PROTOTYPE PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Existing object clone ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® object ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Product Duplication
   - Vendor ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø product duplicate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá
   - ‡¶∏‡¶¨ data copy ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º, ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ name/SKU change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º


Promotion Duplication
   - Last year ‡¶è‡¶∞ promotion clone ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶è ‡¶¨‡¶õ‡¶∞ use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Dates ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ update ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º


Email Template Cloning
   - ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø template clone ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® template ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Structure same ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡ßá, content change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º


Shipping Zone Copying
   - ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø zone copy ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá similar zone ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Coupon Duplication
   - Similar coupon ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá existing clone ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


STRUCTURAL PATTERNS (‡¶ó‡¶†‡¶®‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡¶ï‡¶∂‡¶æ)


5. ADAPTER PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Incompatible interfaces ‡¶ï‡ßá compatible ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Payment Gateway Adapters
   - Stripe API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ PaymentInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - PayPal API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ PaymentInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - ‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶®‡ßã ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® gateway ‡¶∏‡¶π‡¶ú‡ßá ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º


Shipping Carrier Adapters
   - FedEx API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ ShippingInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - UPS API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ ShippingInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - USPS API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ ShippingInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


SMS Gateway Adapters
   - Twilio API ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ SMSInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Nexmo/Vonage ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ SMSInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Social Login Adapters
   - Google OAuth ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ AuthInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Facebook OAuth ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ AuthInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


File Storage Adapters
   - AWS S3 ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ StorageInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Local Storage ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ StorageInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Cloudinary ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ StorageInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Search Engine Adapters
   - Elasticsearch ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ SearchInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - MySQL FULLTEXT ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ SearchInterface ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


CSV/Excel Import Adapters
   - Vendor product CSV ‚Üí ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞ Product format ‡¶è adapt ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Different CSV formats ‚Üí Standard format ‡¶è convert ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
6. DECORATOR PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Object ‡¶è dynamically ‡¶®‡¶§‡ßÅ‡¶® behavior ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Price Decorators
   - BasePrice ‚Üí + TaxDecorator ‚Üí + DiscountDecorator
   - Product ‡¶è‡¶∞ price ‡¶è layer by layer add ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Tax, discount, coupon ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ apply ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º


Product Decorators
   - BaseProduct ‚Üí + FeaturedDecorator ‚Üí + SaleDecorator
   - Featured badge ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Sale badge ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


User Permission Decorators
   - BaseUser ‚Üí + VendorDecorator ‚Üí + VerifiedDecorator
   - Extra permissions dynamically ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Order Decorators
   - BaseOrder ‚Üí + GiftWrapDecorator ‚Üí + InsuranceDecorator
   - Gift wrapping option ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Shipping insurance ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Response Decorators (API)
   - BaseResponse ‚Üí + PaginationDecorator ‚Üí + CacheDecorator
   - API response ‡¶è pagination info ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Cache headers ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Notification Decorators
   - BaseNotification ‚Üí + LoggingDecorator ‚Üí + RetryDecorator
   - Notification ‡¶è logging ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Failed ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá retry logic ‡¶Ø‡ßã‡¶ó ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


7. FACADE PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Complex subsystem ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶Æ‡¶®‡ßá simple interface ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


OrderFacade
   - placeOrder() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí Inventory check
     ‚Üí Payment processing
     ‚Üí Order creation
     ‚Üí Email notification
     ‚Üí Stock deduction
     ‚Üí Invoice generation


CheckoutFacade
   - checkout() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí Cart validation
     ‚Üí Shipping calculation
     ‚Üí Tax calculation
     ‚Üí Coupon application
     ‚Üí Total calculation


VendorRegistrationFacade
   - register() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí User account creation
     ‚Üí Vendor profile creation
     ‚Üí Email verification
     ‚Üí Admin notification
     ‚Üí Welcome email


ProductPublishFacade
   - publish() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí Validation check
     ‚Üí Image processing
     ‚Üí SEO slug generation
     ‚Üí Category update
     ‚Üí Search index update
     ‚Üí Cache clear


SearchFacade
   - search() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí Query building
     ‚Üí Filter application
     ‚Üí Relevance scoring
     ‚Üí Pagination
     ‚Üí Result caching


PayoutFacade
   - processPayout() ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø call ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º:
     ‚Üí Balance check
     ‚Üí Commission deduction
     ‚Üí Bank transfer initiation
     ‚Üí Email notification
     ‚Üí Audit log creation


8. PROXY PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Real object ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø proxy ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Cache Proxy (Product)
   - Product data ‡¶ö‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶•‡¶Æ‡ßá cache check
   - Cache ‡¶è ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ì‡¶Ø‡¶º‡¶æ
   - ‡¶®‡¶æ ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá DB ‡¶•‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá cache ‡¶è ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ


Authorization Proxy
   - API call ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá permission check
   - Unauthorized ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá real service ‡¶è ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá‡¶á ‡¶®‡¶æ


Rate Limiting Proxy
   - API request ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá rate check
   - Limit exceed ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá block ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Logging Proxy
   - ‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶®‡ßã service call ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶ó‡ßá/‡¶™‡¶∞‡ßá log ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Lazy Loading Proxy
   - Product images ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ visible ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá load ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
   - Full product details ‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶ß‡ßÅ click ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá load ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


Virtual Proxy (Heavy Reports)
   - Report generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶∞‡¶ø ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá placeholder ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã
   - Background ‡¶è process ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º, ready ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßã


9. COMPOSITE PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Tree structure ‡¶è objects organize ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Category Tree
   - Electronics
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Computers
     ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Laptops
     ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Desktops
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mobile Phones
         ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Smartphones
         ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Feature Phones


Admin Menu Tree
   - Dashboard
   - Products
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All Products
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Categories
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Attributes
   - Orders
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All Orders
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Refunds


Permission Tree
   - Platform Permissions
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Product Permissions
     ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Create
     ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Edit
     ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Delete
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Order Permissions
         ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ View
         ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Manage


Shipping Zone Regions
   - United States
     ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ East Coast
     ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New York
     ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Massachusetts
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ West Coast
         ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ California
         ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Washington
BEHAVIORAL PATTERNS (‡¶Ü‡¶ö‡¶∞‡¶£‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶®‡¶ï‡¶∂‡¶æ)
________________


10. OBSERVER PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø object ‡¶è‡¶∞ change ‡¶π‡¶≤‡ßá
         ‡¶∏‡¶¨ dependent objects ‡¶ï‡ßá notify ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Order Status Change
   Subject: Order
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Customer notification (email/SMS)
   ‚Üí Vendor notification
   ‚Üí Admin notification
   ‚Üí Inventory update
   ‚Üí Analytics update


New Product Approved
   Subject: Product
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Search index update
   ‚Üí Category count update
   ‚Üí Vendor notification
   ‚Üí Subscriber notification


Low Stock Alert
   Subject: Inventory
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Vendor email notification
   ‚Üí Admin dashboard update
   ‚Üí Automatic reorder (optional)


New Review Posted
   Subject: Review
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Product rating update
   ‚Üí Vendor notification
   ‚Üí Admin moderation queue
   ‚Üí Email to customer (if vendor responded)


Payment Completed
   Subject: Payment
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Order status update
   ‚Üí Invoice generation
   ‚Üí Vendor earnings update
   ‚Üí Analytics update
   ‚Üí Customer email


User Registration
   Subject: User
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Welcome email
   ‚Üí Admin notification
   ‚Üí Analytics update
   ‚Üí CRM update


Promotion Started/Ended
   Subject: Promotion
   Observers:
   ‚Üí Product prices update
   ‚Üí Cache clear
   ‚Üí Homepage update
   ‚Üí Notification to subscribers


11. STRATEGY PATTERN
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Algorithm family define ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ,
         runtime ‡¶è ‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶®‡¶ü‡¶æ use ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá select ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Payment Strategy
   - StripeStrategy: Card payment
   - PayPalStrategy: PayPal payment
   - CodStrategy: Cash on delivery
   - Order ‡¶ú‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßá payment ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá, ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá ‡¶¨‡¶≤‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶®‡¶æ


Pricing Strategy
   - RegularPricing: Normal price
   - SalePricing: Discounted price
   - BulkPricing: Volume discount
   - MemberPricing: Member discount


Shipping Strategy
   - FlatRateStrategy: Fixed amount
   - WeightBasedStrategy: Per kg
   - FreeShippingStrategy: Always free
   - CarrierCalculatedStrategy: Real-time rate


Search Strategy
   - KeywordStrategy: Text search
   - FilterStrategy: Attribute filter
   - CategoryStrategy: Category browse
   - AIRecommendationStrategy: Smart search


Tax Strategy
   - InclusiveTaxStrategy: Tax included in price
   - ExclusiveTaxStrategy: Tax added at checkout
   - ExemptStrategy: No tax


Discount Strategy
   - PercentageStrategy: % off
   - FixedAmountStrategy: $ off
   - BuyXGetYStrategy: BOGO
   - BundleStrategy: Bundle discount


Sorting Strategy
   - PriceAscStrategy: Price low to high
   - PriceDescStrategy: Price high to low
   - RatingStrategy: By rating
   - NewestStrategy: By date
   - PopularityStrategy: By sales count


Authentication Strategy
   - PasswordStrategy: Email + password
   - GoogleOAuthStrategy: Google login
   - FacebookOAuthStrategy: Facebook login
   - TwoFactorStrategy: 2FA verification


12. COMMAND PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Request ‡¶ï‡ßá object ‡¶π‡¶ø‡¶∏‡ßá‡¶¨‡ßá encapsulate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ
         Undo/Redo ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶≠‡¶¨ ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Order Commands
   - PlaceOrderCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - CancelOrderCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - RefundOrderCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


Product Commands
   - PublishProductCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - UnpublishProductCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - DeleteProductCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


Cart Commands
   - AddToCartCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - RemoveFromCartCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - UpdateQuantityCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


Inventory Commands
   - AddStockCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - ReduceStockCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - SetStockCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


Coupon Commands
   - ApplyCouponCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - RemoveCouponCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


Admin Commands
   - BanUserCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - ApproveVendorCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()
   - SuspendVendorCommand ‚Üí execute() / undo()


13. CHAIN OF RESPONSIBILITY
‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Request ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶ø chain ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶ß‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ßá pass ‡¶π‡¶Ø‡¶º
         ‡¶Ø‡ßá handle ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßá ‡¶∏‡ßá ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Order Validation Chain
   Request: Place Order
   Chain:
   ‚Üí StockCheckHandler (Stock ‡¶Ü‡¶õ‡ßá?)
   ‚Üí PaymentValidationHandler (Card valid?)
   ‚Üí AddressValidationHandler (Address valid?)
   ‚Üí FraudCheckHandler (Fraud ‡¶®‡¶Ø‡¶º?)
   ‚Üí RateLimitHandler (Spam ‡¶®‡¶Ø‡¶º?)
   ‚Üí OrderCreationHandler (Order ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶∞‡¶ø)


Product Approval Chain
   Request: Submit Product
   Chain:
   ‚Üí ContentValidationHandler (Content OK?)
   ‚Üí ImageValidationHandler (Images OK?)
   ‚Üí PriceValidationHandler (Price reasonable?)
   ‚Üí CategoryCheckHandler (Category exists?)
   ‚Üí AdminApprovalHandler (Admin approve?)


Payment Processing Chain
   Request: Process Payment
   Chain:
   ‚Üí ValidationHandler (Data valid?)
   ‚Üí FraudDetectionHandler (Not fraud?)
   ‚Üí GatewayHandler (Gateway call)
   ‚Üí ConfirmationHandler (Confirm order)
   ‚Üí NotificationHandler (Send email)


Discount Application Chain
   Request: Calculate Discount
   Chain:
   ‚Üí CouponDiscountHandler
   ‚Üí PromotionDiscountHandler
   ‚Üí MemberDiscountHandler
   ‚Üí VolumeDiscountHandler
   ‚Üí FinalPriceHandler


Permission Check Chain
   Request: Access Resource
   Chain:
   ‚Üí AuthenticationHandler (Logged in?)
   ‚Üí AuthorizationHandler (Has permission?)
   ‚Üí OwnershipHandler (Owns resource?)
   ‚Üí StatusHandler (Account active?)
   ‚Üí ResourceHandler (Give access)


14. STATE PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Object ‡¶è‡¶∞ internal state ‡¶¨‡¶¶‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶≤‡ßá
         behavior ‡¶ì ‡¶¨‡¶¶‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Order State Machine
   PendingState:
   ‚Üí pay() ‚Üí ProcessingState
   ‚Üí cancel() ‚Üí CancelledState


   ProcessingState:
   ‚Üí ship() ‚Üí ShippedState
   ‚Üí cancel() ‚Üí CancelledState


   ShippedState:
   ‚Üí deliver() ‚Üí DeliveredState
   ‚Üí return() ‚Üí ReturnedState


   DeliveredState:
   ‚Üí review() ‚Üí ReviewedState
   ‚Üí refund() ‚Üí RefundedState


Vendor State Machine
   PendingState:
   ‚Üí approve() ‚Üí ActiveState
   ‚Üí reject() ‚Üí RejectedState


   ActiveState:
   ‚Üí suspend() ‚Üí SuspendedState
   ‚Üí ban() ‚Üí BannedState


   SuspendedState:
   ‚Üí reactivate() ‚Üí ActiveState
   ‚Üí ban() ‚Üí BannedState


Product State Machine
   DraftState:
   ‚Üí submit() ‚Üí PendingState
   ‚Üí delete() ‚Üí DeletedState


   PendingState:
   ‚Üí approve() ‚Üí PublishedState
   ‚Üí reject() ‚Üí RejectedState


   PublishedState:
   ‚Üí unpublish() ‚Üí InactiveState
   ‚Üí outOfStock() ‚Üí OutOfStockState


Payment State Machine
   PendingState:
   ‚Üí process() ‚Üí ProcessingState
   ‚Üí fail() ‚Üí FailedState


   ProcessingState:
   ‚Üí confirm() ‚Üí CompletedState
   ‚Üí fail() ‚Üí FailedState


   CompletedState:
   ‚Üí refund() ‚Üí RefundedState


Shipment State Machine
   PreparedState ‚Üí ShippedState
   ‚Üí InTransitState ‚Üí OutForDeliveryState
   ‚Üí DeliveredState / FailedState


15. TEMPLATE METHOD PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Algorithm ‡¶è‡¶∞ skeleton define ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ,
         specific steps subclass ‡¶è implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


Report Generation Template
   generateReport():
   ‚Üí gatherData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí processData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí formatOutput() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí saveReport() [common, same for all]
   ‚Üí sendEmail() [common, same for all]


Payment Processing Template
   process():
   ‚Üí validatePaymentData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí callGatewayAPI() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí handleResponse() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí logTransaction() [common]
   ‚Üí sendNotification() [common]


Import Template (CSV Import)
   import():
   ‚Üí readFile() [common]
   ‚Üí parseData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí validateData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí saveToDatabase() [common]
   ‚Üí sendSummary() [common]


Notification Template
   send():
   ‚Üí buildMessage() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí formatForChannel() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí deliverMessage() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí logNotification() [common]
   ‚Üí trackDelivery() [common]


Export Template
   export():
   ‚Üí fetchData() [common]
   ‚Üí transformData() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí formatOutput() [subclass implement ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡ßá]
   ‚Üí writeToFile() [common]
   ‚Üí returnFile() [common]


16. REPOSITORY PATTERN


‡¶∏‡¶Ç‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶æ: Data access logic ‡¶Ü‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ layer ‡¶è ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶æ


‡¶ï‡ßã‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶Ø‡¶º ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶¨‡¶π‡¶æ‡¶∞:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


ProductRepository
   - findById()
   - findByVendor()
   - findByCategory()
   - findFeatured()
   - search()
   - save()
   - delete()


OrderRepository
   - findById()
   - findByUser()
   - findByVendor()
   - findByStatus()
   - findByDateRange()
   - save()


UserRepository
   - findById()
   - findByEmail()
   - findByRole()
   - findActive()
   - save()
   - delete()


VendorRepository
   - findById()
   - findApproved()
   - findPending()
   - findTopRated()
   - save()


ReviewRepository
   - findByProduct()
   - findByUser()
   - findPending()
   - findByRating()
   - save()
   - delete()


COMPLETE PATTERN MAP SUMMARY


DESIGN PATTERNS DECISION TREE DIAGRAM
üå≥
Design Patterns Decision Tree
Multi-Vendor E-commerce Platform  ¬∑  Feb 2026  ¬∑  v2.0

E-COMMERCE PLATFORM

DESIGN PATTERNS DECISION TREE DIAGRAM

DETAILED DECISION TREE WITH QUESTIONS

Level 1: Primary Classification

BRANCH A: DATA ACCESS PATTERNS

BRANCH B: OBJECT CREATION PATTERNS

  • Main Question: "How complex is object creation?"
  • Three Branches:

1. Multiple Implementations ‚Üí Question B1: "Need to select implementation at runtime?"

  • YES ‚Üí Factory Pattern (Payment Gateway, Shipping Method, Report Format, Search Engine)
  • NO ‚Üí Use new

2. Step by Step Build ‚Üí Question B2: "Many optional parameters and validation?"

  • YES ‚Üí Builder Pattern (Order Creation, Query Building, Report Building, Email Building)
  • NO ‚Üí Use Constructor

3. Dynamic Feature Add ‚Üí Question B3: "Need to add features at runtime?"

  • YES ‚Üí Decorator Pattern (Price calc with tax/discount, Notifications with log/retry/queue, Repository with cache/log)
  • NO ‚Üí Direct Inheritance

Each Pattern Includes:

  • Use cases/when to use
  • Code examples showing implementation
  • Benefits with checkmarks (‚úì Easy to add, ‚úì Readable, ‚úì Flexible, etc.)

BRANCH C: BEHAVIORAL PATTERNS

  • Main Question: "How do components interact?"
  • Three Branches:

1. Business Workflow ‚Üí Question C1: "Complex multi-step workflow with multiple services?"

  • YES ‚Üí Service Layer Pattern (Order Creation, Payment Processing, User Registration, Product Approval)
  • NO ‚Üí Put in Controller

2. Need to Vary Algo ‚Üí Question C2: "Same operation, different implementations at runtime?"

  • YES ‚Üí Strategy Pattern (Payment Processing, Shipping Calculation, Tax Calc, Search Ranking, Discount Rules)
  • NO ‚Üí Use if/else

3. Multiple Handlers ‚Üí Question C3: "Need to notify multiple parts of system?"

  • YES ‚Üí Observer Pattern (Events) (Order placed, Payment OK, User signup, Product created with listeners: SendEmail, UpdateStock, CreateComm, NotifyVendor)
  • NO ‚Üí Direct Method Call

Each Pattern Includes:

  • Use cases/when to use
  • Code examples showing implementation
  • Benefits with checkmarks (‚úì Reusable, ‚úì No if/else, ‚úì Decoupled, etc.)

COMPREHENSIVE FLOWCHART

Main Structure:

  • Top Level: "NEED TO SOLVE?"
  • Three Main Branches:

1. Access Data ‚Üí Source Type? ‚Üí Database/External ‚Üí Repository/Adapter Pattern

2. Create Objects ‚Üí Multiple Types? ‚Üí Runtime/Simple ‚Üí Factory/Builder Pattern

3. Behave/Flow ‚Üí Complexity? ‚Üí Workflow/Simple ‚Üí Service Layer/Direct Method

Decision Flow:

  • Database access can lead to Repository Pattern
  • External APIs lead to Adapter Pattern
  • Both can have caching needs ‚Üí Decorator Pattern
  • Object creation branches to Factory or Builder based on runtime needs
  • Workflow complexity leads to Service Layer
  • Side effects trigger Observer Pattern
  • All paths can converge to Strategy Pattern

Cross-Cutting Concerns Section:

  • Observer Pattern - for notifying many components
  • Chain of Responsibility - for step-by-step validation
  • Facade Pattern - to simplify complex systems
  • Singleton - for single instance needs
  • Dependency Injection - for dependency management

This master diagram unifies all three pattern categories and adds essential cross-cutting concerns that apply across all categories!

QUICK DECISION MATRIX

IF-THEN DECISION TABLE

IF YOU NEED TO...

AND...

THEN USE...

EXAMPLE

Access database

Complex queries, caching

REPOSITORY

ProductRepository

Access database

Simple CRUD

Direct Eloquent

	User::find($id)
	Call external API
	Incompatible interface
	ADAPTER
	StripeAdapter
	Call external API
	Multiple APIs
	ADAPTER + FACADE
	PaymentFacade
	Execute workflow
	Multiple services
	SERVICE LAYER
	OrderService
	Execute workflow
	Simple operation
	Controller method
	Store in controller
	Create object
	Multiple implementations
	FACTORY
	PaymentGatewayFactory
	Create object
	Many parameters
	BUILDER
	OrderBuilder
	Create object
	Simple creation
	new Class()
	new Product()
	Add features
	Dynamically at runtime
	DECORATOR
	PriceDecorator
	Add features
	Static features
	Inheritance
	Child extends Parent
	Vary algorithm
	Multiple implementations
	STRATEGY
	ShippingStrategy
	Vary algorithm
	One implementation
	Direct method
	calculateTax()
	Notify components
	Multiple listeners
	OBSERVER
	OrderPlaced event
	Notify components
	Direct call
	Method call
	$service->notify()
	Validate data
	Multi-step process
	CHAIN
	Middleware chain
	Validate data
	Single step
	Form Request
	LoginRequest
	Simplify complex
	Many subsystems
	FACADE
	PaymentFacade
	Simplify complex
	One system
	Service class
	PaymentService
	Ensure one instance
	Shared resource
	SINGLETON
	ConfigManager
	Ensure one instance
	Testable code
	Container binding
	app()->singleton()
	________________


PATTERN COMBINATION GUIDE
Common Pattern Combinations
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
                   TYPICAL FLOW PATTERNS                                                                                  
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


1. DATA ACCESS FLOW:
   ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
   Controller ‚Üí Service ‚Üí Repository ‚Üí Database
                             ‚Üì                   ‚Üì
                      BUSINESS    DATA ACCESS
                         LOGIC        PATTERN
   
   Patterns Used:
   ‚úì Repository Pattern (data access)
   ‚úì Service Layer (business logic)
   ‚úì Dependency Injection (wiring)


2. EXTERNAL SERVICE FLOW:
   ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
   Service ‚Üí Factory ‚Üí Adapter ‚Üí External API
                          ‚Üì              ‚Üì
                  CREATES   TRANSLATES
                     TYPE        INTERFACE
   
   Patterns Used:
   ‚úì Factory Pattern (select implementation)
   ‚úì Adapter Pattern (unify interface)
   ‚úì Strategy Pattern (swap implementations)


3. COMPLEX CALCULATION FLOW:
   ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
   Service ‚Üí BaseCalculator
                ‚Üì
           Decorator 1 (Tax)
                ‚Üì
           Decorator 2 (Discount)
                ‚Üì
           Decorator 3 (Shipping)
                ‚Üì
            Final Price
   
   Patterns Used:
   ‚úì Decorator Pattern (add features)
   ‚úì Strategy Pattern (calculation methods)


4. EVENT-DRIVEN FLOW:
   ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
   Service ‚Üí Dispatch Event ‚Üí Multiple Listeners
                                                             ‚Üì
                                                   - SendEmail
                                                   - UpdateStock
                                                   - CreateCommission
                                                   - LogActivity
   
   Patterns Used:
   ‚úì Observer Pattern (events/listeners)
   ‚úì Service Layer (orchestration)


5. OBJECT CREATION FLOW:
   ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
   Controller ‚Üí Builder ‚Üí Validator ‚Üí Factory ‚Üí Object
                           ‚Üì                ‚Üì                ‚Üì
                   STEP BY    VALIDATE    SELECT
                      STEP        DATA            TYPE
   
   Patterns Used:
   ‚úì Builder Pattern (complex construction)
   ‚úì Factory Pattern (type selection)
   ‚úì Chain of Responsibility (validation)
REAL-WORLD SCENARIO DECISIONS
Scenario 1: Adding New Payment Gateway
Question: We need to integrate a new payment gateway (Razorpay)


Decision Tree:


Decision Flow:
1. Question: We need to integrate a new payment gateway (Razorpay)
2. Is it external API? ‚Üí YES
3. Does existing code work with multiple gateways? ‚Üí YES
4. Do gateways share common interface? ‚Üí YES
Solution (3 Steps):
1. Create RazorpayAdapter implements PaymentGateway Interface
2. Register in Factory
3. Configure credentials
Patterns Used:
* ‚úì Adapter Pattern (for API integration)
* ‚úì Factory Pattern (to create instances)
* ‚úì Strategy Pattern (to select at runtime)


Code Changes:
- Create: app/Services/Payment/RazorpayAdapter.php
- Update: app/Services/Payment/PaymentGatewayFactory.php
- Config: config/payment.php


Existing Code: UNCHANGED ‚úì


Scenario 2: Adding Product Caching
Question: Products are loading slowly, need caching


Decision Tree:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
              Is data access in   
                   Repository?         
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                         YES
                             ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
          Want to add feature without 
            changing existing code?     
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                          YES
                            ‚îÇ
         ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                  SOLUTION:   
                  1. Create   
                 CacheDecorator
                  wrapping    
                  Repository  
                     
        ‚îÇ          2. Bind     
        ‚îÇ         decorated   
        ‚îÇ          version in  
                   container   
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò


Alternative:
If NO Repository exists:
‚Üí First implement Repository Pattern
‚Üí Then add Decorator


Patterns Used:
‚úì Repository Pattern (data access)
‚úì Decorator Pattern (add caching)


Code Changes:
- Create: app/Repositories/Decorators/CacheDecorator.php
- Update: app/Providers/RepositoryServiceProvider.php


Repository Code: UNCHANGED ‚úì


Scenario 3: Order Confirmation Flow


Question: When order is placed, need to:
- Send email to customer
- Update inventory
- Notify vendor
- Create commission
- Log analytics


Decision Tree:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
            Are these side      
‚îÇ           effects to order    
                    creation?           
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                          YES
                             ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
               Should they execute         
‚îÇ                 asynchronously?             
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                         YES
                             ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
               Multiple components need    
               to react to same event?     
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                          YES
                            ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚îÇ    SOLUTION:   
    ‚îÇ  1. Dispatch 
    ‚îÇ    OrderPlaced 
    ‚îÇ    Event       
    ‚îÇ             
    ‚îÇ 2. Create   
    ‚îÇ Listeners:  
    ‚îÇ - SendEmail 
    ‚îÇ - UpdateInv 
    ‚îÇ - NotifyVend
    ‚îÇ - CreateComm
    ‚îÇ - LogAnalyt 
    ‚îÇ             
    ‚îÇ 3. Queue    
    ‚îÇ listeners   
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò


Patterns Used:
‚úì Observer Pattern (event/listeners)
‚úì Service Layer (dispatch event)


Code Changes:
- Create: app/Events/Order/OrderPlaced.php
- Create: Multiple listener files
- Register: EventServiceProvider


OrderService: Only adds event dispatch ‚úì


Scenario 4: Shipping Calculation


Question: Need different shipping calculations:
- Standard (5-7 days)
- Express (2-3 days)
- Overnight (next day)
- International


Decision Tree:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
            Same operation with 
               different logic?    
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                         YES
                            ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
             Select method at runtime    
                 based on user choice?       
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                         YES
                             ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
              Will you add more shipping  
                  methods in future?          
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                         YES
                           ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚îÇ SOLUTION:   
    ‚îÇ 1. Create   
    ‚îÇ Shipping    
    ‚îÇ Method      
    ‚îÇ Interface   
    ‚îÇ             
    ‚îÇ 2. Implement
    ‚îÇ each method 
    ‚îÇ as strategy 
    ‚îÇ             
    ‚îÇ 3. Use      
    ‚îÇ Factory to  
    ‚îÇ create      
    ‚îÇ             
    ‚îÇ 4. Service  
    ‚îÇ uses chosen 
    ‚îÇ strategy    
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò


Patterns Used:
‚úì Strategy Pattern (methods)
‚úì Factory Pattern (creation)


Code Changes:
- Create: app/Services/Shipping/ShippingMethodInterface.php
- Create: Four strategy classes
- Create: ShippingMethodFactory.php
- Update: CheckoutService.php


Adding new method: Only create new strategy class ‚úì


ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID


‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
‚ïë                    WRONG DECISIONS                                                                                             ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê


WRONG: Business logic in Controller
   RIGHT: Business logic in Service
   
WRONG: Database queries in Controller
   RIGHT: Queries in Repository
   
WRONG: Multiple implementations without pattern
   RIGHT: Use Strategy or Factory
   
WRONG: Creating pattern before need exists
   RIGHT: Add pattern when second implementation needed
   
WRONG: Complex conditionals for type selection
   RIGHT: Use Factory Pattern
   
WRONG: Tight coupling to external API
   RIGHT: Use Adapter Pattern
   
WRONG: God objects (classes doing everything)
   RIGHT: Single Responsibility Principle
   
WRONG: Duplicate code across codebase
   RIGHT: Use Repository or Service
   
WRONG: Synchronous side effects in main flow
   RIGHT: Use Observer Pattern with queues
   
WRONG: Direct dependency instantiation
   RIGHT: Dependency Injection


PATTERN SELECTION CHECKLIST


‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ                                                                                                              
                                             BEFORE CHOOSING PATTERN
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


‚ñ° Is there a simpler solution without a pattern?
  ‚Üí If YES: Use simpler solution first


‚ñ° Do I have two or more implementations?
  ‚Üí If NO: Wait until second implementation needed (YAGNI)


‚ñ° Will this improve testability significantly?
  ‚Üí If YES: Pattern is justified


‚ñ° Will future developers understand this?
  ‚Üí If NO: Simplify or document well


‚ñ° Am I solving current problem or hypothetical future?
  ‚Üí If HYPOTHETICAL: Don't implement yet


‚ñ° Does the pattern match my exact use case?
  ‚Üí If NO: Don't force the pattern


‚ñ° Can I explain why I chose this pattern in one sentence?
  ‚Üí If NO: Reconsider


‚ñ° Will this make maintenance easier?
  ‚Üí If NO: Reconsider
SUMMARY: QUICK REFERENCE
MY SITUATION
	USE THIS PATTERN
	üóÑÔ∏è Need to query database
	REPOSITORY
	üîå Integrating external API
	ADAPTER
	‚öôÔ∏è Complex business workflow
	SERVICE LAYER
	üè≠ Multiple implementations
	FACTORY + STRATEGY
	üé® Add features dynamically
	DECORATOR
	üì¢ Notify multiple parts
	OBSERVER (Events)
	üèóÔ∏è Complex object creation
	BUILDER
	üéØ Simplify complex system
	FACADE
	üîó Multi-step processing
	CHAIN OF RESPONSIBILITY
	üíâ Manage dependencies
	DEPENDENCY INJECTION
	________________


USE THIS DECISION TREE WHEN:
* Starting new feature
* Refactoring existing code
* Code review
* Architecture planning
REMEMBER:
* Patterns are tools, not goals
* Start simple, add patterns when needed
* Don't over-engineer
* Test-driven development helps identify pattern needs


PERFORMANCE, ERROR TRACKING, SEARCH & ADMIN PANEL
üìä
Additional Critical Diagrams & Flowcharts
Multi-Vendor E-commerce Platform  ¬∑  Feb 2026  ¬∑  v2.0

ADDITIONAL CRITICAL DIAGRAMS & FLOWCHARTS

E-COMMERCE PLATFORM

1. COMPLETE SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE DIAGRAM

2. REQUEST LIFECYCLE FLOWCHART

3. DATABASE RELATIONSHIP DIAGRAM

Core Entities:

Core Entities:

  • USERS (with inheritance to CUSTOMERS, VENDORS, ADMINS)
  • PRODUCTS (with PRODUCT_IMAGES, PRODUCT_VARIANTS)
  • ORDERS (with ORDER_ITEMS)
  • CATEGORIES (self-referencing for nested hierarchy)
  • WISHLIST & REVIEWS

Payment & Transaction Flow:

  • ORDERS ‚Üí PAYMENTS ‚Üí REFUNDS
  • COMMISSIONS linked to orders and vendors

Notification System:

  • USERS ‚Üí NOTIFICATIONS
  • NOTIFICATION_PREFERENCES per user

Security & Fraud:

  • FRAUD_CHECKS per order
  • BLOCKED_ENTITIES (standalone)
  • SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITIES per user

4. EVENT-DRIVEN ARCHITECTURE FLOWCHART

ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT DOCUMENTS

ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT DOCUMENTS
