1. ENVIRONMENT SETUP & CONFIGURATION

1.1 Environment File (.env)

# .env

# ===================================

# APPLICATION

# ===================================

APP_NAME="E-commerce Platform"

APP_ENV=local # local, staging, production

APP_KEY=base64:GENERATE_WITH_php_artisan_key:generate

APP_DEBUG=true # false in production

APP_URL=http://localhost:8000

# ===================================

# DATABASE

# ===================================

DB_CONNECTION=pgsql

DB_HOST=127.0.0.1

DB_PORT=5432

DB_DATABASE=ecommerce_platform

DB_USERNAME=postgres

DB_PASSWORD=secret

# ===================================

# REDIS (Cache, Queue, Session)

# ===================================

REDIS_HOST=127.0.0.1

REDIS_PASSWORD=null

REDIS_PORT=6379

REDIS_CLIENT=phpredis # or predis

# Cache

CACHE_DRIVER=redis

# Session

SESSION_DRIVER=redis

SESSION_LIFETIME=120

# Queue

QUEUE_CONNECTION=redis

# ===================================

# EMAIL

# ===================================

MAIL_MAILER=smtp

MAIL_HOST=smtp.mailtrap.io # Development

# MAIL_HOST=smtp.sendgrid.net # Production

MAIL_PORT=2525

MAIL_USERNAME=your_username

MAIL_PASSWORD=your_password

MAIL_ENCRYPTION=tls

MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS="noreply@platform.com"

MAIL_FROM_NAME="${APP_NAME}"

# ===================================

# AWS S3 (File Storage)

# ===================================

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_access_key

AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_secret_key

AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-east-1

AWS_BUCKET=ecommerce-platform-storage

AWS_URL=https://ecommerce-platform-storage.s3.amazonaws.com

AWS_USE_PATH_STYLE_ENDPOINT=false

FILESYSTEM_DISK=s3 # or 'public' for local

# ===================================

# PAYMENT GATEWAYS

# ===================================

# Stripe

STRIPE_KEY=pk_test_...

STRIPE_SECRET=sk_test_...

STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET=whsec_...

# PayPal

PAYPAL_MODE=sandbox # or 'live'

PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id

PAYPAL_SECRET=your_secret

# ===================================

# SEARCH (Meilisearch/Algolia)

# ===================================

SCOUT_DRIVER=meilisearch

MEILISEARCH_HOST=http://127.0.0.1:7700

MEILISEARCH_KEY=masterKey

# ===================================

# MONITORING

# ===================================

# Sentry

SENTRY_LARAVEL_DSN=https://...@sentry.io/...

SENTRY_TRACES_SAMPLE_RATE=0.2

# New Relic

NEWRELIC_LICENSE_KEY=your_license_key

# ===================================

# API KEYS

# ===================================

# Google Maps (for address autocomplete)

GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY=your_api_key

# SMS (Twilio)

TWILIO_SID=your_sid

TWILIO_TOKEN=your_token

TWILIO_FROM=+1234567890

# ===================================

# FRONTEND

# ===================================

FRONTEND_URL=http://localhost:3000

ADMIN_URL=http://localhost:3001

# ===================================

# PLATFORM CONFIGURATION

# ===================================

DEFAULT_COMMISSION_RATE=10.00

MIN_PAYOUT_AMOUNT=50.00

TAX_RATE=0.10

FREE_SHIPPING_THRESHOLD=100.00

STOCK_RESERVATION_MINUTES=15

ABANDONED_CART_HOURS=24

# ===================================

# SECURITY

# ===================================

SANCTUM_STATEFUL_DOMAINS=localhost,localhost:3000,127.0.0.1,127.0.0.1:8000,::1

SESSION_DOMAIN=localhost

1.2 Installation Script

#!/bin/bash

# setup.sh - Complete installation script

echo "üöÄ Starting E-commerce Platform Installation..."

# Check PHP version

php_version=$(php -r "echo PHP_VERSION;")

echo "üìå PHP Version: $php_version"

if [[ ! "$php_version" =~ ^8\.[2-9] ]]; then

echo "‚ùå Error: PHP 8.2+ required"

exit 1

fi

# Install Composer dependencies

echo "üì¶ Installing Composer dependencies..."

composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev

# Copy environment file

if [ ! -f .env ]; then

echo "üìÑ Creating .env file..."

cp .env.example .env

echo "‚ö†Ô∏è Please configure your .env file before continuing"

exit 1

fi

# Generate application key

echo "üîë Generating application key..."

php artisan key:generate

# Create storage symlink

echo "üîó Creating storage symlink..."

php artisan storage:link

# Run migrations

echo "üíæ Running database migrations..."

php artisan migrate --force

# Seed database

echo "üå± Seeding database..."

php artisan db:seed --force

# Clear caches

echo "üßπ Clearing caches..."

php artisan config:clear

php artisan cache:clear

php artisan view:clear

php artisan route:clear

# Optimize

echo "‚ö° Optimizing application..."

php artisan config:cache

php artisan route:cache

php artisan view:cache

# Set permissions

echo "üîê Setting permissions..."

chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache

chown -R www-data:www-data storage bootstrap/cache

# Install NPM dependencies (if needed)

if [ -f package.json ]; then

echo "üì¶ Installing NPM dependencies..."

npm install

npm run build

fi

echo "‚úÖ Installation complete!"

echo ""

echo "Next steps:"

echo "1. Configure your .env file"

echo "2. Run: php artisan serve"

echo "3. Visit: http://localhost:8000"

1.3 Docker Setup

# docker-compose.yml

version: '3.8'

services:

# PHP Application

app:

build:

context: .

dockerfile: docker/php/Dockerfile

container_name: ecommerce_app

restart: unless-stopped

working_dir: /var/www

volumes:

  • ./:/var/www
  • ./docker/php/php.ini:/usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/custom.ini

networks:

  • ecommerce

depends_on:

  • postgres
  • redis

# Nginx Web Server

nginx:

image: nginx:alpine

container_name: ecommerce_nginx

restart: unless-stopped

ports:

  • "80:80"
  • "443:443"

volumes:

  • ./:/var/www
  • ./docker/nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf
  • ./docker/nginx/ssl:/etc/nginx/ssl

networks:

  • ecommerce

depends_on:

  • app

# PostgreSQL Database

postgres:

image: postgres:15-alpine

container_name: ecommerce_postgres

restart: unless-stopped

environment:

      POSTGRES_DB: ${DB_DATABASE}
      POSTGRES_USER: ${DB_USERNAME}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    networks:
      - ecommerce


  # Redis Cache
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: ecommerce_redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    networks:
      - ecommerce


  # Meilisearch
  meilisearch:
    image: getmeilisearch/meilisearch:v1.5
    container_name: ecommerce_meilisearch
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MEILI_MASTER_KEY: ${MEILISEARCH_KEY}
    ports:
      - "7700:7700"
    volumes:
      - meilisearch_data:/meili_data
    networks:
      - ecommerce


  # Queue Worker
  queue:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: docker/php/Dockerfile
    container_name: ecommerce_queue
    restart: unless-stopped
    working_dir: /var/www
    command: php artisan queue:work --sleep=3 --tries=3 --max-time=3600
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
    networks:
      - ecommerce
    depends_on:
      - postgres
      - redis


  # Scheduler
  scheduler:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: docker/php/Dockerfile
    container_name: ecommerce_scheduler
    restart: unless-stopped
    working_dir: /var/www
    command: >
      sh -c "while true; do
        php artisan schedule:run >> /var/log/cron.log 2>&1
        sleep 60
      done"
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
    networks:
      - ecommerce
    depends_on:
      - postgres
      - redis


  # MailHog (Development Email Testing)
  mailhog:
    image: mailhog/mailhog
    container_name: ecommerce_mailhog
    ports:
      - "1025:1025"  # SMTP
      - "8025:8025"  # Web UI
    networks:
      - ecommerce


networks:
  ecommerce:
    driver: bridge


volumes:
  postgres_data:
  redis_data:
  meilisearch_data:
2. QUEUE & JOB PROCESSING
2.1 Queue Configuration
<?php
// config/queue.php


return [
    'default' => env('QUEUE_CONNECTION', 'redis'),


    'connections' => [
        'redis' => [
            'driver' => 'redis',
            'connection' => 'default',
            'queue' => env('REDIS_QUEUE', 'default'),
            'retry_after' => 90,
            'block_for' => null,
            'after_commit' => false,
        ],
    ],


    'failed' => [
        'driver' => env('QUEUE_FAILED_DRIVER', 'database-uuids'),
        'database' => env('DB_CONNECTION', 'pgsql'),
        'table' => 'failed_jobs',
    ],
];
2.2 Example Jobs
Send Order Confirmation Email
<?php
// app/Jobs/SendOrderConfirmationEmail.php


namespace App\Jobs;


use App\Models\Order;
use App\Mail\OrderConfirmation;
use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Queue\ShouldQueue;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Bus\Dispatchable;
use Illuminate\Queue\InteractsWithQueue;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Mail;


class SendOrderConfirmationEmail implements ShouldQueue
{
    use Dispatchable, InteractsWithQueue, Queueable, SerializesModels;


    public $tries = 3;
    public $timeout = 60;
    public $backoff = [30, 60, 120]; // Retry after 30s, 60s, 120s


    public function __construct(
        public Order $order
    ) {}


    public function handle(): void
    {
        Mail::to($this->order->customer->email)
            ->send(new OrderConfirmation($this->order));
    }


    public function failed(\Throwable $exception): void
    {
        // Log failure
        \Log::error('Failed to send order confirmation', [
            'order_id' => $this->order->id,
            'error' => $exception->getMessage(),
        ]);
    }
}


// Usage:
SendOrderConfirmationEmail::dispatch($order);


// Delayed dispatch (send after 5 minutes)
SendOrderConfirmationEmail::dispatch($order)->delay(now()->addMinutes(5));


// Dispatch to specific queue
SendOrderConfirmationEmail::dispatch($order)->onQueue('emails');
Process Product Import


<?php
// app/Jobs/ProcessProductImport.php


namespace App\Jobs;


use App\Models\Vendor;
use Illuminate\Bus\Batchable;
use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Queue\ShouldQueue;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Bus\Dispatchable;
use Illuminate\Queue\InteractsWithQueue;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\DB;


class ProcessProductImport implements ShouldQueue
{
    use Batchable, Dispatchable, InteractsWithQueue, Queueable, SerializesModels;


    public $tries = 1;
    public $timeout = 300; // 5 minutes


    public function __construct(
        public Vendor $vendor,
        public array $productData
    ) {}


    public function handle(): void
    {
        // Check if batch has been cancelled
        if ($this->batch()->cancelled()) {
            return;
        }


        DB::transaction(function () {
            $product = $this->vendor->products()->create([
                'name' => $this->productData['name'],
                'sku' => $this->productData['sku'],
                'regular_price' => $this->productData['price'],
                // ... other fields
            ]);


            // Import images
            if (isset($this->productData['images'])) {
                foreach ($this->productData['images'] as $imageUrl) {
                    ImportProductImage::dispatch($product, $imageUrl);
                }
            }
        });
    }


    public function failed(\Throwable $exception): void
    {
        \Log::error('Product import failed', [
            'vendor_id' => $this->vendor->id,
            'sku' => $this->productData['sku'],
            'error' => $exception->getMessage(),
        ]);
    }
}


// Batch processing:
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Bus;


$batch = Bus::batch([
    new ProcessProductImport($vendor, $product1),
    new ProcessProductImport($vendor, $product2),
    new ProcessProductImport($vendor, $product3),
])->then(function (\Illuminate\Bus\Batch $batch) {
    // All jobs completed successfully
    \Log::info('Product import batch completed', [
        'batch_id' => $batch->id,
        'total_jobs' => $batch->totalJobs,
    ]);
})->catch(function (\Illuminate\Bus\Batch $batch, \Throwable $e) {
    // First batch job failure detected
    \Log::error('Product import batch failed', [
        'batch_id' => $batch->id,
        'error' => $e->getMessage(),
    ]);
})->finally(function (\Illuminate\Bus\Batch $batch) {
    // Batch has finished executing
})->dispatch();
2.3 Supervisor Configuration


# /etc/supervisor/conf.d/ecommerce-worker.conf


[program:ecommerce-worker]
process_name=%(program_name)s_%(process_num)02d
command=php /var/www/platform/artisan queue:work redis --sleep=3 --tries=3 --max-time=3600
autostart=true
autorestart=true
stopasgroup=true
killasgroup=true
user=www-data
numprocs=5
redirect_stderr=true
stdout_logfile=/var/www/platform/storage/logs/worker.log
stopwaitsecs=3600


[program:ecommerce-scheduler]
process_name=%(program_name)s
command=php /var/www/platform/artisan schedule:work
autostart=true
autorestart=true
user=www-data
redirect_stderr=true
stdout_logfile=/var/www/platform/storage/logs/scheduler.log
3. EMAIL & NOTIFICATION SYSTEM
3.1 Mailable Classes
<?php
// app/Mail/OrderConfirmation.php


namespace App\Mail;


use App\Models\Order;
use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;
use Illuminate\Mail\Mailable;
use Illuminate\Mail\Mailables\Content;
use Illuminate\Mail\Mailables\Envelope;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;
use Illuminate\Mail\Mailables\Address;
use Illuminate\Mail\Mailables\Attachment;


class OrderConfirmation extends Mailable
{
    use Queueable, SerializesModels;


    public function __construct(
        public Order $order
    ) {}


    public function envelope(): Envelope
    {
        return new Envelope(
            from: new Address('orders@platform.com', 'Platform Orders'),
            replyTo: [
                new Address('support@platform.com', 'Platform Support'),
            ],
            subject: "Order Confirmation - {$this->order->order_number}",
        );
    }


    public function content(): Content
    {
        return new Content(
            view: 'emails.orders.confirmation',
            text: 'emails.orders.confirmation-text',
            with: [
                'orderNumber' => $this->order->order_number,
                'customerName' => $this->order->customer->name,
                'total' => $this->order->total,
                'items' => $this->order->items,
            ],
        );
    }


    public function attachments(): array
    {
        return [
            Attachment::fromPath(storage_path('invoices/' . $this->order->id . '.pdf'))
                ->as('invoice.pdf')
                ->withMime('application/pdf'),
        ];
    }
}

{{-- resources/views/emails/orders/confirmation.blade.php --}}

3.2 Notification System


<?php
// app/Notifications/OrderShippedNotification.php


namespace App\Notifications;


use App\Models\Order;
use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Queue\ShouldQueue;
use Illuminate\Notifications\Messages\MailMessage;
use Illuminate\Notifications\Messages\DatabaseMessage;
use Illuminate\Notifications\Notification;


class OrderShippedNotification extends Notification implements ShouldQueue
{
    use Queueable;


    public function __construct(
        public Order $order
    ) {}


    /**
     * Notification delivery channels
     */
    public function via($notifiable): array
    {
        $channels = ['database']; // In-app notification
        
        // Add email if user has email notifications enabled
        if ($notifiable->notification_preferences['email'] ?? true) {
            $channels[] = 'mail';
        }
        
        // Add SMS if available
        if ($notifiable->phone && ($notifiable->notification_preferences['sms'] ?? false)) {
            $channels[] = 'sms';
        }
        
        return $channels;
    }


    /**
     * Email notification
     */
    public function toMail($notifiable): MailMessage
    {
        return (new MailMessage)
            ->subject("Your Order Has Shipped! üì¶")
            ->greeting("Hi {$notifiable->name}!")
            ->line("Great news! Your order {$this->order->order_number} has been shipped.")
            ->line("Tracking Number: {$this->order->tracking_number}")
            ->action('Track Your Order', url("/orders/{$this->order->order_number}"))
            ->line('Thank you for shopping with us!');
    }


    /**
     * Database notification (in-app)
     */
    public function toDatabase($notifiable): array
    {
        return [
            'type' => 'order_shipped',
            'title' => 'Your order has been shipped! üì¶',
            'message' => "Order {$this->order->order_number} is on its way!",
            'action_text' => 'Track Order',
            'action_url' => "/orders/{$this->order->order_number}",
            'order_id' => $this->order->id,
            'order_number' => $this->order->order_number,
            'tracking_number' => $this->order->tracking_number,
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Array notification (for custom channels)
     */
    public function toArray($notifiable): array
    {
        return [
            'order_id' => $this->order->id,
            'order_number' => $this->order->order_number,
            'tracking_number' => $this->order->tracking_number,
        ];
    }
}


// Usage:
$user->notify(new OrderShippedNotification($order));


// Or send immediately (bypass queue)
$user->notifyNow(new OrderShippedNotification($order));
4. CACHING STRATEGY
4.1 Cache Configuration
<?php
// config/cache.php


return [
    'default' => env('CACHE_DRIVER', 'redis'),


    'stores' => [
        'redis' => [
            'driver' => 'redis',
            'connection' => 'cache',
            'lock_connection' => 'default',
        ],


        'file' => [
            'driver' => 'file',
            'path' => storage_path('framework/cache/data'),
        ],
    ],


    'prefix' => env('CACHE_PREFIX', 'ecommerce_cache'),
];
4.2 Cache Usage Patterns
Model Caching
<?php
// app/Models/Product.php


namespace App\Models;


use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;


class Product extends Model
{
    /**
     * Cache duration in seconds
     */
    const CACHE_DURATION = 3600; // 1 hour


    /**
     * Get product with cache
     */
    public static function findCached($id)
    {
        $cacheKey = "product:{$id}";
        
        return Cache::remember($cacheKey, self::CACHE_DURATION, function () use ($id) {
            return self::with(['vendor', 'category', 'images', 'variants'])
                ->find($id);
        });
    }


    /**
     * Get featured products with cache
     */
    public static function getFeaturedCached()
    {
        $cacheKey = 'products:featured';
        
        return Cache::remember($cacheKey, self::CACHE_DURATION, function () {
            return self::with(['vendor', 'primaryImage'])
                ->where('is_featured', true)
                ->where('status', 'active')
                ->orderBy('total_sales', 'desc')
                ->limit(12)
                ->get();
        });
    }


    /**
     * Clear product cache when updated
     */
    protected static function boot()
    {
        parent::boot();


        static::saved(function ($product) {
            Cache::forget("product:{$product->id}");
            Cache::forget('products:featured');
            Cache::forget("vendor:{$product->vendor_id}:products");
            Cache::forget("category:{$product->category_id}:products");
        });


        static::deleted(function ($product) {
            Cache::forget("product:{$product->id}");
        });
    }
}
Query Result Caching


<?php
// app/Services/ProductService.php


namespace App\Services;


use App\Models\Product;
use App\Models\Category;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;


class ProductService
{
    /**
     * Get products by category with caching
     */
    public function getByCategory(int $categoryId, array $filters = []): \Illuminate\Pagination\LengthAwarePaginator
    {
        // Generate cache key based on filters
        $cacheKey = $this->generateCacheKey('category_products', $categoryId, $filters);
        
        // Cache for 30 minutes
        return Cache::remember($cacheKey, 1800, function () use ($categoryId, $filters) {
            $query = Product::where('category_id', $categoryId)
                ->where('status', 'active');
            
            // Apply filters
            if (isset($filters['min_price'])) {
                $query->where('regular_price', '>=', $filters['min_price']);
            }
            
            if (isset($filters['max_price'])) {
                $query->where('regular_price', '<=', $filters['max_price']);
            }
            
            if (isset($filters['sort'])) {
                match ($filters['sort']) {
                    'price_low' => $query->orderBy('regular_price', 'asc'),
                    'price_high' => $query->orderBy('regular_price', 'desc'),
                    'popular' => $query->orderBy('total_sales', 'desc'),
                    'rating' => $query->orderBy('average_rating', 'desc'),
                    default => $query->orderBy('published_at', 'desc'),
                };
            }
            
            return $query->with(['vendor', 'primaryImage'])
                ->paginate($filters['per_page'] ?? 20);
        });
    }


    /**
     * Generate cache key from parameters
     */
    private function generateCacheKey(string $prefix, ...$params): string
    {
        $serialized = serialize($params);
        $hash = md5($serialized);
        return "{$prefix}:{$hash}";
    }


    /**
     * Clear category products cache
     */
    public function clearCategoryCache(int $categoryId): void
    {
        // Clear all cached queries for this category
        Cache::tags(['category_' . $categoryId])->flush();
    }
}
Cache Tags (Redis only)


<?php
// Using cache tags for group invalidation


// Store with tags
Cache::tags(['products', 'featured'])->put('featured_products', $products, 3600);


// Retrieve with tags
$products = Cache::tags(['products', 'featured'])->get('featured_products');


// Flush all caches with specific tag
Cache::tags(['products'])->flush(); // Clears all product-related caches
4.4 Cache Best Practice


<?php
// app/Helpers/CacheHelper.php


namespace App\Helpers;


use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;


class CacheHelper
{
    /**
     * Remember with fallback
     * Returns cached value or executes callback, with error handling
     */
    public static function rememberSafe(string $key, int $ttl, callable $callback, $default = null)
    {
        try {
            return Cache::remember($key, $ttl, $callback);
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            \Log::error('Cache error', [
                'key' => $key,
                'error' => $e->getMessage(),
            ]);
            
            try {
                return $callback();
            } catch (\Exception $e) {
                return $default;
            }
        }
    }


    /**
     * Cache with lock (prevent cache stampede)
     */
    public static function rememberWithLock(string $key, int $ttl, callable $callback)
    {
        $value = Cache::get($key);
        
        if ($value !== null) {
            return $value;
        }
        
        $lock = Cache::lock("lock:{$key}", 10);
        
        try {
            $lock->block(5);
            
            // Double-check after acquiring lock
            $value = Cache::get($key);
            if ($value !== null) {
                return $value;
            }
            
            $value = $callback();
            Cache::put($key, $value, $ttl);
            
            return $value;
            
        } finally {
            $lock->release();
        }
    }


    /**
     * Increment with expiry
     */
    public static function incrementWithExpiry(string $key, int $ttl = 3600): int
    {
        if (Cache::has($key)) {
            return Cache::increment($key);
        }
        
        Cache::put($key, 1, $ttl);
        return 1;
    }
}
5. LOGGING & DEBUGGING
5.1 Logging Configuration
<?php
// config/logging.php


return [
    'default' => env('LOG_CHANNEL', 'stack'),


    'channels' => [
        'stack' => [
            'driver' => 'stack',
            'channels' => ['daily', 'slack'],
            'ignore_exceptions' => false,
        ],


        'daily' => [
            'driver' => 'daily',
            'path' => storage_path('logs/laravel.log'),
            'level' => env('LOG_LEVEL', 'debug'),
            'days' => 14,
        ],


        'slack' => [
            'driver' => 'slack',
            'url' => env('LOG_SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL'),
            'username' => 'Platform Logger',
            'emoji' => ':boom:',
            'level' => 'critical',
        ],


        'sentry' => [
            'driver' => 'sentry',
            'level' => 'error',
        ],


        // Separate channels for different concerns
        'security' => [
            'driver' => 'daily',
            'path' => storage_path('logs/security.log'),
            'level' => 'info',
            'days' => 30,
        ],


        'performance' => [
            'driver' => 'daily',
            'path' => storage_path('logs/performance.log'),
            'level' => 'warning',
            'days' => 7,
        ],


        'api' => [
            'driver' => 'daily',
            'path' => storage_path('logs/api.log'),
            'level' => 'debug',
            'days' => 7,
        ],
    ],
];
5.2 Structured Logging


<?php
// app/Services/Logger/StructuredLogger.php


namespace App\Services\Logger;


use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Log;


class StructuredLogger
{
    /**
     * Log with context
     */
    public static function log(string $level, string $message, array $context = []): void
    {
        $enrichedContext = array_merge([
            'timestamp' => now()->toIso8601String(),
            'user_id' => auth()->id(),
            'ip' => request()->ip(),
            'user_agent' => request()->userAgent(),
            'url' => request()->fullUrl(),
            'method' => request()->method(),
        ], $context);


        Log::log($level, $message, $enrichedContext);
    }


    /**
     * Log security event
     */
    public static function security(string $event, array $data = []): void
    {
        Log::channel('security')->info($event, array_merge([
            'event_type' => 'security',
            'timestamp' => now()->toIso8601String(),
            'user_id' => auth()->id(),
            'ip' => request()->ip(),
        ], $data));
    }


    /**
     * Log performance issue
     */
    public static function performance(string $metric, float $value, string $unit = 'ms'): void
    {
        Log::channel('performance')->warning("Performance: {$metric}", [
            'metric' => $metric,
            'value' => $value,
            'unit' => $unit,
            'threshold_exceeded' => $value > 1000, // Example threshold
            'url' => request()->fullUrl(),
        ]);
    }


    /**
     * Log API request/response
     */
    public static function api(string $endpoint, string $method, array $data = []): void
    {
        Log::channel('api')->info("API: {$method} {$endpoint}", array_merge([
            'endpoint' => $endpoint,
            'method' => $method,
            'timestamp' => now()->toIso8601String(),
            'user_id' => auth()->id(),
        ], $data));
    }


    /**
     * Log business event
     */
    public static function business(string $event, array $data = []): void
    {
        Log::info("Business Event: {$event}", array_merge([
            'event_type' => 'business',
            'event_name' => $event,
            'timestamp' => now()->toIso8601String(),
        ], $data));
    }
}


// Usage examples:


// Security event
StructuredLogger::security('failed_login_attempt', [
    'email' => $email,
    'reason' => 'invalid_password',
]);


// Performance monitoring
StructuredLogger::performance('database_query', 1234.56, 'ms');


// API logging
StructuredLogger::api('/api/v1/orders', 'POST', [
    'status_code' => 201,
    'response_time' => 145.23,
]);


// Business event
StructuredLogger::business('order_placed', [
    'order_id' => $order->id,
    'total' => $order->total,
    'item_count' => $order->items->count(),
]);
5.3 Query Debugging
<?php
// app/Providers/AppServiceProvider.php


namespace App\Providers;


use Illuminate\Support\ServiceProvider;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\DB;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Log;


class AppServiceProvider extends ServiceProvider
{
    public function boot(): void
    {
        // Log slow queries (only in development/staging)
        if (config('app.env') !== 'production') {
            DB::listen(function ($query) {
                if ($query->time > 1000) { // Log queries taking > 1 second
                    Log::channel('performance')->warning('Slow Query Detected', [
                        'sql' => $query->sql,
                        'bindings' => $query->bindings,
                        'time' => $query->time . 'ms',
                    ]);
                }
            });
        }


        // Log all queries in local environment
        if (config('app.env') === 'local' && config('app.debug')) {
            DB::listen(function ($query) {
                \Log::debug('Query', [
                    'sql' => $query->sql,
                    'bindings' => $query->bindings,
                    'time' => $query->time . 'ms',
                ]);
            });
        }
    }
}

// config/debugbar.php

        'messages'        => true,
        'time'            => true,
        'memory'          => true,
        'exceptions'      => true,
        'log'             => true,
        'db'              => true,
        'views'           => true,
        'route'           => true,
        'auth'            => true,
        'gate'            => true,
        'session'         => true,
        'symfony_request' => true,
        'mail'            => true,
        'laravel'         => true,
        'events'          => true,
        'default_request' => true,
        'logs'            => true,
        'files'           => false,
        'config'          => false,
        'cache'           => true,
        'models'          => true,
        'livewire'        => false,
    ],
];
6. SECURITY BEST PRACTICES
6.1 Security Headers Middleware


<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/SecurityHeaders.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class SecurityHeaders
{
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next)
    {
        $response = $next($request);


        // Prevent clickjacking
        $response->headers->set('X-Frame-Options', 'SAMEORIGIN');


        // Prevent MIME sniffing
        $response->headers->set('X-Content-Type-Options', 'nosniff');


        // XSS Protection
        $response->headers->set('X-XSS-Protection', '1; mode=block');


        // HTTPS enforcement
        if (config('app.env') === 'production') {
            $response->headers->set('Strict-Transport-Security', 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains');
        }


        // Content Security Policy
        $response->headers->set('Content-Security-Policy', 
            "default-src 'self'; " .
            "script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval' https://cdn.jsdelivr.net; " .
            "style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://fonts.googleapis.com; " .
            "img-src 'self' data: https:; " .
            "font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com; " .
            "connect-src 'self' https://api.platform.com;"
        );


        // Referrer Policy
        $response->headers->set('Referrer-Policy', 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin');


        // Permissions Policy
        $response->headers->set('Permissions-Policy', 
            'geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()'
        );


        return $response;
    }
}
6.2 Input Sanitization
<?php
// app/Services/Security/InputSanitizer.php


namespace App\Services\Security;


class InputSanitizer
{
    /**
     * Sanitize HTML content
     */
    public static function sanitizeHtml(string $html): string
    {
        // Strip all tags except safe ones
        $allowedTags = '<p><br><strong><em><u><ul><ol><li><a><h1><h2><h3><h4><h5><h6>';
        $clean = strip_tags($html, $allowedTags);


        // Remove javascript: and on* event handlers
        $clean = preg_replace('/javascript:/i', '', $clean);
        $clean = preg_replace('/on\w+\s*=/i', '', $clean);


        return $clean;
    }


    /**
     * Sanitize filename
     */
    public static function sanitizeFilename(string $filename): string
    {
        // Remove directory separators and special chars
        $filename = str_replace(['/', '\\', '..'], '', $filename);
        $filename = preg_replace('/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/', '', $filename);
        
        return $filename;
    }


    /**
     * Sanitize SQL input (additional to parameterized queries)
     */
    public static function sanitizeSql(string $input): string
    {
        return addslashes(strip_tags($input));
    }


    /**
     * Sanitize URL
     */
    public static function sanitizeUrl(string $url): string
    {
        $url = filter_var($url, FILTER_SANITIZE_URL);
        
        // Only allow http and https protocols
        if (!preg_match('/^https?:\/\//i', $url)) {
            return '';
        }
        
        return $url;
    }
}
6.3 Rate Limiting for Security


<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/ThrottleFailedLogins.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Cache\RateLimiter;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;


class ThrottleFailedLogins
{
    protected $limiter;


    public function __construct(RateLimiter $limiter)
    {
        $this->limiter = $limiter;
    }


    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next): Response
    {
        $key = $this->resolveRequestSignature($request);


        // Check if too many attempts
        if ($this->limiter->tooManyAttempts($key, 5)) {
            $seconds = $this->limiter->availableIn($key);
            
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => "Too many login attempts. Please try again in {$seconds} seconds.",
            ], 429);
        }


        $response = $next($request);


        // If login failed, increment attempts
        if ($response->status() === 401) {
            $this->limiter->hit($key, 900); // 15 minutes
        } else {
            // Clear on successful login
            $this->limiter->clear($key);
        }


        return $response;
    }


    protected function resolveRequestSignature(Request $request): string
    {
        return 'login_attempts:' . $request->ip() . ':' . $request->input('email');
    }
}
6.5 SQL Injection Prevention


<?php
// ALWAYS use parameterized queries


// ‚úÖ CORRECT - Using query builder (safe)
$users = DB::table('users')
    ->where('email', $email)
    ->get();


// ‚úÖ CORRECT - Using Eloquent (safe)
$user = User::where('email', $email)->first();


// ‚úÖ CORRECT - Using parameterized raw query (safe)
$users = DB::select('SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = ?', [$email]);


// ‚ùå WRONG - String concatenation (NEVER DO THIS)
$users = DB::select("SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = '{$email}'");


// ‚úÖ CORRECT - Named bindings (safe)
$users = DB::select('SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = :email', ['email' => $email]);


// For dynamic column names (use whitelist)
$allowedColumns = ['name', 'email', 'created_at'];
$column = request('sort_by');


if (in_array($column, $allowedColumns)) {
    $users = User::orderBy($column)->get();
}
7. PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION
7.1 Database Query Optimization
<?php
// Eager Loading (N+1 Query Problem Solution)


// ‚ùå BAD - N+1 Problem
$products = Product::all();
foreach ($products as $product) {
    echo $product->vendor->name; // Triggers query for each product
}


// ‚úÖ GOOD - Eager Loading
$products = Product::with('vendor')->get();
foreach ($products as $product) {
    echo $product->vendor->name; // No additional queries
}


// ‚úÖ BETTER - Nested Eager Loading
$products = Product::with([
    'vendor',
    'category',
    'images',
    'variants.images',
])->get();


// ‚úÖ BEST - Conditional Eager Loading
$products = Product::with([
    'vendor:id,business_name', // Select specific columns
    'category:id,name',
    'images' => function ($query) {
        $query->where('is_primary', true); // Filter related records
    },
])->get();


// Lazy Eager Loading (load after fetching)
$products = Product::all();
$products->load('vendor', 'category');


// Count Related Models (without loading)
$products = Product::withCount('reviews')->get();
foreach ($products as $product) {
    echo $product->reviews_count; // No query needed
}
7.2 Database Indexing Strategy
-- Already covered in database design, but here's a reminder:


-- Single column index
CREATE INDEX idx_products_status ON products(status);


-- Composite index (order matters!)
CREATE INDEX idx_products_vendor_status ON products(vendor_id, status);
-- Good for: WHERE vendor_id = ? AND status = ?
-- Also good for: WHERE vendor_id = ?
-- NOT good for: WHERE status = ?


-- Partial index (smaller, faster)
CREATE INDEX idx_products_active ON products(created_at) 
WHERE status = 'active';


-- Unique index
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_products_sku ON products(vendor_id, sku);


-- Full-text search index
CREATE INDEX idx_products_search ON products 
USING gin(to_tsvector('english', name || ' ' || description));


-- JSONB index
CREATE INDEX idx_products_tags ON products USING gin(tags);
7.3 Redis Optimization
<?php
// app/Services/Cache/RedisCacheService.php


namespace App\Services\Cache;


use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Redis;


class RedisCacheService
{
    /**
     * Store multiple values efficiently (pipeline)
     */
    public function setMultiple(array $data, int $ttl = 3600): void
    {
        Redis::pipeline(function ($pipe) use ($data, $ttl) {
            foreach ($data as $key => $value) {
                $pipe->setex($key, $ttl, serialize($value));
            }
        });
    }


    /**
     * Get multiple values efficiently (pipeline)
     */
    public function getMultiple(array $keys): array
    {
        $results = Redis::pipeline(function ($pipe) use ($keys) {
            foreach ($keys as $key) {
                $pipe->get($key);
            }
        });


        return array_map(function ($value) {
            return $value ? unserialize($value) : null;
        }, $results);
    }


    /**
     * Increment counter with expiry
     */
    public function incrementCounter(string $key, int $ttl = 3600): int
    {
        $value = Redis::incr($key);
        
        if ($value === 1) {
            Redis::expire($key, $ttl);
        }
        
        return $value;
    }


    /**
     * Add to sorted set (leaderboard, rankings)
     */
    public function addToRanking(string $key, string $member, float $score): void
    {
        Redis::zadd($key, $score, $member);
    }


    /**
     * Get top rankings
     */
    public function getTopRankings(string $key, int $limit = 10): array
    {
        return Redis::zrevrange($key, 0, $limit - 1, 'WITHSCORES');
    }
}
7.4 Image Optimization
<?php
// app/Services/ImageOptimizationService.php


namespace App\Services;


use Intervention\Image\Facades\Image;
use Spatie\ImageOptimizer\OptimizerChainFactory;


class ImageOptimizationService
{
    /**
     * Optimize and compress image
     */
    public function optimize(string $path): void
    {
        // Resize if too large
        $image = Image::make($path);
        
        if ($image->width() > 2000 || $image->height() > 2000) {
            $image->resize(2000, 2000, function ($constraint) {
                $constraint->aspectRatio();
                $constraint->upsize();
            });
        }


        // Convert to WebP for better compression
        $image->encode('webp', 85)->save($path);


        // Further optimize with external tools
        $optimizerChain = OptimizerChainFactory::create();
        $optimizerChain->optimize($path);
    }


    /**
     * Generate responsive sizes
     */
    public function generateResponsiveSizes(string $originalPath, string $outputDir): array
    {
        $sizes = [
            'thumbnail' => 150,
            'small' => 300,
            'medium' => 600,
            'large' => 1200,
        ];


        $paths = [];


        foreach ($sizes as $name => $width) {
            $image = Image::make($originalPath);
            
            $image->resize($width, null, function ($constraint) {
                $constraint->aspectRatio();
                $constraint->upsize();
            });


            $filename = pathinfo($originalPath, PATHINFO_FILENAME);
            $path = "{$outputDir}/{$filename}_{$name}.webp";
            
            $image->encode('webp', 85)->save($path);
            $this->optimize($path);
            
            $paths[$name] = $path;
        }


        return $paths;
    }
}
8. DEPLOYMENT GUIDE
8.1 Pre-Deployment Checklist
# ‚úÖ Pre-Deployment Checklist


# 1. Code Quality
‚ñ° All tests passing (php artisan test)
‚ñ° No debug code left (dd(), dump(), var_dump())
‚ñ° Code reviewed and approved
‚ñ° Dependencies updated (composer update)


# 2. Configuration
‚ñ° .env configured for production
‚ñ° APP_DEBUG=false
‚ñ° APP_ENV=production
‚ñ° Database credentials verified
‚ñ° API keys configured
‚ñ° HTTPS enabled


# 3. Security
‚ñ° Security headers configured
‚ñ° CSRF protection enabled
‚ñ° Rate limiting configured
‚ñ° Input validation implemented
‚ñ° SQL injection prevention verified
‚ñ° XSS prevention verified


# 4. Performance
‚ñ° Routes cached (php artisan route:cache)
‚ñ° Config cached (php artisan config:cache)
‚ñ° Views cached (php artisan view:cache)
‚ñ° Assets compiled and minified
‚ñ° Images optimized
‚ñ° CDN configured


# 5. Database
‚ñ° Migrations reviewed
‚ñ° Seeders ready (if needed)
‚ñ° Backup strategy in place
‚ñ° Indexes optimized


# 6. Monitoring
‚ñ° Error tracking configured (Sentry)
‚ñ° Logging configured
‚ñ° Performance monitoring set up
‚ñ° Uptime monitoring configured


# 7. Backups
‚ñ° Database backup automated
‚ñ° File storage backup configured
‚ñ° Backup restoration tested
8.4 Nginx Configuration


# /etc/nginx/sites-available/platform


server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;
    server_name platform.com www.platform.com;
    
    # Redirect HTTP to HTTPS
    return 301 https://$server_name$request_uri;
}


server {
    listen 443 ssl http2;
    listen [::]:443 ssl http2;
    server_name platform.com www.platform.com;


    root /var/www/platform/public;
    index index.php index.html;


    # SSL Configuration (Let's Encrypt)
    ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/platform.com/fullchain.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/platform.com/privkey.pem;
    ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3;
    ssl_ciphers HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5;
    ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on;


    # Security Headers
    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN" always;
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always;
    add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always;
    add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" always;
    add_header Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin" always;


    # Logging
    access_log /var/log/nginx/platform_access.log;
    error_log /var/log/nginx/platform_error.log;


    # Gzip compression
    gzip on;
    gzip_vary on;
    gzip_min_length 1024;
    gzip_types text/plain text/css text/xml text/javascript 
               application/x-javascript application/xml+rss 
               application/json application/javascript;


    # Client body size (for file uploads)
    client_max_body_size 10M;


    # Rate limiting
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=api:10m rate=10r/s;
    
    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }


    # API rate limiting
    location /api/ {
        limit_req zone=api burst=20 nodelay;
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }


    # PHP-FPM configuration
    location ~ \.php$ {
        fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php/php8.2-fpm.sock;
        fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $realpath_root$fastcgi_script_name;
        include fastcgi_params;
        fastcgi_hide_header X-Powered-By;
        
        # Increase timeouts for long-running requests
        fastcgi_read_timeout 300;
        fastcgi_send_timeout 300;
    }


    # Deny access to hidden files
    location ~ /\. {
        deny all;
        access_log off;
        log_not_found off;
    }


    # Cache static assets
    location ~* \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|ico|css|js|svg|woff|woff2|ttf|eot)$ {
        expires 1y;
        add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
        access_log off;
    }


    # Deny access to sensitive files
    location ~ /\.(?!well-known).* {
        deny all;
    }
}
# Enable site and restart Nginx
sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/platform /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t
sudo systemctl restart nginx
8.5 Deployment Script


#!/bin/bash
# deploy.sh - Production Deployment Script


set -e


APP_DIR="/var/www/platform"
BRANCH="main"


echo "üöÄ Starting Deployment..."


# Navigate to app directory
cd $APP_DIR


# Enable maintenance mode
echo "üîß Enabling maintenance mode..."
php artisan down --retry=60 --secret="deploy-secret-token"


# Pull latest code
echo "üì• Pulling latest code from Git..."
git fetch origin $BRANCH
git reset --hard origin/$BRANCH


# Install/update dependencies
echo "üì¶ Installing Composer dependencies..."
composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader --no-interaction


# Clear old caches
echo "üßπ Clearing old caches..."
php artisan cache:clear
php artisan config:clear
php artisan route:clear
php artisan view:clear


# Run migrations
echo "üíæ Running database migrations..."
php artisan migrate --force --no-interaction


# Cache optimization
echo "‚ö° Optimizing caches..."
php artisan config:cache
php artisan route:cache
php artisan view:cache
php artisan event:cache


# Compile assets (if using Vite/Mix)
if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
    echo "üé® Compiling assets..."
    npm ci --production
    npm run build
fi


# Set permissions
echo "üîê Setting permissions..."
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data storage bootstrap/cache
sudo chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache


# Restart services
echo "‚ôªÔ∏è Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl restart php8.2-fpm
sudo supervisorctl restart ecommerce-worker:*


# Restart queue workers (gracefully)
echo "üë∑ Restarting queue workers..."
php artisan queue:restart


# Warm cache
echo "üî• Warming cache..."
php artisan cache:warm


# Disable maintenance mode
echo "‚úÖ Disabling maintenance mode..."
php artisan up


echo "üéâ Deployment completed successfully!"


# Send deployment notification (optional)
curl -X POST https://hooks.slack.com/services/YOUR/WEBHOOK/URL \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "text": "‚úÖ Platform deployed successfully to production!",
    "username": "Deploy Bot"
  }'
8.6 Zero-Downtime Deployment (Advanced)


#!/bin/bash
# zero-downtime-deploy.sh - Using Symlinks for Zero Downtime


set -e


DEPLOY_DIR="/var/www/deployments"
CURRENT_DIR="/var/www/platform"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
NEW_RELEASE_DIR="$DEPLOY_DIR/releases/$TIMESTAMP"
SHARED_DIR="$DEPLOY_DIR/shared"


echo "üöÄ Starting Zero-Downtime Deployment..."


# Create directories
mkdir -p $DEPLOY_DIR/releases
mkdir -p $SHARED_DIR/storage
mkdir -p $SHARED_DIR/uploads


# Clone repository into new release directory
echo "üì• Cloning repository..."
git clone --branch main --depth 1 git@github.com:yourorg/platform.git $NEW_RELEASE_DIR


# Navigate to new release
cd $NEW_RELEASE_DIR


# Install dependencies
echo "üì¶ Installing dependencies..."
composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader --no-interaction


# Create symlinks to shared directories
echo "üîó Creating symlinks..."
rm -rf storage
ln -s $SHARED_DIR/storage storage
ln -s $SHARED_DIR/uploads public/uploads


# Copy .env from shared
cp $SHARED_DIR/.env .env


# Run migrations (with transaction)
echo "üíæ Running migrations..."
php artisan migrate --force --no-interaction


# Cache optimization
echo "‚ö° Optimizing..."
php artisan config:cache
php artisan route:cache
php artisan view:cache


# Compile assets
if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
    npm ci --production
    npm run build
fi


# Update current symlink (atomic operation)
echo "üîÑ Switching to new release..."
ln -sfn $NEW_RELEASE_DIR $CURRENT_DIR


# Restart services
echo "‚ôªÔ∏è Restarting services..."
sudo systemctl reload php8.2-fpm
php artisan queue:restart


# Keep only last 5 releases
echo "üßπ Cleaning old releases..."
cd $DEPLOY_DIR/releases
ls -t | tail -n +6 | xargs -r rm -rf


echo "‚úÖ Zero-downtime deployment completed!"
8.7 Automated Deployment with GitHub Actions
# .github/workflows/deploy.yml


name: Deploy to Production


on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main


jobs:
  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Production Server
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v3


      - name: Setup PHP
        uses: shivammathur/setup-php@v2
        with:
          php-version: '8.2'
          extensions: mbstring, xml, curl, zip, pgsql, redis
          tools: composer:v2


      - name: Install dependencies
        run: composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader --no-interaction


      - name: Run tests
        run: php artisan test


      - name: Deploy to server
        uses: appleboy/ssh-action@master
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.SERVER_HOST }}
          username: ${{ secrets.SERVER_USER }}
          key: ${{ secrets.SSH_PRIVATE_KEY }}
          script: |
            cd /var/www/platform
            bash deploy.sh


      - name: Notify Slack
        if: always()
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: ${{ job.status }}
          text: 'Deployment to production ${{ job.status }}'
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}
9. TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE
9.1 Common Issues & Solutions
Issue 1: 500 Internal Server Error
# Check error logs
tail -f storage/logs/laravel.log
tail -f /var/log/nginx/error.log


# Common causes:
# 1. File permissions
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data storage bootstrap/cache
sudo chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache


# 2. Missing .env file
cp .env.example .env
php artisan key:generate


# 3. Cache issues
php artisan cache:clear
php artisan config:clear
php artisan route:clear
php artisan view:clear


# 4. Composer dependencies
composer install
Issue 2: Database Connection Failed
# Test PostgreSQL connection
sudo -u postgres psql -d ecommerce_platform


# Check if PostgreSQL is running
sudo systemctl status postgresql


# Restart PostgreSQL
sudo systemctl restart postgresql


# Verify credentials in .env
DB_CONNECTION=pgsql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=5432
DB_DATABASE=ecommerce_platform
DB_USERNAME=platform_user
DB_PASSWORD=your_password


# Test connection with artisan
php artisan tinker
> DB::connection()->getPdo();
Issue 3: Queue Jobs Not Processing
bash
# Check if queue worker is running
sudo supervisorctl status ecommerce-worker:*


# Restart queue workers
sudo supervisorctl restart ecommerce-worker:*


# Check failed jobs
php artisan queue:failed


# Retry failed jobs
php artisan queue:retry all


# Monitor queue in real-time
php artisan queue:listen --verbose


# Check Redis connection
redis-cli ping
# Should return: PONG
Issue 4: Redis Connection Refused
bash
# Check if Redis is running
sudo systemctl status redis-server


# Restart Redis
sudo systemctl restart redis-server


# Test connection
redis-cli ping


# Check Redis logs
sudo tail -f /var/log/redis/redis-server.log


# Verify .env configuration
REDIS_HOST=127.0.0.1
REDIS_PASSWORD=null
REDIS_PORT=6379
Issue 5: Slow Query Performance
sql
-- Enable query logging (PostgreSQL)
ALTER SYSTEM SET log_min_duration_statement = 1000; -- Log queries > 1 second
SELECT pg_reload_conf();


-- Check slow queries
SELECT 
    query,
    calls,
    total_time,
    mean_time,
    max_time
FROM pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY mean_time DESC
LIMIT 20;


-- Analyze table statistics
ANALYZE products;
ANALYZE orders;


-- Check missing indexes
SELECT
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    attname,
    n_distinct,
    most_common_vals
FROM pg_stats
WHERE tablename = 'products'
ORDER BY n_distinct DESC;
Issue 6: High Memory Usage
bash
# Check PHP-FPM memory
sudo ps aux | grep php-fpm | awk '{sum+=$6} END {print sum/1024 " MB"}'


# Optimize PHP-FPM pool
sudo nano /etc/php/8.2/fpm/pool.d/www.conf


# Adjust these values based on available RAM:
pm = dynamic
pm.max_children = 50
pm.start_servers = 10
pm.min_spare_servers = 5
pm.max_spare_servers = 20
pm.max_requests = 500


# Restart PHP-FPM
sudo systemctl restart php8.2-fpm


# Check for memory leaks in code
# Use Laravel Telescope or Clockwork for profiling
composer require laravel/telescope --dev
php artisan telescope:install
php artisan migrate
Issue 7: File Upload Fails
bash
# Check PHP upload limits
php -i | grep upload_max_filesize
php -i | grep post_max_size


# Update PHP configuration
sudo nano /etc/php/8.2/fpm/php.ini


upload_max_filesize = 10M
post_max_size = 10M
memory_limit = 512M
max_execution_time = 300


# Update Nginx configuration
sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/platform


client_max_body_size 10M;


# Restart services
sudo systemctl restart php8.2-fpm
sudo systemctl restart nginx


# Check storage permissions
ls -la storage/app/
sudo chmod -R 775 storage/
Issue 8: CORS Errors
php
// config/cors.php
return [
    'paths' => ['api/*', 'sanctum/csrf-cookie'],
    'allowed_methods' => ['*'],
    'allowed_origins' => [
        env('FRONTEND_URL', 'http://localhost:3000'),
        'https://platform.com',
        'https://www.platform.com',
    ],
    'allowed_origins_patterns' => [],
    'allowed_headers' => ['*'],
    'exposed_headers' => [],
    'max_age' => 0,
    'supports_credentials' => true,
];


// Clear config cache
php artisan config:clear
php artisan config:cache
9.2 Debugging Tools
Laravel Telescope (Development)
bash
# Install Telescope
composer require laravel/telescope --dev
php artisan telescope:install
php artisan migrate


# Access at: http://localhost:8000/telescope


# Features:
# - Request monitoring
# - Database queries
# - Jobs & queues
# - Mail previews
# - Exceptions
# - Logs
# - Cache operations
Query Debugging
php
<?php
// Enable query log temporarily
DB::enableQueryLog();


// Your queries here
$products = Product::where('status', 'active')->get();


// Get executed queries
$queries = DB::getQueryLog();
dd($queries);


// Or use toSql() to see query without executing
$sql = Product::where('status', 'active')->toSql();
dd($sql);
Performance Profiling
php
<?php
// Using Laravel's built-in stopwatch
$stopwatch = new \Symfony\Component\Stopwatch\Stopwatch();


$stopwatch->start('expensive_operation');


// Your code here
$products = Product::with('vendor', 'category')->get();


$event = $stopwatch->stop('expensive_operation');


Log::info('Operation took: ' . $event->getDuration() . 'ms');
Log::info('Memory used: ' . $event->getMemory() . ' bytes');
________________


10. CODE STANDARDS & BEST PRACTICES
10.1 PSR Standards
php
<?php
// Follow PSR-12 Code Style


// ‚úÖ GOOD - PSR-12 compliant
namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;


use App\Http\Resources\ProductResource;
use App\Models\Product;
use Illuminate\Http\JsonResponse;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class ProductController extends Controller
{
    public function index(Request $request): JsonResponse
    {
        $products = Product::query()
            ->where('status', 'active')
            ->paginate(20);


        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => ProductResource::collection($products),
        ]);
    }
}


// ‚ùå BAD - Not PSR-12 compliant
namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;
use App\Http\Resources\ProductResource;use App\Models\Product;
class ProductController extends Controller{
public function index(Request $request):JsonResponse{
$products=Product::query()->where('status','active')->paginate(20);
return response()->json(['success'=>true,'data'=>ProductResource::collection($products)]);}}
10.2 Naming Conventions
<?php
// Classes: PascalCase
class ProductController {}
class OrderService {}


// Methods: camelCase
public function getActiveProducts() {}
public function calculateTotal() {}


// Variables: camelCase
$userEmail = 'user@example.com';
$totalAmount = 100.50;


// Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE
const MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE = 5242880;
const DEFAULT_CURRENCY = 'USD';


// Database tables: snake_case, plural
products
order_items
product_variants


// Database columns: snake_case, singular
user_id
created_at
is_active


// Routes: kebab-case
Route::get('/api/v1/product-categories', ...);
Route::post('/api/v1/order-items', ...);


// Configuration files: kebab-case
config/payment-gateways.php
config/email-templates.php

## 10.3 Code Organization

app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Console/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Commands/         # Artisan commands
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exceptions/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Handler.php       # Global exception handling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Http/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Controllers/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Api/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ V1/       # API version 1
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Middleware/       # Custom middleware
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requests/         # Form requests (validation)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resources/        # API resources (transformers)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Models/               # Eloquent models
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Providers/            # Service providers
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Services/             # Business logic
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Payment/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Order/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Product/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repositories/         # Data access layer (optional)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Jobs/                 # Queue jobs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail/                 # Mailable classes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Notifications/        # Notification classes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Policies/             # Authorization policies
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Traits/               # Reusable traits
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Helpers/              # Helper functions
10.4 SOLID Principles
Single Responsibility Principle
php
<?php
// ‚ùå BAD - Too many responsibilities
class OrderController
{
    public function store(Request $request)
    {
        // Validation
        $validated = $request->validate([...]);
        
        // Calculate totals
        $subtotal = 0;
        foreach ($items as $item) {
            $subtotal += $item['price'] * $item['quantity'];
        }
        
        // Create order
        $order = Order::create([...]);
        
        // Process payment
        $payment = Stripe::charges()->create([...]);
        
        // Send email
        Mail::to($user)->send(new OrderConfirmation($order));
        
        // Update inventory
        foreach ($order->items as $item) {
            $product = Product::find($item->product_id);
            $product->decrement('stock_quantity', $item->quantity);
        }
        
        return response()->json([...]);
    }
}


// ‚úÖ GOOD - Single responsibility per class
class OrderController
{
    public function __construct(
        private OrderService $orderService
    ) {}


    public function store(StoreOrderRequest $request): JsonResponse
    {
        $order = $this->orderService->createOrder($request->validated());
        
        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => new OrderResource($order),
        ], 201);
    }
}


class OrderService
{
    public function __construct(
        private PaymentService $paymentService,
        private InventoryService $inventoryService,
        private NotificationService $notificationService
    ) {}


    public function createOrder(array $data): Order
    {
        DB::transaction(function () use ($data) {
            $order = Order::create($data);
            
            $this->paymentService->processPayment($order);
            $this->inventoryService->updateStock($order);
            $this->notificationService->sendOrderConfirmation($order);
            
            return $order;
        });
    }
}
Dependency Injection
php
<?php
// ‚úÖ GOOD - Using dependency injection
class ProductService
{
    public function __construct(
        private CacheService $cache,
        private ImageService $imageService
    ) {}


    public function getProduct(int $id): Product
    {
        return $this->cache->remember("product:{$id}", 3600, function () use ($id) {
            return Product::with('images')->findOrFail($id);
        });
    }
}


// Register in service provider
class AppServiceProvider extends ServiceProvider
{
    public function register(): void
    {
        $this->app->singleton(ProductService::class, function ($app) {
            return new ProductService(
                $app->make(CacheService::class),
                $app->make(ImageService::class)
            );
        });
    }
}
10.5 Testing Standards
php
<?php
// tests/Feature/Api/ProductApiTest.php


namespace Tests\Feature\Api;


use App\Models\Product;
use App\Models\User;
use App\Models\Vendor;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Testing\RefreshDatabase;
use Laravel\Sanctum\Sanctum;
use Tests\TestCase;


class ProductApiTest extends TestCase
{
    use RefreshDatabase;


    /** @test */
    public function it_returns_paginated_products_list()
    {
        // Arrange
        Product::factory()->count(25)->create(['status' => 'active']);


        // Act
        $response = $this->getJson('/api/v1/products?per_page=10');


        // Assert
        $response->assertStatus(200)
                 ->assertJsonStructure([
                     'success',
                     'data' => [
                         '*' => ['id', 'name', 'slug', 'regular_price']
                     ],
                     'meta' => ['total', 'per_page', 'current_page'],
                 ])
                 ->assertJsonCount(10, 'data');
    }


    /** @test */
    public function vendor_can_create_product_with_valid_data()
    {
        // Arrange
        $vendor = Vendor::factory()->create(['status' => 'approved']);
        Sanctum::actingAs($vendor->user);


        $productData = [
            'name' => 'Test Product',
            'category_id' => 1,
            'type' => 'simple',
            'sku' => 'TEST-001',
            'regular_price' => 99.99,
            'stock_quantity' => 10,
            'description' => str_repeat('Test description. ', 10),
        ];


        // Act
        $response = $this->postJson('/api/v1/vendor/products', $productData);


        // Assert
        $response->assertStatus(201)
                 ->assertJson([
                     'success' => true,
                 ]);


        $this->assertDatabaseHas('products', [
            'name' => 'Test Product',
            'sku' => 'TEST-001',
        ]);
    }


    /** @test */
    public function it_validates_required_fields()
    {
        // Arrange
        $vendor = Vendor::factory()->create(['status' => 'approved']);
        Sanctum::actingAs($vendor->user);


        // Act
        $response = $this->postJson('/api/v1/vendor/products', []);


        // Assert
        $response->assertStatus(422)
                 ->assertJsonValidationErrors(['name', 'category_id', 'type']);
    }
}

1. PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION & CACHING

1.2 Redis Caching Strategy

Cache Configuration

php

<?php

// config/cache.php - Enhanced

return [

    'default' => env('CACHE_DRIVER', 'redis'),


    'stores' => [
        'redis' => [
            'driver' => 'redis',
            'connection' => 'cache',
            'lock_connection' => 'default',
        ],
        
        // Separate cache for different data types
        'redis-products' => [
            'driver' => 'redis',
            'connection' => 'cache',
            'prefix' => 'products',
        ],
        
        'redis-sessions' => [
            'driver' => 'redis',
            'connection' => 'cache',
            'prefix' => 'sessions',
        ],
    ],


    'prefix' => env('CACHE_PREFIX', 'ecommerce'),
];
Advanced Caching Service
<?php
// app/Services/Cache/AdvancedCacheService.php


namespace App\Services\Cache;


use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Redis;


class AdvancedCacheService
{
    /**
     * Cache with tags (Redis only)
     */
    public function rememberWithTags(array $tags, string $key, int $ttl, callable $callback)
    {
        return Cache::tags($tags)->remember($key, $ttl, $callback);
    }


    /**
     * Flush cache by tags
     */
    public function flushTags(array $tags): void
    {
        Cache::tags($tags)->flush();
    }


    /**
     * Cache forever with manual invalidation
     */
    public function rememberForever(string $key, callable $callback)
    {
        return Cache::rememberForever($key, $callback);
    }


    /**
     * Atomic increment with expiry
     */
    public function incrementWithExpiry(string $key, int $ttl = 3600): int
    {
        $value = Cache::increment($key);
        
        if ($value === 1) {
            Cache::put($key, 1, $ttl);
        }
        
        return $value;
    }


    /**
     * Cache with lock (prevent cache stampede)
     */
    public function rememberWithLock(string $key, int $ttl, callable $callback, int $lockSeconds = 10)
    {
        $value = Cache::get($key);


        if ($value !== null) {
            return $value;
        }


        $lock = Cache::lock("lock:{$key}", $lockSeconds);


        try {
            if ($lock->get()) {
                // Double-check after acquiring lock
                $value = Cache::get($key);
                
                if ($value === null) {
                    $value = $callback();
                    Cache::put($key, $value, $ttl);
                }
            } else {
                // Wait and retry
                sleep(1);
                return $this->rememberWithLock($key, $ttl, $callback, $lockSeconds);
            }
        } finally {
            optional($lock)->release();
        }


        return $value;
    }


    /**
     * Cache aside pattern (lazy loading)
     */
    public function cacheAside(string $key, int $ttl, callable $loader)
    {
        $cached = Cache::get($key);


        if ($cached !== null) {
            return $cached;
        }


        $data = $loader();
        Cache::put($key, $data, $ttl);


        return $data;
    }


    /**
     * Cache through pattern (write-through)
     */
    public function cacheThrough(string $key, $value, int $ttl): void
    {
        // Write to database first
        // Then update cache
        Cache::put($key, $value, $ttl);
    }


    /**
     * Cache with soft expiry (stale-while-revalidate)
     */
    public function rememberWithSoftExpiry(
        string $key,
        int $hardTtl,
        int $softTtl,
        callable $callback
    ) {
        $cached = Cache::get($key);


        if ($cached !== null) {
            $metadata = Cache::get("{$key}:metadata");
            
            if ($metadata && $metadata['soft_expired_at'] < now()->timestamp) {
                // Async refresh in background
                dispatch(function () use ($key, $hardTtl, $softTtl, $callback) {
                    $fresh = $callback();
                    Cache::put($key, $fresh, $hardTtl);
                    Cache::put("{$key}:metadata", [
                        'soft_expired_at' => now()->addSeconds($softTtl)->timestamp,
                    ], $hardTtl);
                })->afterResponse();
            }


            return $cached;
        }


        $fresh = $callback();
        Cache::put($key, $fresh, $hardTtl);
        Cache::put("{$key}:metadata", [
            'soft_expired_at' => now()->addSeconds($softTtl)->timestamp,
        ], $hardTtl);


        return $fresh;
    }


    /**
     * Multi-get optimization
     */
    public function getMany(array $keys): array
    {
        return Cache::many($keys);
    }


    /**
     * Multi-put optimization
     */
    public function putMany(array $values, int $ttl): bool
    {
        return Cache::putMany($values, $ttl);
    }


    /**
     * Cache statistics
     */
    public function getStatistics(): array
    {
        $redis = Redis::connection('cache');
        $info = $redis->info();


        return [
            'used_memory' => $info['used_memory_human'] ?? 'N/A',
            'connected_clients' => $info['connected_clients'] ?? 'N/A',
            'total_commands' => $info['total_commands_processed'] ?? 'N/A',
            'keyspace_hits' => $info['keyspace_hits'] ?? 0,
            'keyspace_misses' => $info['keyspace_misses'] ?? 0,
            'hit_rate' => $this->calculateHitRate($info),
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Calculate cache hit rate
     */
    protected function calculateHitRate(array $info): float
    {
        $hits = $info['keyspace_hits'] ?? 0;
        $misses = $info['keyspace_misses'] ?? 0;
        $total = $hits + $misses;


        if ($total === 0) {
            return 0;
        }


        return round(($hits / $total) * 100, 2);
    }
}


Cached Model Trait


<?php
// app/Traits/Cacheable.php


namespace App\Traits;


use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;


trait Cacheable
{
    /**
     * Boot the trait
     */
    public static function bootCacheable()
    {
        // Clear cache on model events
        static::created(function ($model) {
            $model->clearModelCache();
        });


        static::updated(function ($model) {
            $model->clearModelCache();
        });


        static::deleted(function ($model) {
            $model->clearModelCache();
        });
    }


    /**
     * Get cache key for model
     */
    public function getCacheKey(string $suffix = ''): string
    {
        $key = strtolower(class_basename($this)) . ':' . $this->getKey();
        
        return $suffix ? "{$key}:{$suffix}" : $key;
    }


    /**
     * Cache model instance
     */
    public function cache(int $ttl = 3600): self
    {
        Cache::put($this->getCacheKey(), $this, $ttl);
        return $this;
    }


    /**
     * Get cached model
     */
    public static function findCached($id, int $ttl = 3600)
    {
        $key = strtolower(class_basename(static::class)) . ':' . $id;
        
        return Cache::remember($key, $ttl, function () use ($id) {
            return static::find($id);
        });
    }


    /**
     * Clear model cache
     */
    public function clearModelCache(): void
    {
        Cache::forget($this->getCacheKey());
        
        // Clear related caches
        if (method_exists($this, 'getCacheTags')) {
            Cache::tags($this->getCacheTags())->flush();
        }
    }
}
Product Model with Caching


<?php
// app/Models/Product.php - Enhanced with Caching


namespace App\Models;


use App\Traits\Cacheable;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Cache;


class Product extends Model
{
    use Cacheable;


    /**
     * Get cache tags for this model
     */
    public function getCacheTags(): array
    {
        return [
            'products',
            'products:vendor:' . $this->vendor_id,
            'products:category:' . $this->category_id,
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Get featured products (cached)
     */
    public static function getFeaturedCached(int $limit = 10)
    {
        return Cache::tags(['products', 'featured'])->remember(
            'products:featured:' . $limit,
            3600,
            function () use ($limit) {
                return static::where('is_featured', true)
                    ->where('status', 'active')
                    ->with(['vendor:id,business_name', 'primaryImage'])
                    ->limit($limit)
                    ->get();
            }
        );
    }


    /**
     * Get products by category (cached)
     */
    public static function getByCategoryCached(int $categoryId, int $page = 1, int $perPage = 20)
    {
        $cacheKey = "products:category:{$categoryId}:page:{$page}:per_page:{$perPage}";
        
        return Cache::tags(['products', 'products:category:' . $categoryId])->remember(
            $cacheKey,
            1800, // 30 minutes
            function () use ($categoryId, $page, $perPage) {
                return static::where('category_id', $categoryId)
                    ->where('status', 'active')
                    ->with(['vendor:id,business_name', 'primaryImage'])
                    ->paginate($perPage, ['*'], 'page', $page);
            }
        );
    }


    /**
     * Increment view count (cached counter)
     */
    public function incrementViewCount(): void
    {
        $key = "product:{$this->id}:views";
        
        // Increment in cache
        $views = Cache::increment($key);
        
        // Persist to database every 10 views
        if ($views % 10 === 0) {
            $this->increment('view_count', 10);
        }
    }
}

Installation & Configuration
bash
# Install Horizon
composer require laravel/horizon


# Publish assets

# Publish configuration
