USING ATTRIBUTES IN PRODUCTS:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
(When adding/editing product)


Step 1: Select Category (e.g., Laptops)
Step 2: Required Attributes auto-load
Step 3: Fill required attributes:


Required Attributes for Laptops:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
Processor * [Intel Core i7-12th Gen ‚ñº]
RAM * [16GB ‚ñº]
Storage * [512GB SSD ‚ñº]
Screen Size * [15.6" ‚ñº]
Operating System * [Windows 11 ‚ñº]


Optional Attributes:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
Graphics Card [NVIDIA RTX 3060 ‚ñº] (Optional)
Weight [2.1] kg (Optional)
Battery Life [8] hours (Optional)
Color [Silver ‚ñº] (Optional)
Warranty Period [2 Years ‚ñº] (Your custom attribute)


WHAT VENDOR CAN DO:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: All global attributes
‚úì ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Category-specific required/optional attributes
‚úì Search ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Attributes by name
‚úì Filter ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: By category, type
‚úì Use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Any approved attribute in products
‚úì Request ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: New attribute values
‚úì Request ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Custom attributes
‚úì Track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Request status
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Which products use which attributes
‚úó Cannot: Create attributes directly
‚úó Cannot: Edit global attribute structure
‚úó Cannot: Delete attributes
‚úó Cannot: Make optional attributes required


PAGE 9: PRODUCT VARIANTS


‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚îÇ                      PRODUCT VARIANTS MANAGEMENT                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


PURPOSE:
‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶á product ‡¶è‡¶∞ different versions (size, color, etc.) manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ


WHAT ARE VARIANTS?
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Variants = Same product, different options
Example: T-Shirt
- Base Product: Cotton T-Shirt
- Variants: 
  - Small-Red
  - Small-Blue  
  - Medium-Red
  - Medium-Blue
  - Large-Red
  - Large-Blue


Each variant can have:
- Different price
- Different stock
- Different SKU
- Different image (optional)
- Same base description


WHEN TO USE VARIANTS:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì Use Variants When:
- Same product, different sizes
- Same product, different colors
- Same product, different materials
- Combinations: Size + Color


‚úó Don't Use Variants When:
- Completely different products
- Different product features (create separate products)


VARIANT SETUP:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


1. PRODUCT WITH VARIANTS (Example):
   
   Product: Premium Cotton T-Shirt
   Base Price: $25
   Has Variants: ‚úì Yes
   
   Variant Attributes:
   - Size (Required)
   - Color (Required)


2. VARIANT CONFIGURATION PAGE:
   (Accessed from Add/Edit Product page)
   
     
3. GENERATED VARIANTS TABLE:
   (After clicking "Generate Variants")
   
   Total Possible Variants: 25 (5 sizes √ó 5 colors)
   
        
   Legend:
   - ‚úì Active (Available for sale)
   - ‚úó Inactive (Not available)
   - üî¥ Out of Stock (0 inventory)


4. EDIT VARIANT (Modal):
   
     
5. BULK EDIT VARIANTS:
   
     
6. VARIANT INVENTORY OVERVIEW:
   
   Product: Premium Cotton T-Shirt
   Total Variants: 25
   Active Variants: 23
   Total Stock: 1,250 units
   Total Value: $31,250
   
   Stock by Size:
   ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
   S:    285 units (5 colors)
   M:    400 units (5 colors)  ‚Üê Best selling
   L:    320 units (5 colors)
   XL:   180 units (5 colors)
   XXL:   65 units (5 colors)  ‚Üê Low stock
   
   Stock by Color:
   ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
   Black:  350 units (5 sizes) ‚Üê Best selling
   White:  320 units (5 sizes)
   Blue:   280 units (5 sizes)
   Red:    200 units (5 sizes)
   Green:  100 units (5 sizes) ‚Üê Low stock
   
   Low Stock Variants (< 20 units):
   ‚ö†Ô∏è XXL - Green: 8 units
   ‚ö†Ô∏è XXL - Red: 12 units
   ‚ö†Ô∏è XL - Green: 15 units


7. VARIANT SALES ANALYTICS:
   
   Best Selling Variants (Last 30 days):
   
   
   Recommendation:
   üí° Consider reducing XXL-Green inventory or 
      running promotions to clear slow-moving stock.


8. ADDING NEW VARIANT:
   
   Button: [+ Add Single Variant]
   
     
9. VARIANT IMAGE GALLERY:
   
   Product: Premium Cotton T-Shirt
   
   Base Images (Shown if no variant image):
   [Image 1] [Image 2] [Image 3]
   
   Variant-Specific Images:
     
   
   Upload Variant Image:
   - Select Variant: [M - Red ‚ñº]
   - Upload: [Choose File]
   
   Note: If no variant image, base product image shown.


CUSTOMER VIEW (Frontend):
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
(How customers see variants)


Product Page:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
Premium Cotton T-Shirt
$25.00


Select Size: [S] [M] [L] [XL] [XXL]
                ‚Üë selected


Select Color: [üî¥] [üîµ] [üü¢] [‚ö´] [‚ö™]
                     ‚Üë selected


Selected: Medium - Blue
SKU: TS-MB
Price: $25.00
Stock: ‚úì In Stock (75 available)


[Add to Cart]
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ


When customer changes selection:
- Image updates (if variant has specific image)
- Price updates (if variant has different price)
- Stock status updates
- SKU updates


Out of Stock Variant:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
Select Size: [S] [M] [L] [XL] [XXL (Out)]
                                 ‚Üë grayed out


Select Color: [üî¥] [üîµ (Out)] [üü¢] [‚ö´] [‚ö™]
                     ‚Üë grayed out


[Notify When Available] button shown
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ


WHAT VENDOR CAN DO:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì Create ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Product variants (combinations)
‚úì Set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Different prices per variant
‚úì Manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Different stock per variant
‚úì Upload ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Variant-specific images
‚úì Generate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: All combinations automatically
‚úì Edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Individual variants
‚úì Bulk edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Multiple variants at once
‚úì Activate/Deactivate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Specific variants
‚úì Delete ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Unwanted variants
‚úì Track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Variant sales performance
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Stock by size/color
‚úì Add ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: New variants to existing products
‚úó Cannot: Change variant attributes after creation
         (must delete and recreate)


PAGE 10: PAYMENTS & COMMISSIONS


3. EARNINGS BREAKDOWN:
   
   Current Period: Feb 1 - Feb 28, 2026
   ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

   ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

4. COMMISSION RATES:
    
  
WHAT VENDOR CAN DO:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Total earnings, commission breakdown
‚úì Track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Pending payouts
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Payout history
‚úì Download ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Payment statements, invoices
‚úì Set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Bank account details
‚úì Choose ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Payout frequency
‚úì Request ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Early payout (with fee)
‚úì Calculate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Commission on any amount
‚úì Export ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Earnings reports (CSV/PDF)
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Commission rates and tiers
‚úì Track ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Adjustments and disputes
‚úì Download ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Tax forms (W-9, 1099)
‚úó Cannot: Change commission rates
‚úó Cannot: Process payouts manually (admin only)
‚úó Cannot: See other vendors' earnings


PAGE 11: CUSTOMER REVIEWS
  

3. FILTER & TABS:
   
   Status Tabs:
   [All (234)] [Pending Response (12)] [Responded (200)] 
   [Reported (2)]
   
   Filters:
   - Rating: [All Ratings ‚ñº]
   - Product: [All Products ‚ñº]
   - Date: [Last 30 Days ‚ñº]
   - Verified Purchase: ‚òë Only verified buyers
   - With Photos: ‚òê Show only reviews with photos
   - Sort by: [Newest First ‚ñº]


4. REVIEWS LIST (Card Layout):


RESPONSE TEMPLATES:
   Click ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶≤‡ßá auto-fill ‡¶π‡¶¨‡ßá:
   
   [Thank You]:
   "Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled 
    to hear that you're happy with your purchase. If you need 
    anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out!"
   
   [Address Issue]:
   "Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize 
    for any inconvenience. We'd like to make this right. Please 
    contact us at support@example.com so we can help resolve 
    this issue."
   
   [Request Contact]:
   "Thank you for your feedback. We'd like to learn more about 
    your experience. Could you please reach out to us at 
    support@example.com? We're here to help!"


6. REPORT REVIEW:
   
   Button: [Report] (on any review)
   
     
7. REVIEW ANALYTICS:
    

WHAT VENDOR CAN DO:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì ‡¶¶‡ßá‡¶ñ‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: All reviews for own products
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Overall rating and distribution
‚úì Filter ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: By rating, product, date
‚úì Respond ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: To any review
‚úì Edit ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Own responses
‚úì Delete ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Own responses (not reviews)
‚úì Report ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Inappropriate/fake reviews
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Review analytics and trends
‚úì Request ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Reviews from customers
‚úì Set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Notification preferences
‚úì Use ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Response templates
‚úó Cannot: Delete customer reviews (only admin)
‚úó Cannot: Edit customer reviews
‚úó Cannot: See other vendors' reviews
‚úó Cannot: Approve/reject reviews (auto-approved)


PAGE 12: STORE SETTINGS


‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚îÇ                          STORE SETTINGS                                  ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


PURPOSE:
Vendor ‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶∞ store/shop ‡¶è‡¶∞ profile, branding, policies configure ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá


WHAT VENDOR CAN SEE:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


SIDEBAR NAVIGATION (Settings Sections):
1. Store Information
2. Branding & Logo
3. Store Policies
4. Business Details
5. Notification Preferences
6. Account Settings
7. Tax Settings
8. Shipping Locations


‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
SECTION 1: STORE INFORMATION
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ


WHAT VENDOR CAN DO:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì Update ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Store information (name, description, contact)
‚úì Upload ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Logo, banner, favicon
‚úì Set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Brand colors and theme
‚úì Configure ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Return, refund, shipping policies
‚úì Manage ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Business details and licenses
‚úì Choose ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Notification preferences
‚úì Enable/Disable ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Email/SMS notifications
‚úì Change ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Password and email
‚úì Setup ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Two-factor authentication
‚úì View ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Active sessions
‚úì Configure ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Tax settings and rates
‚úì Set ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Shipping locations
‚úì Deactivate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Account temporarily
‚úì Request ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Account deletion
‚úó Cannot: Change vendor commission rate
‚úó Cannot: Access platform-wide settings


PAGE 13: SHIPPING MANAGEMENT
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                       SHIPPING MANAGEMENT                                ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

‚úì Duplicate ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶¨‡ßá: Existing promotions
‚úó Cannot: Override platform-wide promotions
‚úó Cannot: Offer discounts below cost (if restricted)

‚îÇ              VENDOR DASHBOARD - COMPLETE PAGE LIST                       
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ


COMPLETED (16 PAGES):


1. Dashboard (Overview) - Metrics, charts, recent activity
2. My Products - Product listing, management
3. Add/Edit Product - Complete product form
4. Orders - Order management, tracking, shipping
5. Inventory Management - Stock tracking, alerts
6. Sales Analytics - Performance metrics, charts
7. Payments & Commissions - Earnings, payouts, history
8. Customer Reviews - Review management, responses
9. Category Management - View categories, request new
10. Attributes Management - Product attributes, custom requests
11. Product Variants - Size, color, combinations
12. Store Settings - Store info, branding, policies
13. Shipping Management - Zones, methods, carriers
14. Promotions & Discounts - Sales, BOGO, bundles
15. Reports - Custom reports, scheduled reports
16. Support/Help Center - Tickets, knowledge base, chat


KEY FEATURES:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úì Complete product lifecycle management
‚úì Order processing and fulfillment
‚úì Inventory tracking with alerts

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

‚úì Get support


VENDOR RESTRICTIONS:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
‚úó Cannot see other vendors' data
‚úó Cannot change commission rates
‚úó Cannot access admin functions
‚úó Cannot modify platform settings
‚úó New products need admin approval
‚úó Cannot create categories directly
‚úó Cannot create global attributes directly


APPROVAL WORKFLOWS:
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
1. New Vendor ‚Üí Admin Review ‚Üí Approved/Rejected
2. New Product ‚Üí Admin Review ‚Üí Approved/Rejected
3. Category Request ‚Üí Admin Review ‚Üí Approved/Rejected
4. Attribute Request ‚Üí Admin Review ‚Üí Approved/Rejected
5. Payout Request ‚Üí Auto/Manual ‚Üí Processed
üîå
API Documentation ‚Äî Common Functionalities
Multi-Vendor E-commerce Platform  ¬∑  Feb 2026  ¬∑  v2.0

API DOCUMENTATION - COMMON FUNCTIONALITIES

Table of Contents

1. Authentication & Authorization

2. Request/Response Format Standards

3. Error Handling

4. Pagination

5. File Upload (Images/Documents)

6. Search & Filtering

7. Validation

8. Rate Limiting

9. API Versioning

10. Common HTTP Status Codes

1. AUTHENTICATION & AUTHORIZATION

1.1 Authentication Methods

Laravel Sanctum (Token-based)

// config/sanctum.php

return [

    'expiration' => 60 * 24 * 7, // 7 days
    'token_prefix' => env('SANCTUM_TOKEN_PREFIX', ''),
];
Login Flow
php
// POST /api/v1/auth/login
// Request:
{
    "email": "customer@example.com",
    "password": "password123"
}


// Response (Success):
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Login successful",
    "data": {
        "user": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "John Doe",
            "email": "customer@example.com",
            "role": "customer",
            "status": "active"
        },
        "token": "1|abc123def456ghi789...",
        "token_type": "Bearer",
        "expires_in": 604800
    }
}


// Response (Error):
{
    "success": false,
    "message": "Invalid credentials",
    "errors": {
        "email": ["These credentials do not match our records."]
    }
}
Using Token in Requests
http
GET /api/v1/orders HTTP/1.1
Host: platform.com
Authorization: Bearer 1|abc123def456ghi789...
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json
Middleware Implementation
php
// app/Http/Middleware/RoleMiddleware.php
<?php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class RoleMiddleware
{
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next, ...$roles)
    {
        if (!$request->user()) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Unauthenticated',
            ], 401);
        }
        
        if (!in_array($request->user()->role, $roles)) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Unauthorized. Insufficient permissions.',
            ], 403);
        }
        
        return $next($request);
    }
}


// Register in Kernel.php
protected $middlewareAliases = [
    'role' => \App\Http\Middleware\RoleMiddleware::class,
];
________________


2. REQUEST/RESPONSE FORMAT STANDARDS
2.1 Standard Response Structure
Success Response (200, 201)
json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Operation successful",
    "data": {
        // Response payload
    },
    "meta": {
        // Optional metadata (pagination, etc.)
    }
}
Error Response (400, 401, 403, 404, 422, 500)
json
{
    "success": false,
    "message": "Error message",
    "errors": {
        "field_name": [
            "Error message 1",
            "Error message 2"
        ]
    }
}
2.2 Response Helper Trait


<?php
// app/Traits/ApiResponse.php


namespace App\Traits;


use Illuminate\Http\JsonResponse;


trait ApiResponse
{
    /**
     * Success response
     */
    protected function successResponse($data = null, string $message = 'Success', int $code = 200): JsonResponse
    {
        $response = [
            'success' => true,
            'message' => $message,
        ];
        
        if ($data !== null) {
            $response['data'] = $data;
        }
        
        return response()->json($response, $code);
    }
    
    /**
     * Created response
     */
    protected function createdResponse($data = null, string $message = 'Resource created successfully'): JsonResponse
    {
        return $this->successResponse($data, $message, 201);
    }
    
    /**
     * Error response
     */
    protected function errorResponse(string $message, $errors = null, int $code = 400): JsonResponse
    {
        $response = [
            'success' => false,
            'message' => $message,
        ];
        
        if ($errors !== null) {
            $response['errors'] = $errors;
        }
        
        return response()->json($response, $code);
    }
    
    /**
     * Validation error response
     */
    protected function validationErrorResponse($errors, string $message = 'Validation failed'): JsonResponse
    {
        return $this->errorResponse($message, $errors, 422);
    }
    
    /**
     * Not found response
     */
    protected function notFoundResponse(string $message = 'Resource not found'): JsonResponse
    {
        return $this->errorResponse($message, null, 404);
    }
    
    /**
     * Unauthorized response
     */
    protected function unauthorizedResponse(string $message = 'Unauthorized'): JsonResponse
    {
        return $this->errorResponse($message, null, 401);
    }
    
    /**
     * Forbidden response
     */
    protected function forbiddenResponse(string $message = 'Forbidden'): JsonResponse
    {
        return $this->errorResponse($message, null, 403);
    }
    
    /**
     * Paginated response
     */
    protected function paginatedResponse($data, string $message = 'Success'): JsonResponse
    {
        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'message' => $message,
            'data' => $data->items(),
            'meta' => [
                'current_page' => $data->currentPage(),
                'last_page' => $data->lastPage(),
                'per_page' => $data->perPage(),
                'total' => $data->total(),
                'from' => $data->firstItem(),
                'to' => $data->lastItem(),
            ],
            'links' => [
                'first' => $data->url(1),
                'last' => $data->url($data->lastPage()),
                'prev' => $data->previousPageUrl(),
                'next' => $data->nextPageUrl(),
            ],
        ]);
    }
}
Usage in Controller
<?php


namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;


use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Traits\ApiResponse;


class OrderController extends Controller
{
    use ApiResponse;
    
    public function store(Request $request)
    {
        // Validation
        $validated = $request->validate([
            'items' => 'required|array',
            // ...
        ]);
        
        try {
            $order = $this->orderService->create($validated);
            
            return $this->createdResponse(
                new OrderResource($order),
                'Order placed successfully'
            );
            
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            return $this->errorResponse(
                'Failed to create order: ' . $e->getMessage(),
                null,
                500
            );
        }
    }
}


3.2 Custom Exception Classes


<?php
// app/Exceptions/BusinessException.php


namespace App\Exceptions;


use Exception;


class BusinessException extends Exception
{
    protected $errors;
    
    public function __construct(string $message, array $errors = [], int $code = 400)
    {
        parent::__construct($message, $code);
        $this->errors = $errors;
    }
    
    public function render($request)
    {
        return response()->json([
            'success' => false,
            'message' => $this->getMessage(),
            'errors' => $this->errors,
        ], $this->getCode());
    }
}


// Usage:
throw new BusinessException(
    'Insufficient stock',
    ['product_id' => ['Only 5 units available']],
    400
);


4. PAGINATION

// GET /api/v1/products?page=2&per_page=20


// Response:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Products retrieved successfully",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 21,
            "name": "Product 21",
            // ...
        },
        // ... 19 more items
    ],
    "meta": {
        "current_page": 2,
        "last_page": 5,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 95,
        "from": 21,
        "to": 40
    },
    "links": {
        "first": "https://api.platform.com/v1/products?page=1",
        "last": "https://api.platform.com/v1/products?page=5",
        "prev": "https://api.platform.com/v1/products?page=1",
        "next": "https://api.platform.com/v1/products?page=3"
    }
}
4.2 Custom Pagination Helper


<?php
// app/Http/Controllers/Controller.php


namespace App\Http\Controllers;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Auth\Access\AuthorizesRequests;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Validation\ValidatesRequests;
use Illuminate\Routing\Controller as BaseController;


abstract class Controller extends BaseController
{
    use AuthorizesRequests, ValidatesRequests;
    
    /**
     * Get pagination parameters from request
     */
    protected function getPaginationParams($request): array
    {
        return [
            'page' => max(1, (int) $request->get('page', 1)),
            'per_page' => min(100, max(1, (int) $request->get('per_page', 20))),
        ];
    }
}
5. FILE UPLOAD (IMAGES/DOCUMENTS)
5.1 Image Upload Configuration
<?php
// config/media.php


return [
    'images' => [
        'disk' => env('MEDIA_DISK', 's3'), // or 'public' for local
        
        'max_size' => 5 * 1024 * 1024, // 5MB in bytes
        
        'allowed_mimes' => [
            'image/jpeg',
            'image/jpg',
            'image/png',
            'image/webp',
        ],
        
        'sizes' => [
            'thumbnail' => [150, 150],
            'small' => [300, 300],
            'medium' => [600, 600],
            'large' => [1200, 1200],
        ],
        
        'quality' => 85,
    ],
    
    'documents' => [
        'disk' => env('MEDIA_DISK', 's3'),
        
        'max_size' => 10 * 1024 * 1024, // 10MB
        
        'allowed_mimes' => [
            'application/pdf',
            'image/jpeg',
            'image/png',
        ],
    ],
];
5.2 Image Upload Service
<?php
// app/Services/ImageUploadService.php


namespace App\Services;


use Illuminate\Http\UploadedFile;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Storage;
use Intervention\Image\Facades\Image;
use Illuminate\Support\Str;


class ImageUploadService
{
    /**
     * Upload and process image
     * 
     * @param UploadedFile $file
     * @param string $path Directory path (e.g., 'products/1')
     * @return array URLs for all sizes
     */
    public function upload(UploadedFile $file, string $path): array
    {
        // Validate
        $this->validate($file);
        
        // Generate filename
        $filename = Str::uuid() . '.' . $file->getClientOriginalExtension();
        
        // Get configuration
        $disk = config('media.images.disk');
        $sizes = config('media.images.sizes');
        $quality = config('media.images.quality');
        
        $urls = [];
        
        // Process original
        $originalPath = "{$path}/original/{$filename}";
        Storage::disk($disk)->put($originalPath, file_get_contents($file));
        $urls['original'] = Storage::disk($disk)->url($originalPath);
        
        // Process each size
        foreach ($sizes as $sizeName => [$width, $height]) {
            $image = Image::make($file);
            
            // Resize maintaining aspect ratio
            $image->resize($width, $height, function ($constraint) {
                $constraint->aspectRatio();
                $constraint->upsize();
            });
            
            // Convert to WebP for better compression
            $image->encode('webp', $quality);
            
            // Save
            $sizePath = "{$path}/{$sizeName}/{$filename}.webp";
            Storage::disk($disk)->put($sizePath, (string) $image);
            $urls[$sizeName] = Storage::disk($disk)->url($sizePath);
        }
        
        return [
            'filename' => $filename,
            'urls' => $urls,
            'size' => $file->getSize(),
            'mime_type' => 'image/webp',
        ];
    }
    
    /**
     * Validate uploaded image
     */
    protected function validate(UploadedFile $file): void
    {
        $maxSize = config('media.images.max_size');
        $allowedMimes = config('media.images.allowed_mimes');
        
        if ($file->getSize() > $maxSize) {
            throw new \Exception('File size exceeds maximum allowed size');
        }
        
        if (!in_array($file->getMimeType(), $allowedMimes)) {
            throw new \Exception('File type not allowed');
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Delete image and all sizes
     */
    public function delete(string $path, string $filename): void
    {
        $disk = config('media.images.disk');
        $sizes = array_merge(['original'], array_keys(config('media.images.sizes')));
        
        foreach ($sizes as $size) {
            $filePath = "{$path}/{$size}/{$filename}";
            Storage::disk($disk)->delete($filePath);
        }
    }
}


5.3 Image Upload API Endpoint


<?php
// POST /api/v1/products/{id}/images


namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;


use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Models\Product;
use App\Models\ProductImage;
use App\Services\ImageUploadService;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class ProductImageController extends Controller
{
    public function upload(Request $request, int $productId, ImageUploadService $imageService)
    {
        $product = Product::findOrFail($productId);
        
        // Authorization
        if ($request->user()->id !== $product->vendor->user_id) {
            return response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Unauthorized',
            ], 403);
        }
        
        // Validation
        $request->validate([
            'images' => 'required|array|max:5',
            'images.*' => 'required|image|mimes:jpeg,jpg,png,webp|max:5120', // 5MB
        ]);
        
        $uploadedImages = [];
        
        foreach ($request->file('images') as $index => $file) {
            try {
                // Upload image
                $result = $imageService->upload($file, "products/{$productId}");
                
                // Save to database
                $image = ProductImage::create([
                    'product_id' => $productId,
                    'filename' => $result['filename'],
                    'original_url' => $result['urls']['original'],
                    'thumbnail_url' => $result['urls']['thumbnail'],
                    'small_url' => $result['urls']['small'],
                    'medium_url' => $result['urls']['medium'],
                    'large_url' => $result['urls']['large'],
                    'file_size' => $result['size'],
                    'mime_type' => $result['mime_type'],
                    'sort_order' => ProductImage::where('product_id', $productId)->count() + 1,
                    'is_primary' => $index === 0 && !$product->images()->exists(),
                ]);
                
                $uploadedImages[] = $image;
                
            } catch (\Exception $e) {
                return response()->json([
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'Failed to upload image: ' . $e->getMessage(),
                ], 500);
            }
        }
        
        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'message' => count($uploadedImages) . ' image(s) uploaded successfully',
            'data' => $uploadedImages,
        ], 201);
    }
}
5.4 Image Upload Request (Frontend)
// JavaScript/React example


const uploadProductImages = async (productId, files) => {
    const formData = new FormData();
    
    // Append multiple files
    files.forEach((file, index) => {
        formData.append(`images[${index}]`, file);
    });
    
    try {
        const response = await fetch(`/api/v1/products/${productId}/images`, {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Authorization': `Bearer ${token}`,
                // Don't set Content-Type - browser will set it with boundary
            },
            body: formData,
        });
        
        const data = await response.json();
        
        if (data.success) {
            console.log('Images uploaded:', data.data);
        } else {
            console.error('Upload failed:', data.message);
        }
        
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error uploading images:', error);
    }
};


// Usage
const handleFileSelect = (event) => {
    const files = Array.from(event.target.files);
    uploadProductImages(123, files);
};
6. SEARCH & FILTERING
6.1 Advanced Search Implementation
<?php
// app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/ProductSearchController.php


namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1;


use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Models\Product;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class ProductSearchController extends Controller
{
    /**
     * Search products with advanced filtering
     * 
     * GET /api/v1/products/search?q=laptop&category=1&min_price=500&max_price=2000&sort=price_low
     */
    public function search(Request $request)
    {
        $query = Product::with(['vendor', 'category', 'primaryImage'])
            ->active()
            ->visible();
        
        // Text search
        if ($request->filled('q')) {
            $searchTerm = $request->q;
            $query->where(function($q) use ($searchTerm) {
                $q->where('name', 'ILIKE', "%{$searchTerm}%")
                  ->orWhere('description', 'ILIKE', "%{$searchTerm}%")
                  ->orWhere('brand', 'ILIKE', "%{$searchTerm}%")
                  ->orWhere('sku', 'ILIKE', "%{$searchTerm}%");
            });
        }
        
        // Category filter
        if ($request->filled('category')) {
            $query->where('category_id', $request->category);
        }
        
        // Multiple categories
        if ($request->filled('categories')) {
            $categoryIds = explode(',', $request->categories);
            $query->whereIn('category_id', $categoryIds);
        }
        
        // Vendor filter
        if ($request->filled('vendor')) {
            $query->where('vendor_id', $request->vendor);
        }
        
        // Price range
        if ($request->filled('min_price')) {
            $query->where('regular_price', '>=', $request->min_price);
        }
        
        if ($request->filled('max_price')) {
            $query->where('regular_price', '<=', $request->max_price);
        }
        
        // Brand filter
        if ($request->filled('brand')) {
            $query->where('brand', $request->brand);
        }
        
        // Rating filter
        if ($request->filled('min_rating')) {
            $query->where('average_rating', '>=', $request->min_rating);
        }
        
        // In stock only
        if ($request->boolean('in_stock')) {
            $query->where('stock_status', 'in_stock');
        }
        
        // On sale only
        if ($request->boolean('on_sale')) {
            $query->onSale();
        }
        
        // Featured only
        if ($request->boolean('featured')) {
            $query->where('is_featured', true);
        }
        
        // Sorting
        $sort = $request->get('sort', 'relevance');
        
        switch ($sort) {
            case 'price_low':
                $query->orderBy('regular_price', 'asc');
                break;
            case 'price_high':
                $query->orderBy('regular_price', 'desc');
                break;
            case 'newest':
                $query->orderBy('published_at', 'desc');
                break;
            case 'popular':
                $query->orderBy('total_sales', 'desc');
                break;
            case 'rating':
                $query->orderBy('average_rating', 'desc')
                      ->orderBy('total_reviews', 'desc');
                break;
            case 'name_asc':
                $query->orderBy('name', 'asc');
                break;
            case 'name_desc':
                $query->orderBy('name', 'desc');
                break;
            default: // relevance
                if ($request->filled('q')) {
                    // Full-text search relevance (PostgreSQL)
                    $query->orderByRaw("
                        ts_rank(
                            to_tsvector('english', name || ' ' || description),
                            plainto_tsquery('english', ?)
                        ) DESC
                    ", [$request->q]);
                } else {
                    $query->orderBy('published_at', 'desc');
                }
        }
        
        // Pagination
        $perPage = min($request->get('per_page', 20), 100);
        $products = $query->paginate($perPage);
        
        // Build facets (filters with counts)
        $facets = $this->buildFacets($request);
        
        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'data' => $products->items(),
            'meta' => [
                'current_page' => $products->currentPage(),
                'last_page' => $products->lastPage(),
                'per_page' => $products->perPage(),
                'total' => $products->total(),
            ],
            'facets' => $facets,
            'applied_filters' => $this->getAppliedFilters($request),
        ]);
    }
    
    /**
     * Build facets for filtering
     */
    protected function buildFacets(Request $request): array
    {
        $baseQuery = Product::active()->visible();
        
        // Apply existing filters except the one being faceted
        if ($request->filled('q')) {
            $baseQuery->where('name', 'ILIKE', "%{$request->q}%");
        }
        
        return [
            'categories' => $baseQuery->clone()
                ->select('category_id', \DB::raw('COUNT(*) as count'))
                ->groupBy('category_id')
                ->with('category:id,name')
                ->get(),
            
            'brands' => $baseQuery->clone()
                ->select('brand', \DB::raw('COUNT(*) as count'))
                ->whereNotNull('brand')
                ->groupBy('brand')
                ->orderBy('brand')
                ->get(),
            
            'price_ranges' => [
                ['label' => 'Under $50', 'min' => 0, 'max' => 50, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->where('regular_price', '<', 50)->count()],
                ['label' => '$50 - $100', 'min' => 50, 'max' => 100, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->whereBetween('regular_price', [50, 100])->count()],
                ['label' => '$100 - $500', 'min' => 100, 'max' => 500, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->whereBetween('regular_price', [100, 500])->count()],
                ['label' => '$500 - $1000', 'min' => 500, 'max' => 1000, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->whereBetween('regular_price', [500, 1000])->count()],
                ['label' => 'Over $1000', 'min' => 1000, 'max' => null, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->where('regular_price', '>', 1000)->count()],
            ],
            
            'ratings' => [
                ['rating' => 5, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->where('average_rating', '>=', 4.5)->count()],
                ['rating' => 4, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->whereBetween('average_rating', [3.5, 4.5])->count()],
                ['rating' => 3, 'count' => $baseQuery->clone()->whereBetween('average_rating', [2.5, 3.5])->count()],
            ],
        ];
    }
    
    /**
     * Get applied filters summary
     */
    protected function getAppliedFilters(Request $request): array
    {
        $filters = [];
        
        if ($request->filled('q')) {
            $filters[] = ['type' => 'search', 'value' => $request->q];
        }
        
        if ($request->filled('category')) {
            $filters[] = ['type' => 'category', 'value' => $request->category];
        }
        
        if ($request->filled('min_price') || $request->filled('max_price')) {
            $filters[] = [
                'type' => 'price',
                'min' => $request->min_price,
                'max' => $request->max_price,
            ];
        }
        
        if ($request->filled('brand')) {
            $filters[] = ['type' => 'brand', 'value' => $request->brand];
        }
        
        return $filters;
    }
}
7. VALIDATION
7.1 Form Request Validation
<?php
// app/Http/Requests/StoreProductRequest.php


namespace App\Http\Requests;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Http\FormRequest;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Validation\Validator;
use Illuminate\Http\Exceptions\HttpResponseException;


class StoreProductRequest extends FormRequest
{
    /**
     * Determine if the user is authorized to make this request.
     */
    public function authorize(): bool
    {
        // Check if user is a vendor
        return $this->user() && $this->user()->isVendor();
    }


    /**
     * Get the validation rules that apply to the request.
     */
    public function rules(): array
    {
        return [
            'name' => 'required|string|min:3|max:255',
            'slug' => 'nullable|string|unique:products,slug',
            'category_id' => 'required|exists:categories,id',
            'description' => 'required|string|min:50',
            'short_description' => 'nullable|string|max:500',
            'brand' => 'nullable|string|max:100',
            'type' => 'required|in:simple,variable',
            
            // Simple product fields
            'sku' => 'required_if:type,simple|nullable|string|max:100|unique:products,sku',
            'regular_price' => 'required_if:type,simple|nullable|numeric|min:0',
            'sale_price' => 'nullable|numeric|min:0|lt:regular_price',
            'stock_quantity' => 'required_if:type,simple|nullable|integer|min:0',
            
            // Optional fields
            'weight' => 'nullable|numeric|min:0',
            'dimensions' => 'nullable|array',
            'dimensions.length' => 'required_with:dimensions|numeric|min:0',
            'dimensions.width' => 'required_with:dimensions|numeric|min:0',
            'dimensions.height' => 'required_with:dimensions|numeric|min:0',
            'dimensions.unit' => 'required_with:dimensions|in:cm,inch',
            
            // Tags
            'tags' => 'nullable|array',
            'tags.*' => 'string|max:50',
            
            // SEO
            'seo_title' => 'nullable|string|max:255',
            'seo_description' => 'nullable|string|max:500',
            'seo_keywords' => 'nullable|string|max:500',
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Custom validation messages
     */
    public function messages(): array
    {
        return [
            'name.required' => 'Product name is required',
            'name.min' => 'Product name must be at least 3 characters',
            'name.max' => 'Product name cannot exceed 255 characters',
            
            'category_id.required' => 'Please select a category',
            'category_id.exists' => 'Selected category does not exist',
            
            'description.required' => 'Product description is required',
            'description.min' => 'Description must be at least 50 characters',
            
            'type.required' => 'Product type is required',
            'type.in' => 'Product type must be either simple or variable',
            
            'sku.required_if' => 'SKU is required for simple products',
            'sku.unique' => 'This SKU is already in use',
            
            'regular_price.required_if' => 'Price is required for simple products',
            'regular_price.min' => 'Price cannot be negative',
            
            'sale_price.lt' => 'Sale price must be less than regular price',
            
            'stock_quantity.required_if' => 'Stock quantity is required for simple products',
            'stock_quantity.min' => 'Stock quantity cannot be negative',
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Get custom attributes for validator errors
     */
    public function attributes(): array
    {
        return [
            'name' => 'product name',
            'category_id' => 'category',
            'regular_price' => 'price',
            'sale_price' => 'sale price',
            'stock_quantity' => 'stock quantity',
        ];
    }


    /**
     * Handle a failed validation attempt (API)
     */
    protected function failedValidation(Validator $validator)
    {
        throw new HttpResponseException(
            response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Validation failed',
                'errors' => $validator->errors(),
            ], 422)
        );
    }


    /**
     * Handle a failed authorization attempt (API)
     */
    protected function failedAuthorization()
    {
        throw new HttpResponseException(
            response()->json([
                'success' => false,
                'message' => 'Unauthorized. Only vendors can create products.',
            ], 403)
        );
    }
}
Usage in Controller
<?php


namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\Vendor;


use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Http\Requests\StoreProductRequest;
use App\Models\Product;


class ProductController extends Controller
{
    public function store(StoreProductRequest $request)
    {
        // Validation automatically handled by FormRequest
        // If validation fails, automatic 422 response
        
        $product = Product::create([
            'vendor_id' => $request->user()->vendor->id,
            ...$request->validated(),
        ]);
        
        return response()->json([
            'success' => true,
            'message' => 'Product created successfully',
            'data' => $product,
        ], 201);
    }
}
7.2 Custom Validation Rules


<?php
// app/Rules/ValidCouponCode.php


namespace App\Rules;


use App\Models\Coupon;
use Closure;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Validation\ValidationRule;


class ValidCouponCode implements ValidationRule
{
    protected $userId;
    protected $cartTotal;


    public function __construct($userId, $cartTotal)
    {
        $this->userId = $userId;
        $this->cartTotal = $cartTotal;
    }


    /**
     * Run the validation rule.
     */
    public function validate(string $attribute, mixed $value, Closure $fail): void
    {
        $coupon = Coupon::where('code', strtoupper($value))->first();


        // Coupon doesn't exist
        if (!$coupon) {
            $fail('Invalid coupon code');
            return;
        }


        // Check status
        if ($coupon->status !== 'active') {
            $fail('This coupon is no longer active');
            return;
        }


        // Check validity period
        $now = now();
        if ($coupon->starts_at > $now) {
            $fail('This coupon is not yet valid');
            return;
        }


        if ($coupon->expires_at && $coupon->expires_at < $now) {
            $fail('This coupon has expired');
            return;
        }


        // Check usage limit
        if ($coupon->max_uses && $coupon->current_uses >= $coupon->max_uses) {
            $fail('This coupon has reached its usage limit');
            return;
        }


        // Check per-user limit
        $userUsageCount = $coupon->usages()
            ->where('user_id', $this->userId)
            ->count();


        if ($userUsageCount >= $coupon->max_uses_per_user) {
            $fail('You have already used this coupon the maximum number of times');
            return;
        }


        // Check minimum order amount
        if ($coupon->min_order_amount && $this->cartTotal < $coupon->min_order_amount) {
            $fail("Minimum order amount of \${$coupon->min_order_amount} required for this coupon");
            return;
        }
    }
}


// Usage:
use App\Rules\ValidCouponCode;


$request->validate([
    'coupon_code' => [
        'required',
        'string',
        new ValidCouponCode($request->user()->id, $cart->subtotal)
    ],
]);
7.3 Conditional Validation
<?php
// app/Http/Requests/StoreOrderRequest.php


namespace App\Http\Requests;


use Illuminate\Foundation\Http\FormRequest;


class StoreOrderRequest extends FormRequest
{
    public function rules(): array
    {
        $rules = [
            'shipping_address_id' => 'required|exists:addresses,id',
            'billing_address_id' => 'required|exists:addresses,id',
            'payment_method' => 'required|in:stripe_card,paypal,cash_on_delivery',
        ];


        // Additional validation for card payment
        if ($this->payment_method === 'stripe_card') {
            $rules['payment_intent_id'] = 'required|string';
        }


        // Additional validation for PayPal
        if ($this->payment_method === 'paypal') {
            $rules['paypal_order_id'] = 'required|string';
        }


        return $rules;
    }


    /**
     * Configure the validator instance
     */
    public function withValidator($validator)
    {
        $validator->after(function ($validator) {
            // Custom validation logic after basic validation passes
            
            // Check if cart has items
            $cart = $this->user()->cart;
            if (!$cart || $cart->items->isEmpty()) {
                $validator->errors()->add('cart', 'Your cart is empty');
            }


            // Check stock availability
            foreach ($cart->items as $item) {
                if (!$item->product->isInStock()) {
                    $validator->errors()->add(
                        "items.{$item->id}",
                        "{$item->product->name} is out of stock"
                    );
                }
            }
        });
    }
}


8. RATE LIMITING
8.1 Rate Limit Configuration
<?php
// app/Http/Kernel.php


protected $middlewareAliases = [
    'throttle' => \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\ThrottleRequests::class,
];


// routes/api.php
Route::middleware('throttle:api')->group(function () {
    // Rate-limited routes
});
<?php
// app/Providers/RouteServiceProvider.php


use Illuminate\Cache\RateLimiting\Limit;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\RateLimiter;


public function boot(): void
{
    // Default API rate limit
    RateLimiter::for('api', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perMinute(60)->by($request->user()?->id ?: $request->ip());
    });


    // Public endpoints (unauthenticated)
    RateLimiter::for('public', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perMinute(30)->by($request->ip());
    });


    // Authentication endpoints (stricter)
    RateLimiter::for('auth', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perMinute(5)->by($request->ip())
            ->response(function (Request $request, array $headers) {
                return response()->json([
                    'success' => false,
                    'message' => 'Too many login attempts. Please try again later.',
                ], 429, $headers);
            });
    });


    // Vendor endpoints (higher limit)
    RateLimiter::for('vendor', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perMinute(120)->by($request->user()?->id ?: $request->ip());
    });


    // Admin endpoints (highest limit)
    RateLimiter::for('admin', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perMinute(200)->by($request->user()?->id);
    });


    // File upload endpoints
    RateLimiter::for('uploads', function (Request $request) {
        return Limit::perHour(50)->by($request->user()?->id ?: $request->ip());
    });


    // Order creation (prevent abuse)
    RateLimiter::for('orders', function (Request $request) {
        return [
            Limit::perMinute(10)->by($request->user()?->id),
            Limit::perDay(100)->by($request->user()?->id),
        ];
    });
}
8.2 Apply Rate Limiting to Routes


<?php
// routes/api.php


// Authentication (strict rate limit)
Route::prefix('auth')->middleware('throttle:auth')->group(function () {
    Route::post('login', [AuthController::class, 'login']);
    Route::post('register', [AuthController::class, 'register']);
    Route::post('forgot-password', [AuthController::class, 'forgotPassword']);
});


// Public endpoints
Route::middleware('throttle:public')->group(function () {
    Route::get('products', [ProductController::class, 'index']);
    Route::get('products/{slug}', [ProductController::class, 'show']);
    Route::get('categories', [CategoryController::class, 'index']);
});


// Authenticated endpoints
Route::middleware(['auth:sanctum', 'throttle:api'])->group(function () {
    Route::get('user', [AuthController::class, 'user']);
    Route::get('notifications', [NotificationController::class, 'index']);
});


// Order creation (special rate limit)
Route::middleware(['auth:sanctum', 'throttle:orders'])->group(function () {
    Route::post('orders', [OrderController::class, 'store']);
});


// File uploads (special rate limit)
Route::middleware(['auth:sanctum', 'throttle:uploads'])->group(function () {
    Route::post('products/{id}/images', [ProductImageController::class, 'upload']);
});


// Vendor routes (higher limit)
Route::middleware(['auth:sanctum', 'role:vendor', 'throttle:vendor'])->prefix('vendor')->group(function () {
    Route::apiResource('products', VendorProductController::class);
});


// Admin routes (highest limit)
Route::middleware(['auth:sanctum', 'role:admin', 'throttle:admin'])->prefix('admin')->group(function () {
    Route::get('dashboard', [AdminDashboardController::class, 'index']);
});
8.3 Rate Limit Response


// Request exceeds rate limit
// Response: 429 Too Many Requests


{
    "success": false,
    "message": "Too many requests. Please try again later."
}


// Response Headers:
X-RateLimit-Limit: 60
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 45

# 9. API VERSIONING

## 9.1 URI Versioning Strategy

Current Structure:
/api/v1/products          ‚Üê Version 1 (Current)
/api/v2/products          ‚Üê Version 2 (Future)


Benefits:
‚úì Clear versioning
‚úì Easy to maintain multiple versions
‚úì Simple for clients to understand
9.2 Version Management
<?php
// routes/api.php


// Version 1 (Current)
Route::prefix('v1')->group(function () {
    Route::get('products', [V1\ProductController::class, 'index']);
    Route::get('products/{slug}', [V1\ProductController::class, 'show']);
    // ... other v1 routes
});


// Version 2 (Future - Breaking changes)
Route::prefix('v2')->group(function () {
    Route::get('products', [V2\ProductController::class, 'index']);
    Route::get('products/{id}', [V2\ProductController::class, 'show']); // Changed from slug to id
    // ... other v2 routes
});
9.3 Version Deprecation Strategy
<?php
// app/Http/Middleware/ApiVersionDeprecation.php


namespace App\Http\Middleware;


use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;


class ApiVersionDeprecation
{
    protected $deprecatedVersions = [
        'v1' => [
            'deprecated_at' => '2026-06-01',
            'sunset_at' => '2026-12-01',
            'message' => 'API v1 is deprecated. Please migrate to v2. v1 will be sunset on 2026-12-01.',
        ],
    ];


    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next)
    {
        $version = $request->segment(2); // Get 'v1' from /api/v1/...


        if (isset($this->deprecatedVersions[$version])) {
            $info = $this->deprecatedVersions[$version];
            
            $response = $next($request);
            
            // Add deprecation headers
            $response->headers->set('X-API-Deprecation-Date', $info['deprecated_at']);
            $response->headers->set('X-API-Sunset-Date', $info['sunset_at']);
            $response->headers->set('X-API-Deprecation-Info', $info['message']);
            $response->headers->set('Link', '</api/v2>; rel="successor-version"');
            
            return $response;
        }


        return $next($request);
    }
}


// Register in Kernel.php and apply to API routes


10. HTTP STATUS CODES
10.1 Standard Status Codes Usage
<?php
// Complete HTTP Status Code Guide


// ===================================
// 2xx SUCCESS
// ===================================


// 200 OK - Successful GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE
return response()->json([
    'success' => true,
    'data' => $data,
], 200);


// 201 Created - Successful POST (resource created)
return response()->json([
    'success' => true,
    'message' => 'Resource created successfully',
    'data' => $resource,
], 201);


// 202 Accepted - Request accepted but processing not complete
return response()->json([
    'success' => true,
    'message' => 'Request accepted for processing',
    'job_id' => $jobId,
], 202);


// 204 No Content - Successful DELETE (no response body)
return response()->json(null, 204);


// ===================================
// 4xx CLIENT ERRORS
// ===================================


// 400 Bad Request - Invalid request format/syntax
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Invalid request format',
], 400);


// 401 Unauthorized - Authentication required
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Authentication required',
], 401);


// 403 Forbidden - Authenticated but insufficient permissions
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'You do not have permission to perform this action',
], 403);


// 404 Not Found - Resource doesn't exist
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Resource not found',
], 404);


// 405 Method Not Allowed - HTTP method not supported
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Method not allowed',
], 405);


// 409 Conflict - Request conflicts with current state
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Resource already exists',
], 409);


// 422 Unprocessable Entity - Validation failed
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Validation failed',
    'errors' => [
        'email' => ['Email is required'],
        'password' => ['Password must be at least 8 characters'],
    ],
], 422);


// 429 Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Too many requests',
], 429);


// ===================================
// 5xx SERVER ERRORS
// ===================================


// 500 Internal Server Error - Generic server error
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Internal server error',
], 500);


// 502 Bad Gateway - Invalid response from upstream server
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Bad gateway',
], 502);


// 503 Service Unavailable - Server temporarily unavailable
return response()->json([
    'success' => false,
    'message' => 'Service temporarily unavailable',
], 503);

## 10.2 Status Code Decision Tree

REQUEST RECEIVED
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îú‚îÄ Authentication Required?
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ No Token/Invalid Token ‚Üí 401 Unauthorized
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ Valid Token
    ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ Has Permission?
    ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ No ‚Üí 403 Forbidden
    ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ Yes ‚Üí Continue
    ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ Resource Exists?
    ‚îÇ           ‚îú‚îÄ No ‚Üí 404 Not Found
    ‚îÇ           ‚îî‚îÄ Yes
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ               ‚îú‚îÄ Valid Request Data?
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ Invalid Format ‚Üí 400 Bad Request
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ Validation Failed ‚Üí 422 Unprocessable Entity
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ Valid
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ Conflict with State?
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ Yes ‚Üí 409 Conflict
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ No
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ Operation Type?
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ GET/PUT/PATCH/DELETE ‚Üí 200 OK
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ POST (Created) ‚Üí 201 Created
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ DELETE (No Content) ‚Üí 204 No Content
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ Server Error? ‚Üí 500 Internal Server Error
11. CORS CONFIGURATION
11.1 CORS Setup
<?php
// config/cors.php


return [
    /*
     | Paths that should handle CORS
     */
    'paths' => ['api/*', 'sanctum/csrf-cookie'],


    /*
     | Allowed HTTP methods
     */
    'allowed_methods' => ['*'], // GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS


    /*
     | Allowed origins (domains that can access API)
     */
    'allowed_origins' => [
        env('FRONTEND_URL', 'http://localhost:3000'),
        'https://platform.com',
        'https://www.platform.com',
        'https://admin.platform.com',
    ],


    /*
     | Wildcard patterns for allowed origins
     */
    'allowed_origins_patterns' => [
        '/^https:\/\/.*\.platform\.com$/', // All subdomains
    ],


    /*
     | Allowed headers
     */
    'allowed_headers' => ['*'],


    /*
     | Headers exposed to browser
     */
    'exposed_headers' => [
        'X-RateLimit-Limit',
        'X-RateLimit-Remaining',
        'X-API-Version',
    ],


    /*
     | Max age for preflight requests (in seconds)
     */
    'max_age' => 86400, // 24 hours


    /*
     | Allow credentials (cookies, authorization headers)
     */
    'supports_credentials' => true,
];
